Le présent crédit permettra à Félix d'entretenir l'étendue cultivée pour ainsi obtenir une bonne production.
texts.en:
The income from the previous loan helped Félix and the other members of the group called Wafanyakazi to fulfill their responsibilities as parents: put their children in school, pay for healthcare and food, expand the cultivated surface, and make small investments.

Thieving birds in the rice fields called for a guardian for the field to prevent their spoilage.

This loan will permit Félix to maintain the cultivated area so as to get a good production.

loans.use: to plow, transplant, buy fertilizer, and buy plant chemicals.

loans.name: Nonglem Group

texts.fr: Mariam est mariée et mère de 2 enfants, Mariam est âgée de 28 ans. Elle vend des céréales au marché dans son quartier et cela fait 10 ans qu'elle exerce cette activité. elle a besoin d'un prêt pour acheter du haricot à 50 000 f pour vendre. Dans le marché, elle a un bon emplacement, avec son expérience de 10 ans les clients sont habitués elle parce qu'elle propose du haricot de qualité à ses clients ce qui fait bien marcher son activité et en plus de cela, elle respect ses clients. Après ses ventes, elle aura un bénéfice qui lui permettra de faire des épargnes et s'occuper de sa famille et aussi e continuer ses activités. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt  une fois et à rembourser  à la date prévue à ACFIME.
texts.en:
Mariam is married and the mother of two children. She is 28 years old. She sells cereals (dried beans and grains) in her area and has been doing this business for 10 years now. She needs a loan to buy dried beans for 50,000 francs to resell.

In the market, Mariam has a well-located place for her sales. With her 10 years of experience, she is able to retain customers. She offers good-quality dried beans to her customers and that makes her business run well. Moreover, she respects her customers.

After her sales, she will have a profit that permits her to put aside savings and take care of her family and to continue her business. She has already received one loan and reimbursed ACFIME on the due date.

loans.use: to buy 50,000 francs worth of dried beans for resale.

loans.name: Mehwish

texts.en:
Mehwish is the age of 29 years, and is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of two children. She is a very hardworking and honest lady. She has to do a lot of hard work to run her household expenses. Her children go to school in morning and tutoring in evening. It is a challenge for her to afford the school and tuition fees, so she has to do a lot of hard work to run the setup of her house.

She owns a small beauty parlor at home, and her husband is doing a small job in a firm. Both are contributing their full income for household expenses. With the passage of time, her beauty products are going to be finished, and at this time, she wants to buy more cosmetics products for her beauty salon.

Mehwish has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan; she will buy cosmetics products, such as facial cream, hair colors, scissors and combs, for her salon. She hopes that through this amount, she will be able to enhance her businesses. Mehwish is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics products, such as facial cream, hair colors, scissors and combs, for her salon.

loans.name: Menuka

texts.en:
Menuka is 45 years old. She is married and has two children who are 23 and 21 years old. Many years ago, she established her business knitting sweaters, socks, etc. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy raw materials. In the future, Menuka plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines. These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her home knitted socks

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona lives in Poblacion Panaon. She is now 67 years old and living with her children because her husband died a year ago.

Ramona helped her children to earn a living by fattening swine. She took good care of the pigs and if one became big, she sold it and gave the money to her children. The money she earned from this business was a great help to the basic needs of her family.

Ramona wanted to earn more in order to repair their house for her family to have a comfortable living condition.

She wanted to begin a nipa hut-making business. She needed a fund to start the said business so she went to GDMPC to ask for help. She applied for a loan that amounted to PHP 5,000. This will be used to buy the materials needed and the rest of the proceeds will be used to buy feed for the piglet.

loans.use: to buy materials for her nipa hut business, and to buy feed for the piglets.

loans.name: Ponciana

texts.en:
Ponciana is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ponciana is 58 years old now.

Ponciana has a food processing business in the Philippines. Ponciana requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients, such as sugar, oil, etc.

Ponciana has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Ponciana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, such as sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is a married woman and 55 years old. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Victoria has a food vending business in the Philippines. Victoria requested a 6,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business such as vegetables, sugar, rice, etc. Victoria has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Victoria would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business such as vegetables, sugar, rice, etc.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia lives in Atsabe, and her business is printer rental. She lives near many people, so she has one idea to open the rental for everybody, so if they want to print a document, it should not be far away. She opened her business a few years ago, but she is earning a good income every day because many people come to print a document in her rental, so she is very happy with her business.

Now she is applying for a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business because she wants to open a larger rental in the future. She started to open her rental in 2013 with her own working capital of $500. She is taking this loan because she wants to buy paper, ink, glue, insulation and other materials to use. She hopes with this loan, her business can be improving in the future.

loans.use: to buy paper, ink, glue, insulation and other materials to use.

loans.name: Hermanita

texts.en:
Hermanita is a 53-year-old married woman with six children, 2 of whom are in school, She works very hard to provide for them.

Hermanita runs a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, such as candies, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

She has been in this business for 20 years, and Hermanita sells a variety of items.

In the future, Hermanita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, such as candies, canned goods, junk food, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Maisha Ni Siri Ya Mungu Group

texts.fr: Le présent crédit sollicité par Sebihendo sera orienté dans le financement de travaux d'exploitation de son activité rizicole. Le précédent a contribué tant soit peu à l'amélioration du bien être familial malgré la présence de rats, chauves-souris et les oiseaux destructeurs des plantes. Les produits phytosanitaires et la garde de champ assuré par ses enfants après l'école ont été d'un grand soutien pour contrecarrer ces obstacles.
texts.en:
This loan requested by Sebihendo will be put toward financing the cultivation of his rice fields. The former loan contributed at least a little to the family's increased well-being, despite the presence of rats, bats, and destructive birds in the fields.

Plant chemicals and his children's work guarding the field after school were a great help in reducing these obstacles.

loans.use: to pay for work to harrow and sow seed in his fields and buy seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Fareeda

texts.en:
Fareeda, aged 35, is a responsible mother of three children and is living happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband owns a scrap shop and deals with scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles, etc. He has been making transactions of scrap goods with the common people and selling it to the recycling factories. Nowadays, due to household expenses, he does not have an amount to buy scrap goods and does not have scrap to sell for getting money.

Therefore, Fareeda requested a loan for her husband so that he could buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents.

Fareeda is very impressed with this honorable support and shows her wish to take more loans after the payment of this loan. Fared gives thanks to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy scrap goods for her husband's scrap business

loans.name: Jose Abraham

texts.es: Don Jose de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la venta de arena y graba desde hace mas de 3 años adicional a eso tambien se dedica al cultivo, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la reparacion y mantenimiento de su camion ya que lo utiliza para llevar los materiales y asi poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Jose, 42, lives in his own home with his wife. He works in the sale of sand and gravel. For more than three years, in addition to this, he has also worked in farming. He is able to settle some of the bills of his house with what he earns from his sales. He is requesting a loan for the repair and maintenance of his truck because he uses it to carry materials and this way he can continue with his work to have a better income.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his truck.

loans.name: Purification

texts.en:
Purification is a married woman from Catigbian, Bohol. She is 64 years old and has four adult children.

A few months ago, she successfully started her sari-sari (variety) store business to earn a living.

Purification wishes to improve this business because it is her main source of income. With this in mnd, she is requesting a fund to help her improve her store. From this loan, she will buy assorted grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, eggs, sugar, coffee, powdered chocolate drink, toiletries, chips, candies, biscuits, and drinks. This will help her to increase her sales and improve her profit.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, eggs, sugar, coffee, powdered chocolate drink, toiletries, chips, candies, biscuits, and drinks.

loans.name: Crescenciana

texts.en:
Crescenciana is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Crescenciana is 61 years old now.

Crescenciana has a bakery business in the Philippines. Crescenciana requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients, such as flour, sugar, etc.

Crescenciana has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Crescenciana would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a raising pigs business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Josephine has been in this business for two years. Josephine earns additional income from vegetable vending.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Julia Nelly

texts.es:
Ella es Julia una incansable mujer de 71 años de edad, que se dedica a las actividades agrícolas, principalmente a la producción de leche, aunque tiene una edad considerable, está mujer se levanta  a primer hora del día a trabajar hasta que se oculta el sol.
Julia solo pide tener salud para seguir ejerciendo su profesión, llevar el alimento diario a su hogar y sostener el estilo de vida que ha tenido durante muchos años, no es millonaria, es una persona humilde que vive feliz y se siente afortunada de lo que tiene ya que fue construido a base de trabajo honesto.
La cliente actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para comprar una vaca, vacunas y alimento complementario, la necesidad nace de un problemática con el precio de venta de leche, el cual está muy desvalorizado, causando estragos financieros a los honorables campesinos que se dedican a esta actividad.
texts.en:
This is Julia. She is an indefatigable woman of 71 years of age, and makes a living in farming. In spite of her considerable age, she mainly works in milk production. Julia wakes up very early and works until sunset.

Julia only wants for good health in order to continue working and bringing home food to eat. She wants to sustain the lifestyle that she has enjoyed for so many years. Julia is not a millionaire; she is poor woman but she is happy and feels fortunate to have what does as it was built with honest work.

Julia is currently applying for a loan in order to buy a cow, vaccines and feed. The need for a loan comes from the very low price of milk. This is wreaking havoc with the finances of ordinary country-folk who work in this trade.

loans.use: to buy a cow, vaccines and feed; she wants to increase daily milk production and to have a greater turnover of animals.

loans.name: Thalia Yanine

texts.es:
Ella es Thalia una joven de 18 años de edad la cual inició un negocio de venta de comidas rápidas, este sueño empezó gracias a su tío quien le enseño como preparar los alimentos y administrar el negocio, la apoyo incondicionalmente, para que consolidara un local y hoy a su temprana edad tiene un negocio y trabaja diariamente con mucho esfuerzo, esmero y entrega con el objetivo de generar buenos ingresos para ayudar a sus padres, estudiar y en un futuro poder comprar una vivienda y dársela a su madre.

La temporada de diciembre esta próxima y Thalia quiere contar con una infraestructura ideal para atender la demanda de fin de año y empezar el año 2016 de la mejor manera.
 
El dinero del préstamo será usado para la compra de una freidora, greca e insumos para vender pasteles, buñuelos, panzarotis, café y jugos.
Espera mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes y posicionar su local.
texts.en:
Thalia, 18, started a business selling fast foods. This dream began thanks to her uncle who taught her how to prepare the foods and administer the business. He supported her unconditionally to consolidate a location, and today, at her young age, Thalia has a business where she works daily with much effort, care and commitment, with the goal of earning good income to help her parents, study, and in the future to buy a home and give it to her mother.

The December season is approaching, and Thalia wants to have in place an ideal infrastructure to meet the year-end demand and to start the year 2016 in the best possible way. 

The loan will be used to buy a deep-fryer, a stovetop coffeemaker, and supplies to sell pastries, fritters, panzarottis [stuffed fritters], coffee and juices. She is looking to improve her sales, increase her clientele, and boost her business.

loans.use: to buy a deep-fryer, stovetop coffeemaker, and supplies to sell pastries, fritters, panzarottis, coffee and juices.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a 45-year-old married woman with one child.

She is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Evangeline has been pig fattening for 10 years, and has borrowed 23 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Evangeline would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 49-year-old married woman with 3 daughters and 2 sons.

In order to care for her children, and to meet household expenses, she started doing embroidery at home, and has been doing it for many years to support her family. A supplier comes to her home and provides her with the raw materials for embroidery, and she and her daughters complete the tasks on a wooden frame.

Samina wants to sells embroidered items directly in the market, so that she can earn more profit for her family. She has become expert in her art, and wants to buy her own raw materials so that she can sell her hand-made embroidery in her hometown. Samina has requested a Kiva loan to buy raw materials and wooden frames, so she can embroider dresses to sell and generate maximum income.

She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through large sales. Samina wishes to utilize a portion of her revenue to provide a quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and wooden frames for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is the age of 48. She is the mother of five children and is living in Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store as well, and some relatives like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with a monotonous tone which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relationships with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town; that is the reason his business is running well.

Due to good relationships, his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Zainab requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, etc. Zainab thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

Zainab hopes that her husband will utilize the loan in a positive way; this amount will help him to cope with the demand.

loans.use: to buy stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, etc., for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 26 years old. She is married and she is a businesswoman. She is applying for a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business.

Magdalena has been involved in business activities since a few years ago; she started with her own working capital. She has a shop of clothes. She is earning a good income from her business because she is selling party dresses and cosmetic bags, which many people like to buy. So, she is still happy to do her business.

She is taking this loan because she wants to buy more clothes such as party dresses and cosmetic bags.

loans.use: to buy party dresses and cosmetic bags.

loans.name: Mallam Sani

texts.en:
Mallam is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Mallam is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. 
Traditionally, Mallam would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Mallam will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for hismaize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. 
With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Mallam now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for hisself and family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Chitsanzo Group

texts.en:
Gladys is 32 years old and single. She has 1 child and 2 relatives that depend on her.

Gladys owns a general store. She has requested this loan to buy wrappers (fabric), slippers and spaghetti to stock up her store. She started her business to be self dependent. She will be able to provide basic needs such as food for her family and pay school fess for her child with the profits from the business.

Gladys currently rents the building where she is working from and hopes to own a building for her business in future. She also hopes to expand her business and sell a variety of items, more than she is selling now.

loans.use: to buy fabric,slippers and spaghetti

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is a 51 year old mother of two who works as a saleswoman in her hometown located in the Chouf mountains of Lebanon.
She has been living alone for several years, since she lost her husband and her sons moved out to start their own family. They both work and support their mother in covering her monthly expenses.

Ghada started working five years ago as a way to occupy herself and generate some income. She sells home products to her regular clients and also works as a nurse, helping the elderly upon request from their families.

She is asking for a 1,029,765 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. She needs the loan to buy a series of house products that her clients have been requesting. She will also be using part of the amount to make some home improvement works to her house. As such, the loan will have a direct impact on Ghada's living conditions by increase her income and improving her house before winter.

loans.use: to buy home products requested by her clients

loans.name: Bartolome

texts.en: Rice farming is the business of Bartolome where he gets income to sustain his family. Bartolome is 56 years old, married and had six children. One of his child is still studying. His wife also sells vegetables for income. Bartolome wanted to continue improving his crop production that is why he is now asking additional capital of P20,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides use in farming. He hopes to improve his crops so it will give him good harvest in return. Additional profits will be kept as revolvng capital for the next planting season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides use in farming

loans.name: Zebo

texts.en: Zebo is an industrious woman. She comes from Tajikistan. Zebo is married and has 3 children. Two of them are adults and one of them is non-adult. Zebo is going to start new business and in this way to get ahead in life. She took part with this aim in the course “To Get Ahead” of women organization and got certificate. She is going to start business with sewing of national mattress “kurpa”. She will offer her service in her house. She is asking for a loan of 1000 Somoni with this aim. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for organizing a new sewing business.

loans.name: Ma. Chona

texts.en:
Ma. Chona has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She has been engaged in buying and selling herbal medicines and food supplements for more than seven years, and she earns well from this. She sustains all her needs through her business while ably helping her family at the same time. She also works hard with the determination of having better income.

To improve sales, Ma. Chona is requesting a new loan of PHP 35,000 to purchase additional merchandise to sell, specifically more bottles of "Life" products and other herbal supplements to expand her product inventory. She sincerely expresses her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Ma. Chona hopes that she and her family will be financially secure. She dreams of growing her business and reaching out to other investors who can help her expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for several bottles of "Life" products (health supplements) to sell.

loans.name: Yoradyl

texts.en:
Yoradyl is 29 years old, married and has a child. She borrowed a loan to buy more goods for her carenderia (small restaurant). She was able to raise her son alone, and was able to cope in the most difficult time in her life. She wants to be successful in her endeavor, save for the future and give the best to her son.

Her plan is to expand her business and help her parents, as well as give good service to people by serving them healthy and palatable food.

loans.use: to buy more goods for her carenderia business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma has been farming for 15 years and she is having a coconut farm. She earns a good income from this business and it help her to provide the needs of her children.. Her previous loan was paid successfully and plans to renew the loan to be used in buying coconut seedlings for she plan to change the old coconut trees into a new one to bear more fruits. Emma’s future plan is to have another line of business like swine fattening in the near future.

loans.use: to buy coconut seedlings

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 24 years old and single.  

Rowena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, chocolates, milk, candies, sanitary pads, fabric conditioners, coffee, etc. to sell.

Rowena has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, chocolates, milk, candies, sanitary pads, fabric conditioners, coffee, etc. 

In the future, Rowena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, chocolates, milk, candies, sanitary pads, fabric conditioners, coffee, etc. to sell

loans.name: Rosy

texts.en:
Rosy is 45 years old and has two children. Rosy is married and has two children who are in school.

Rosy is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Rosy requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Rosy has been in pig fattening for 8 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Maculada

texts.en:
Maculda is 28 years old and She is married and she is now applying for a loan of $ 900.00 to improve her business.  She opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of $ 70.00.  She earns a good income from her business.
 She will use her loan to buy petrol and diesel.She is a very hard working woman and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 5 years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy petrol and diesel.

loans.name: Nachik Group

texts.en: Wang’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Wang and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  Wang and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Wang’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Rafia

texts.en:
RAFIA is a 51-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
She requested a loan for her husband’s green grocery business. Her husband has been selling vegetables for many years. He sells seasonal fresh vegetables in his hometown. He has been using a four wheel manual cart to carry the vegetables from one place to another. Now he has opened a shop for selling vegetables, but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy initial inventories to run his shop in a good manner.
His children are growing and their needs are increasing. To cope with the rapid increase in the school fee, books, utility bills and household expenses, he wants to establish his business but he does not have enough savings to buy initial inventory in the form of fresh and seasonal vegetables in bulk.
Therefore, RAFIA has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy fresh and seasonal vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy initial inventory in the form of fresh and seasonal vegetable in bulk for her husband's green grocery business.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en:
Rustam is a 19-year-old refugee from the Bilasuvar IDP settlement. He is a highly motivated farmer, who's been able to grow his business through effort and dedication. He is taking care of his family, and helps his elderly parents who are retirees. Sometimes his parents help Rustam in the yard with his farming activities.

For the last six years, with the goal of generating more income, he has been doing farming activities, such as growing vegetables and fruits. He is very diligent and honest man. People know Rustam as a trustworthy person. He sells his produce in a local bazaar, and to his clients in the neighborhood. Rustam displays his products in a shop located in the bazaar close to his home.

Rustam is applying for a loan of 1,200 AZN in order to expand his business. With the growing demand for fruits, vegetables, he must expand. He will uses the funds to buy fertilizers and new fruit trees.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and new fruit trees.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en: Mona is a Lebanese married woman. She’s 51 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is still in school.  She is a housewife, focusing on her family and kids, while her husband works in construction. Mona is in a real need of a little help from Kiva. She is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her child’s educational fees for the coming year. She says that she is happy that she can ensure him a suitable education.

loans.use: to pay her child’s educational fees for the coming year.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline works hard to support her family. Evangeline is married and has a fish pond business in the Philippines.

Evangeline requested a loan of 22,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase fingerlings, feed and other supplies for her business.

Evangeline has been in this business for 10 years now.

Evangeline would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fingerlings, feed and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Margarida

texts.en: Margarida lives in Atsabe. She is married and very busy with her business. She is applying for a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop, and she also sells in the market on market day, when many people come to make purchases. Margarida has been in business since 2013. She started with her own working capital of $500. She is earning a good income from selling shoes and slippers, so she is still happy with her business.  She is taking out this loan because she wants to add to her stock of shoes and slippers.

loans.use: to buy shoes and slippers to sell.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Doña Antonia de 61 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus grupo familiar, ella se dedica desde hace 8 años a la elaboración y venta de pupusas su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de chicharrón, quesillo, frijoles, maíz y demás ingredientes y asi poder seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
Doña Antonia, who is 61 years old, lives in her own house with her family group. For eight years she has been making and selling pupusas [thick, filled corn tortillas]. Her business is located near her residence in a zone with a lot of traffic. With what she obtains from her sales, she manages to pay some of the expenses of her household.

She is applying for a loan to purchase fried pork rinds, fresh cheese, beans, corn, and other ingredients and to thus be able to continue with her work, which generates good income for her.

loans.use: to buy fried pork rinds, fresh cheese, beans, corn, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en:
Aziz is 21 years old. He is living in the Bilasuvar region with his family. He has just finished his education. He loves helping his family and wants the family to be successful together. He also supports his aging parents, including visiting them daily, sometimes going for a walk, and taking care of the farm.

Aziz is kind, loving and also a very caring, very hardworking person who loves his job as a farmer involved in daily farming activities. He has some cattle and raises small calves in his own yard. He usually fattens them and sells their meat in the local market. He has been engaged in this activity for the last several years. He has seen his parents running their farm and dedicating themselves to this activity for more than 10 years, and he has gained vast experience.

Most traditional foods in Azerbaijan are prepared with meat. A lot of people like to consume meat. Since he knows that demand is high in the local bazaar, he is also planning to expand his business a little. To meet the demand, he plans to have more calves to fatten and to buy a few more cows. He is planning to expand his farm and build a new milking unit. In order to expand his business, he needs to buy 2 more calves, for 1,200 AZN. He hopes that Kiva lenders will show their support.

loans.use: to buy two more calves for his farm.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, who is in her early thirties is married with two schooling children. She has been running her clothes business for three years now. She works from 7am to 8.30pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Maria's 4th loan from Tujijege Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the clothes stock and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan. She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay her loan, to reinvest in her business and also covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy the best clothes for the Christmas season sales. She dreams of expanding her clothes shop and opening another clothes shop in a different area.

Maria will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the best clothes for Christmas season sales.

loans.name: Souraya

texts.en: Souraya is a 40-year-old Lebanese married mother of four children. Three of her children are still attending school. Her husband is the main income source. He has been working as a farmer for the past 8 years to be able to meet the needs of life and to improve their lifestyle. She is requesting today a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay the school fees for her children. It makes her very happy that she will able to secure a brilliant future.

loans.use: to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.name: Uyel

texts.en:
Uyel is 38 years old and married with five children. Four of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Uyel has a general store business in the Philippines. Uyel requested a loan through NWTF in order to buy additional groceries to sell.

Uyel has been in this business for three years. In the future, Uyel would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mary Ann is 22 years old and has one child currently in school.

Mary Ann has a shell craft business in the Philippines. Mary Ann requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy shells, thread and other materials needed in her business.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy shells, thread, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Concepcion De Maria

texts.es: Doña Concepcion de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella posee desde hace 10 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Concepcion is 56 years old and lives in her own home with her husband. She has owned a small store located in her place of residence for 10 years. She has many customers because of the good prices, and with the profits she makes she is able to settle some of the bills of her home. She is requesting a loan to be able to purchase more soup, eggs, basic grains, beverages, candy, sweet breads, etc. and thus she can have a better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more soup, eggs, basic grains, beverages, candy, sweet breads, etc.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is 57 years old, single, and lives at Solana. She manages a farming business, planting and harvesting rice to sell. She hires laborers to help her in the farming activities. She is now applying for additional capital, of PHP 10,000, to invest in her rice field to sustain her crops. She will buy fertilizers and insecticides. Rosita would like to further develop the business and reap a bountiful harvest. She will save additional revenue for emergency needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides for her rice farm.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 48 years old and married with five children.

Zenaida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Zenaida has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Zenaida aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en: Marianita is 68 years old, married, and has seven children. She works very hard to provide for them. Marianita runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has applied for a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, snack foods, personal care products and other groceries. She has been in this business for four years. Marianita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, snack foods, personal care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Olly &molly Teachers Group

texts.en:
Agnes is a teacher, a local entrepreneur, and a key member of Olly and Molly Teachers' Association.

The association is comprised mainly of members of the school team, who are venturing into other businesses to provide income for their families. After training, a few of the members acquired loans last month. Seeing that those people had increased their businesses and been well paid, others were motivated to join the group, which has expanded to 13 members. Agnes and the other members are grateful for the service, and excited about the advancement they are achieving with the financial boost.

Olly and Molly Teachers' Association has had a positive impact, because UGAFODE has trained the whole team on investment and financial literacy. Moreover, each member has been able accumulate assets in the community.

Recently, Agnes encountered financial challenges due to limited capital. Consequently, the committee was looking for financial aid. Eventually, the association qualified for a loan, and Agnes and the other teachers agreed to apply in order to build their different businesses and acquire the materials they needed.

Agnes will buy a bull using the loan funds. She will raise it, and sell it at a profit during the festive season.

loans.use: to buy a bull.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 48-year-old married woman with four children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Marilyn is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Marilyn has been raising livestock for 3 years, and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly to attain her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es: Marta de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus hijos, ella posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 7 años, tiene mucha clientela por la variedad de productos que comercializa, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la clienta está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas productos como: azúcar, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, etc. por mayor y asi seguir surtiendo su negocio para tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Marta, who is 59 years old, lives in her own house with her children. She has had a store located in her place of residence for seven years. She has many customers because of the variety of products that she sells. With the earnings that she obtains, she manages to pay some of the expenses of her household.

This client is again applying for a loan for the wholesale purchase of more products such as sugar, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candies, etc., to thus continue stocking her business in order to have better economic earnings.

loans.use: to buy more products wholesale, such as sugar, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candies, etc.

loans.name: Maria Eusebia

texts.es: Doña Maria de 66 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija y su nieto, ella se dedica a la crianza de pollos desde hace varios años, y con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda contruyendo una pared que esta hecha de laminas pero con lo que obtiene de sus ventas no le alcanza para realizarlo por esa razon esta solicitando un credito para la compra de materiales de construccion y pago de mano de obra y asi tener una vivienda mas segura.
texts.en: Maria, 66, lives in her own home with her daughter and grandson. She has worked  in the rearing of chicken for several years and with the sales that she makes, she is able to cover some of the bills of her home. She wants to improve her home by building a wall that is made of sheet metal, but with what she earns from her sales, she doesn't have enough to make it. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to purchase construction materials and pay for labor to have a more secure home.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials and pay for labor.

loans.name: Meena

texts.en:
Meena, 48 years old, is married and has one children. Many years ago, she established her grocery shop business. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods. In the future, she plans to uplift her family's economic condition. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods

loans.name: Adolmano

texts.en:
Adolmano is applying for a loan of $600 to improve his business. He is married and he has a kiosk where he just sells tools and oil for motors. He said, "If we want to open a business with our own money, then our efforts will not run properly, because we can't know how to count the money coming in and money going out." So he had one idea to take a loan from Tuba Rai Metin.

He is taking this loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in his kiosk including oil, tires, spark plugs, pads, rubber packing and other things to sell. He started his business in 2014 with working capital. He hopes he can open a big store in the future.

loans.use: To buy oil, tires, spark plugs, pads, rubber packing and other things to sell.

loans.name: Djigbodi

texts.fr: Djigbodi est une femme mariée qui vit avec ses deux enfants à charge. Djigbodi est âgée de 31 ans et vit à Baguida où elle exerce son activité de restauratrice  de la pâte faite à base du maïs. Djigbodi s’approvisionne du nécessaire servant à la préparation deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Djigbodi sollicite ce crédit pour commander le sac de maïs, des cartons de poissons et de poulet afin de bien revendre puis gagner plus de bénéfices et de venir en aide à son mari à bien s’occuper de ses enfants en améliorant leurs conditions de vie quotidiennes et à avoir une bonne éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Djigbodi is a married woman, who lives in Baguida with her two dependent children. She is 31 years old and works making dishes with a dough from corn.

Djigbodi procures her ingredients twice a month from the market, and she resells her goods from the front of her home.

Djigbodi is seeking this loan to order a sac of corn and cartons of fish and chicken. She wants to make good sales and earn more profits, so that she can help her husband take care of their children by improving their everyday living conditions and giving them a good education.

loans.use: to buy one sac of corn, two cartons of fish, and two cartons of chicken.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 22-year-old single woman living in Irbid, which became a crowded city with Syrian refugees.

She is studying to get her bachelor's degree, majoring medical science. Alaa is trying her best to finish her degree and find good work to help her family with their household expenses. Recently she is having difficulty paying her school fees, and decided to apply for an educational loan to help out.

Alaa is very ambitious girl, and wants to work in the medical field, and increase her income.

loans.use: to help her cover her school fees for the semester.

loans.name: Pade Welhoore Group

texts.fr: Assiatou est mariée mère de de 3 enfants et âgée de 37 ans. Elle vend son jus et des brochettes de soja dans le quartier et cela fait 4 ans qu'elle exerce son activité. Elle a besoin d'un prêt pour acheter 2 sacs de soja à 70 000 f, aussi 2 bidons d'huile à 35 000 f, une charette de bois à 35 000 f, des tiges de brochette à 10 000 f et un sac de sucre à 25 000 f pour faire du jus aussi pour vendre. Dans le quartier de Assiatou, son lieu de commerce est à côté d'un collège ce qui fait que la vente de ses brochettes de soja et son jus marche très bien et en plus de cela elle est accueillante respectueuse et très propre. Après ses ventes, elle aura un bénéfice qui lui permettra de faire des épargnes , de s'occuper de sa famille et aussi de continuer ses activités. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt une fois et à rembourser à la bonne date à ACFIME
texts.en:
Assiatou is married and has three children. She is 37 years old. She has been selling juice and skewers of soy in her area for four years.

Assiatou needs this loan to buy two bags of soy at 70,000 francs CFA, two drums of oil at 35,000 francs CFA, a wagon of wood for 35,000 francs CFA, skewers for 10,000 francs CFA, and a sac of sugar for 25,000 francs to make juice, which she also sells.

In Assiatou's area, her business is next to a school where she sells her soy skewers and juice. She does very well. She is also very welcoming and has a clean location.

After her sales, she will have enough profits to save money, take care of her family, and continue her business. She has already received one loan from ACFIME, and she repaid this on time.

loans.use: to buy soy, oil, wood, skewers, and sugar.

loans.name: Tilimbike Group

texts.en:
Treza is 39 years old and married. Her husband works as a tinsmith. She has 7 children and 2 relatives who depend on her.

Treza operates a snack business. She would like to use this loan to buy more flour, sugar etc. for her business. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children. She started her business to be financially self reliant and to provide daily needs such as food for her family.

Her hope is to buy a plot of land where to build a house and also hopes to open a grocery store in a couple years.

loans.use: to buy more flour, sugar etc. for her snack business.

loans.name: Gunel

texts.en:
Gunel is 24 years old, and she is a refugee from Bilasuvar region. She is married and has a family of five people. She has a son and two daughters. Gunel's family is a large family. She is very hard-working in the family.

Gunel is a diligent lady. She is trying to earn enough income by being a farmer who raises cattle and sheep. This way, she takes care of family's needs. She is very energetic and passionate about her job. There are many people in the local market who respect Gunel for her dedication, honesty and right principles over doing business. She is a well-known farmer who does a great job in meeting customers' needs.

She has a small shop where she brings natural meat to sell in the market. In the local market, there aren't many people who can provide the real natural meat. That's why people like buying from Gunel.

Due to growing demand in the market because of peoples' preference for traditional food like kofta and bozbash, which consists of mutton and beef, Gunel is planning to expand. Currently, she needs a 1,900 AZN loan to buy four calves. Hopefully, Kiva lenders will support her.

loans.use: to buy four calves.

loans.name: Doris Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Doris de 61 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de plasticos ( vasos, platos, guacales, canastas recipientes, etc.) desde hace 12 años y vende  de manera ambulante en el mercado municipal, posee muchos clientes y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas productos por mayor para poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Doris is 61 years old and lives in her own house with her husband. She has worked selling plastic products for 12 years. She sells itinerantly in the municipal market. She has a lot of clients and with her profits she manages to pay some of the household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy more plastic products wholesale in order to have greater economic income.

loans.use: to buy plastic products (glasses, plates, pail storage containers, etc.) wholesale.

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr: Agée de 24 ans, Ami est une femme mariée et mère de deux enfants. Pour exercer ses activités, Ami vit à Baguida et vend des casseroles, marmites et assiettes en aluminium en circulant les quartiers environnant pour ainsi gagner son revenu. Ami s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des unités de marmites de bassines en aluminium, Ami demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat et trouver un gain nécessaire pour aider son mari à bien s’occuper de leurs enfants à avoir un bon épanouissement et une bonne éducation.
texts.en:
At 24 years old, Ami is married and the mother of two children. She lives in Baguida. Ami sells aluminum casseroles, pots, and plates by traveling around the surrounding neighborhoods, where she can earn more profits.

Ami procures her stock twice a month from the market. She is seeking this loan to make an order of aluminum pots and basins, so that she can earn enough to help her husband provide their children with a good development and education.

loans.use: to buy six pots and 12 basins.

loans.name: Joanica

texts.en:
Joanica is 49 years old. She is married and she is a businesswoman. She is applying for a loan of $1,500 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop of clothes.

Joanica has been involved in business activities since 2011; she started with her own working capital of $500. She is earning a good income from selling in her business because she is selling in the center of the market, so many people like to buy. She is still happy to do her business.

She is taking this loan because she wants to buy more clothes such as children's clothing, rubber pants, women's shirts and other items.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing, rubber pants, women's shirts and other items.

loans.name: Angèle Mawussi

texts.fr: Veuve et mère de deux enfants, Angèle est une femme âgée de 60 ans résidant à Baguida. Angèle est une marchande  de produits d’alimentations générales qui s’approvisionne de ses marchandises quatre fois par mois au marché et le revend dans sa boutique à domicile. Angèle demande ce prêt pour commander des cartons de détergents en vue de mieux revendre et d’en magasiné un grand nombre de stock puis maximiser son profit afin d’aider à promouvoir l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants et à subvenir aux charges quotidiennes éprouvées par sa famille.
texts.en:
A widow and the mother of two children, Angèle is 60 years old and lives in Baguida. She sells general food products, which she procures four times a month from the market and resells in the shop at her home.

Angèle is seeking this loan to make an order for cartons of detergent, with the hopes of increasing her stock and making better sales. This will help her to provide her children with an education and support her family's everyday needs.

loans.use: to buy five boxes of detergent.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: Don Guadalupe de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica a la albañileria desde hace 20 años y es gracias a ese trabajo como ha podido salir adelante con su familia, el quiere mejorar su vivienda contruyendo un cuarto adicional para sus hijos, pero no posee de suficiente capital por esa razon esta solicitando un credito para la compra de los materiales de construccion necesarios para poder mejorar su casa y asi vivir mas comodos.
texts.en: Guadalupe, 45, lives in his own home with his wife and two children. He has worked in construction for 20 years and thanks to this job, he has been able to help his family get ahead. He wants to improve his home by building an additional room for his children, but he doesn't have the sufficient resources. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to purchase the necessary construction materials to be able to improve his home and live more comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Yasim

texts.en:
Yasim is a 21-year-old refugee from Bilasuvar IDP (Internally Displaced Person) settlement. He is a highly motivated farmer who lost his home in the war and is very optimistic now to put his ideas into making his family's life better.

He is taking care of his family. He helps his old parents, who are retirees. Sometimes, his parents see their son working hard, and they come to support Yasim in the yard for farming activities.

For the last six years, and with the goal of generating more income, he has been doing farming activities like growing vegetables and fruits. He is a very diligent and honest man. People know him as a trustworthy person. He sells the produce in a local bazaar and to the clients in the neighborhood. Yasim displays his products in a shop located in the bazaar close to his home.

He is now applying for 1,200 AZN for expanding his business activity. With the growing demand for fruits and vegetables, he needs to expand as well. He will uses the funds to buy fertilizers and new fruit trees.

loans.use: to buy new seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Las Flores Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS FLORES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Liliana ,la socia continua con su negocio de venta de ropa, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que espera mediante su negocio obtener más ganancias para de esta forma continuar apoyando a su familia, la socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido, la socia continua vendiendo  pantalones, blusas y polos, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma continuar apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar casacas entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de restaurant, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.

Los socios en general agradecen el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
El socio que sale adjunto en la foto pidio permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
The members of this group are part of the community bank called “LAS FLORES”; the bank is located in Cusco district, in the province and region of the same name.

One of the members is Liliana,an entrepreneurial woman who has a business selling clothing. She hopes that her business will increase her income so that she can continue to provide for her family. Liliana is thankful for everyone who plays a part in this dream by providing her loan and promises to make payments on time. She sells trousers, blouses and t-shirts, and wants to keep working like this to be able to provide for her family. She has applied for a loan to buy jackets and other items.

The other group members make a living from a restaurant business, selling clothing, running a convenience store, and selling food. The members of the group are thankful for the loan that has been disbursed and promise to make payments on time. The member whose photo has been added to the picture asked for permission to be late for the meeting due to work commitments.

loans.use: to buy jackets and other items.

loans.name: Inobat

texts.en:
Inobat is a 48-year-old married woman with 3 children. Her husband is a farmer.

12 years ago, Inobat started her own business dealing with buying and selling dried fruits, because she needed additional income. She has grown her business, and knows all aspects of it well.

Inobat must periodically increase her working capital, so she is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni to buy dried fruits.

loans.use: to buy dried fruits in order to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo, tiene 32 años de edad, es acompañado vive con su familia, aún no tiene hijos, se dedica a trabajar en el campo, cultivando específicamente maíz, inicio su negocio con capital propio, ya tiene 13 años de trabar de siete de la mañana a una de la tarde, de lunes a sábado.
Con el financiamiento podrá comprar semilla mejorada de maíz para sembrar en el tiempo justo y aprovechar la lluvia para tener una buena cosecha, espera obtener nuevos ingresos con los que podrá cancelar con puntualidad las cuotas de su crédito.
Su visión es finalizar su crédito con buena calificación crediticia y ganar popularidad con su negocio.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is 32 years old. He is married and lives with his family. He still has no children. He works in the fields, specifically, raising corn. He began his business with his own capital. He already has 13 years of experience in working from 7 in the morning to 1 in the afternoon, from Monday to Saturday.

With the financing he will be able to buy improved seed to plant at the right time and take advantage of the rain in order to have a good harvest. He hopes to obtain new income with which he will be able to make the payments on his loan punctually.

His vision is to conclude his loan with a good credit rating and have his business become more popular.

loans.use: to buy improved corn seed to plant at the right time and take advantage of the rain in order to have a good harvest.

loans.name: Saeeda

texts.en:
Saeeda's husband, shown in the photo with her, has been doing a business selling animals. His business has provided them with a decent life. He works hard to provide his children with good food and education.

For the improvement of her husband's business, Saeeda has requested a loan of 20,000 PKR. Her husband intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

Saeeda is positive about her husband's future earnings.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Maria Olinda

texts.es:
María, es madre de 3 hijos, pero todos formaron su propia familia, ella estudio hasta sexto grado por que sus padres eran de escasos recursos y no podían darle la educación que ella necesitaba, es madre soltera y actualmente solo un nieto depende de ella. 

María, se dedica a la venta de comida típica, como pasteles, enchiladas, panes rellenos y fresco, el lugar donde vende estos productos está ubicada en su vivienda y regularmente vende por las tardes y siempre se ha dedicado a esta actividad, el negocio lo aprendió de su madre quien siempre le enseño a ser una persona trabajadora. 

María, usara el crédito para comprar mayonesa, tomates, papas, platos, etc. y también quiere hacer un muro para proteger su negocio de la lluvia y con ello espera que sus ventas mejoren.

María, sueña con tener un mejor negocio y construir su casa, todo esto lo lograra con las ganancias que le genere el crédito que se le aprobara, ya que podrá realizar sus sueños y dar mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
María has three children who all live with their own family now.
She could not go beyond the sixth form because of her parents' dire financial situation.
She is a single mother and cares for one of her grandchildren.
María sells traditional food such as pies, enchiladas, stuffed bread, and cream cheese.
She sells all this at her house, mostly in the afternoons.
She has always been in this trade, which she learned from her mother, along with the value of hard work.
María will use the loan to buy mayonnaise, tomatoes, potatoes, plates, etc. and to build a wall to protect her stall from the rain.
She hope this will result in increased sales.
María's dream is to improve her business and to build a house of her own, and she plans on doing so thanks to the profits this loan will help her generate.
Her dreams will thus come true and she will be able to increase her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare the food she sells and to build a wall to protect her stall from the elements.

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Micheal is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Micheal is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Micheal would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Micheal will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season, when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Micheal now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and his family members, and would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yalcin

texts.en:
Yalcin is 20 years old. He is living in Bilasuvar region with his family. He has just finished his education. He loves helping his family and wants to be successful together and he also supports his old parents by visiting them daily, sometimes going for a walk, and taking care of the farm. Yalcin is a kind, loving and also very caring, very hard-working person and he loves his job as a farmer.

He is a farmer and involved in daily farming activities. He has some cattle and raises small calves in his own yard. He usually fattens them and sells their meat in the local market. This activity he has been doing for the last several years, but he has seen his parents running the farm and dedicating themselves to this activity for more than 10 years and he gained vast experience.

People in Azerbaijan prepare traditional foods mostly with meat. A lot of people like to consume meat. Since he knows that the existing demand is high in the local bazaar, he is also planning to expand the business a little. To meet the demand he plans to have calves fatter and buy few more cows.

Currently he is planning to expand the farm and build a new milking unit. In order to expand his farming business, he requires to buy two more calves. For this he needs 1,200 AZN. He hopes that Kiva lenders will show their support.

loans.use: to buy two more calves.

loans.name: Icela Guadalupe

texts.es:
Icela, de 21 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, lamentablemente no pudo seguir con sus estudios porque se dedicó a trabajar debido a la pobreza extrema en la que vivía; está casada y vive solo con su esposo, pero está a la espera de su primogénito, su esposo trabaja como vendedor de agua y bebidas gaseosas. 

Icela, junto a su esposo vende pan dulce y bebidas como agua y jugos, ellos poseen este negocio desde hace poco más de un año, pero aparte de eso también trabaja en una tienda en el centro de la ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días en un carro que posee su esposo en donde salen a las comunidades cercanas a vender el producto.
 
Icela, necesita el préstamo para comprar más pan y bebidas para la venta, esto le ayudara para mejorar su inventario y tener más ingresos.   

El sueño más grande de Icela, es poner una tienda, también sueña con conocer a su primogénito.
texts.en:
Icela, 21, could not go beyond the ninth form because she had to start working at a very young age, since she was living in extreme poverty.
She is married and the couple lives alone, with a baby on the way.
Her husband sells water and fizzy drinks.
Icela has been selling sweet rolls and drinks (water and juice) for the past year or so; she also works as an employee in a shop in the city centre.
She shares a lorry with her husband, which they use to tour the villages in the region to sell their wares.
Icela needs the loan to buy more merchandise to sell in order to increase her stock and earn more money.
Icela's greatest dream is to have a shop of her own one day; in the meantime, she eagerly awaits the baby's arrival.

loans.use: to buy more sweet rolls and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Gul Bano

texts.en:
It was hard for Gul Bano to manage her household expenses with the small income of her husband. She is a 36-year-old, married woman; shown in the photo with her brother-in-law. She is a mother of six children.

Some years ago she started her business of selling animals in her community. Now, she has requested a Murabaha loan of 35,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

She has gained great confidence in the business as she has learned how to deal with other individuals within the business, allowing her to feel empowered.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Aysel

texts.en:
Aysel is a 21-year-old IDP from the Bilasuvar region. She is single and lives with her parents in the refugee settlement. She grows some vegetables and fruits in the yard of her family. She loves this job.

Aysel has support from her family, especially from the dad who is running quite a successful farming business. Her dad is a teacher at school but helps her with great passion. She has more than five years of experience.

For managing the farm, she relies as well on the support of her siblings, who help her with watering, cleaning the yard, and other related works. They support each other very well. Aysel is running the farm with great passion and love, because she wants to take care of her old parents, and also for marriage.

Aysel sells natural fruits and vegetables in the local market. In Azerbaijan there is a great demand for vegetables to make traditional foods like dolma and bozbash, and also for fruits for after-dinner desserts.

She is currently planning to expand the business. She requires 1,900 AZN to buy new fruit trees, vegetable seed, and fertilizers for the fruit and vegetables. She hopes that Kiva lenders will support her.

loans.use: to buy new fruit trees, vegetable seed, and fertilizers for the fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Gs Palo Verde Group

texts.es:
Aquileo es una persona que se dedica a la caficultura desde hace 25 años, en la actualidad cuenta con 3 Manzanas de café variedad lempira, según  el último año Aquileo reporto 95 quintales en oro, este café es vendido en la zona.
Don Aquileo solicita el préstamo para la compra de un sistema de planta solar de 65 watts ya que no cuenta con luz por las noches en su hogar y cree que el día puede ser mas productivo ya que cuando se va la luz del sol todas las actividades se detienen y no pueden seguir realizando actividades de trabajo o compartir con su familia noches de convivencia.
Don Aquileo está solicitando el crédito de forma grupal con las siguientes personas: Tomas, se dedica a la caficultura desde hace 20 años, José Manuel se dedica a la caficultura desde hace 15 años,    todos ellos solicitan el apoyo porque no cuentan con el capital suficiente para comprar el sistema de energía y para cambiar la vida de sus familias.

Honduras - Octubre 2015
texts.en:
Aquileo has been in the coffee growing business for 25 years. He has three plots of Lempira coffee which, according to Aquielo, provided 95,000 lbs of coffee last year. The crop is sold in his area.

Mr. Aquileo is requesting this loan for the purchase of a 65 watt solar panel system. Currently he has no light or electricity at night and believes that he could be more productive. When the sun goes down he must stop all of his activities and can't continue to work or enjoy time with his family at his convenience.

Mr. Aquileo is requesting this loan as a part of a group with the following people: 

Tomas, who has been a coffee grower for 20 years.

José Manuel, who has been a coffee grower for 15 years.

They are all asking for support because they can't come up with the investment capital to buy the energy system to change the life of their families.


Honduras - October 2015

loans.use: to buy a 65 watt solar panel for his home.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Limatambo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SANTA ROSA DE LIMATAMBO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Limatambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Doris es una mujer  emprendedora y trabajadora que se dedica a su tienda de abarrotes desde hace ya muchos años, ella tiene 44 años y tres hijos por quienes velar, su deseo es ampliar su negocio de abarrotes por fin de año.
La socia solicito el crédito para comprar azúcar, leche, cereales y gaseosas; estos productos  son indispensables en su negocio.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de agricultura, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de internet,  negocio de venta de animales y negocio de venta de comida.
Los socios que están adjuntos en la fotografía grupal llegaron tarde por motivos de trabajo y se les tomo la imagen  después de la reunión.
Los socios están contentos por el crédito otorgado por los inversionistas de KIVA, y se comprometen a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
This group of borrowers is called Santa Rosa de Limatambo and is based in Limatambo district, Anta province, Cusco region.
Doris is a hard-working woman entrepreneur who has had a grocery shop for ages.
She is 44 and has three children to take care of.
Her goal is to restock in preparation for the end-of-year festivities.
She thus asks for a loan to buy sugar, milk, cereals, and fizzy drinks, all staples of her business.
The other members of the group are farmers, sell clothes, manage an internet café, sell animals or sell food.
The two members not in the group photo were late to the meeting for work-related reasons and thus had to have their picture taken separately.
The group is very grateful to Kiva lenders and promises to be punctual in its repayments.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, cereals, and fizzy drinks.

loans.name: Rabiu

texts.en:
Rabiu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Rabiu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Rabiu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Rabiu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Rabiu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Rabiu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Mario Ernesto

texts.es:
Mario, tiene como fuente de ingresos una granja de pollos de engorde, cuando los pollos tienen la edad de 6 semanas ya están listos para ser comercializados, el oficio lo aprendió mediante preparación académica, pues estudio agronomía, es por esa razón que no representa dificultades en su negocio, tiene una familia que se integra por su esposa y dos hijos, él trabaja muy duro para suplir las necesidades que existen en su hogar.
Necesita de capital para fortalecer su negocio de manera inmediata, lo invertirá en concentrado para alimentar a los pollos y en la construcción de una fosa para depositar los desechos de la granja, le permitiré tener un lugar más higiénico tanto para él como para los animales, pretende tener mayores ventas para ir subsistiendo con su familia.
 Sus aspiraciones son seguir trabajando para que su negocio sea uno de los más competitivos en la zona y poderles dar a sus hijos un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Mario has a chicken farm.
He fattens the chickens until they are 6 weeks old, at which point they are ready to be sold at the market.
He learned the trade at university, where he studied agricultural science. His business is thus going well.
Mario lives with his wife and their two children and works very hard to provide for them.
He needs working capital to strengthen his business right now.
He will use the loan to buy chicken feed and to dig a trench for farm waste disposal.
In this way, the farm will be a more healthy environment for him as well as for the animals.
He hopes to increase sales to keep supporting his family.
Mario aims at keeping the farm going and seeing it become the most productive in the region so as to build a better future for his children.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and to build a farm waste disposal system.

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en:
Safaa is a 33-year-old married mother of three. Almost a year ago, she started selling cosmetics from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She is a hard worker and ambitious lady who is trying hard to develop her business and become well-known among her region to attract more customers.

Today, Safaa is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase and diversify her merchandise a with new collection of winter cosmetics to satisfy her customers' needs in the upcoming Christmas season.

Safaa hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and stay capable of providing her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to increase and diversify her merchandise with a new collection of winter cosmetics to satisfy her customers' needs

loans.name: Salasala Group

texts.en:
Peter, who in his early 50's, is married with four schooling children. He has been running a retail shop for twenty years now. He works from 6.30 am to 09 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Peter's sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase the shop stock inventory and has been able to pay back all his loans successfully.

He is doing great with his loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. He used the profit to pay school fees, to repay the loan, to buy a plot of land, to reinvest in business, and to cover household expenses.

He will use this loan to increase the retail shop inventory and meet his customers' demand. He dreams of opening another shop in a different area.

Peter will share this loan with his loan group, Salasala, which has seven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the retail shop inventory and meet his customers' demands.

loans.name: Jose Ferman

texts.es: Jose de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas y su nieta, el se dedica a realizar viajes en su pick up desde hace mas de un año, tiene muchos clientes que lo prefieren por la responsabilidad que tiene a la hora de manejar, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de llantas y darle mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y poder tener mejor calidad de vida.
