texts.en:
José, 36, lives in a house of his own with his two daughters and his granddaughter.
He has been working in transportation for over a year in his pick-up truck.
He has many customers, who choose him because they know him to be a responsible driver.
Thanks to his work, he is able to support his family.
He asks for a loan to buy tires and to perform maintenance on his vehicle, which is his only source of income.
He aims at improving his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy tires and perform maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Silvia Maritza

texts.es: Silvia, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada, tiene 3 hijos, reside en el municipio de Yoro. En busca de obtener sus propios ingresos hace 4 años que estableció su propio negocio de venta de pan casero y tamales.  Esta actividad la realiza en su casa y los productos los vende a sus alrededores. El préstamo que ha solicitado es el tercer ciclo en la institución y es por 12,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar materia prima como harina, manteca, huevos, azúcar, leña, y otros insumos  para elaborar pan y tamales. Con esta inversión va poder aumentar la producción y venta. Su sueño es seguir trabajando para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Silvia, 38, is married and has 3 children.  She lives in the municipality of Yoro.  Seeking a way to earn her own income, she started her own business 4 years ago making homemade bread and tamales.  She does this work in her home, and she sells her products in the surrounding areas.  Silvia has applied for her 3rd loan with the institution.  She is requesting 12,000 Honduran lempiras to buy supplies such as flour, butter, eggs, sugar, firewood, and other items to make bread and tamales.  With this investment, she will increase her production and sales.  Silvia's dream is to continue to work so that she can provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make bread and tamales

loans.name: Dallami

texts.en:
Dallami is a maize farmer from Maiyashi village. As a Babban Gona member, Dallami is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Dallami would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Dallami can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Dallami no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Dallami hopes to realize better yields. He plans on using his additional income to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Silva

texts.en:
Silva is 54, living in Aygut village. She works at the local village school. Because of high unemployment rate in the region, Silva's husband had to go to neighbouring country for a migrant work, to sustain his family.

Silva now has to take care of the farming business alone, because her two sons, with their families also work and live in different cities. She keeps a livestock of cows, calves, bees, and pigs and also cultivates wheat, potato, walnut, pear, plum and apple.

Because it is very difficult for woman alone to sustain such a big farm, her neighbors help her with gathering the harvest and cultivation works in exchange of various food products from the farm.
Silva asks this loan to purchase 2 oxen to enlarge her herd. She hopes for lenders faith and trust to develop her farming business and gather income for family.

loans.use: to pay for 2 oxen to enlarge her livestock herd.

loans.name: Jose Neftali

texts.es:
José es un agricultor que se dedica principalmente a cultivar granos básicos y a la crianza de cerdos, el oficio lo aprendió gracias a sus padres y hoy en día es su fuente de ingresos, él también desarrolla las actividades de albañilería y carpintería para tener ingresos extras, su negocio lo atiende solo, en su comunidad es reconocido por ser responsable y trabajador. José vive con su compañera de vida, juntos cuidan de un hijo que tiene un año de edad, él procura que su familia tenga una vida mejor cada día.
Al solicitar un crédito tendrá los recursos necesario para poder comprar dos cerdos para engordarlos y después venderlos, otra parte le servirá para adquirir abono con el que cuidara mejor de sus cultivos de granos básicos, fortalecerá su negocio con la finalidad de tener más ingresos para que en su hogar las carencias sean menos.
José tiene como objetivo sacar el mejor provecho de la inversión para ir mejorando las cosechas y así estabilizarse económicamente.
texts.en:
José is a farmer who mainly works growing basic grains and raising pigs. He learned these activities from his parents and today they are his sources of income. He also carries out bricklaying and carpentry work to have extra income. He takes care of his business alone and he is seen in his community as being responsible and hard-working.

José lives with life companion and together they care for their one year old son. He tries to provide his family a better life each day.

Requesting the loan he will have the resources needed to be able to buy two pigs to fatten and later sell. The other part will serve him to buy manure to improve the care of his basic grain crops and strengthen his business with the goal of having more income for his house so they lack less.

José's goal is to make the most of this investment to improve his crops and stabilize economically.

loans.use: to buy two pigs to fatten and then sell and the other part will be used to buy manure to care for his basic grain crops.

loans.name: Namarhkeuayai Group

texts.en: Bounmee is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  Bounmee and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter Bounmee and his group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Bounmee and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Bounmee and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor is a 20-year-old single lady; she is in her third year at university, majoring in physics. Noor is from a big educated family, and her father is retired from his work.

She likes what she is studying and wants to work as a teacher to deliver her message and make a change. She applied for a loan because her father could not cover her education fees, and she will use this loan to pay her university fees and to buy what she needs for books and supplies for her education.

loans.use: to pay her university fees and to buy what she needs for books and supplies for her education.

loans.name: Elmidar

texts.en:
Elmidar is 18 years old. He is a very effort-giving and passionate person. Elmidar is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Bilasuvar refugee settlement built after the war that took place decades ago. He is living with his large family and also helps his old parents. He has a brothers and sister.

At this young age, he just finished his studies and he knows that he has great responsibilities in both earning income and supporting his family, because his parents are both not eligible for work. He is a farmer, and people in his neighborhood call him an honest young farmer. He is very energetic and knows that success requires dedication.

Elmidar likes to provide more natural products to people. Being a refugee and from the region where people are more familiar with farming, gives him more advantage in the local market. He is more familiar with local area people and knows the peoples' needs and demands.

Elmidar is growing wheat. In Azerbaijan people consume a lot of wheat, with which rural area people bake their own bread and make pastries and cakes at home. Elmidar has an advantage, because people trust him. Currently he is planning to buy more fertilizers. To do so, he needs 1,200 AZN, and he hopes that Kiva lenders will support him.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers

loans.name: Liên

texts.en:
Mrs Liên is 27 years old and she is married. She has had a manufacturing business making wood furniture for 5 years. Liên lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.
Her family has no latrine.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a toilet . She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build toilet.

This is Liên first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Liên hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Rosa Candida

texts.es:
Rosa, de 40 años de edad, está acompañada, tiene tres hijos que están estudiando y su pareja es agricultor. 

Rosa, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a la crianza de especies menores, este fue el oficio que aprendió desde que estaba muy pequeña, su pareja a través de la agricultura ayuda para cubrir las necesidades de su familia.

Rosa, necesita el préstamo para comprar cerdos, construir un corral y comprar concentrado para engordarlos y luego venderlos, porque esta será otra fuente de ingresos para ellos. 

Rosa, sueña con apoyar a sus hijos, para que se preparen academicamente y tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is 40 years old and married. She has three children who are studying and her husband is a farmer.

Rosa works in the home and raises small animals. This is the profession that she learned from when she was very little. Her husband, through farming, helps to cover the needs of the family.

Rosa needs the loan to buy pigs, build a corral, and buy feed to fatten and later sell them, because this will be another source of income for them.

Rosa dreams of supporting her children so they prepare themselves academically and have better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy pigs, build a corral, and buy feed to fatten and later sell them.

loans.name: Dorris

texts.en:
Dorris is 42 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Dorris works very hard to provide for them.

Dorris runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, school supplies, and other groceries.

Dorris has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Dorris would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, school supplies, and other groceries

loans.name: Aliia

texts.en:
Aliia is 19-years-old freshman in the Sociology Program at AUCA. She is applying for a Kiva loan to pay for her Bachelor's degree.

Aliia is certain that if she doesn’t complete her university degree, she won’t have ever opportunity to achieve her career goals. She wants to attain a career as a sociologist since her passion has always been assisting others and trying to improve the quality of their life.

Aliia has two dreams for the future, the first is to become a certified sociologist in order to make her own business of social aid for people, who need any kind of aid. Furthermore, she wants to contribute to the under-served people in Central Asia who struggle every day to sustain a family, and who don’t have as much access to social assistance as other privileged groups. For that Aliia wants to establish a free clinic where affordable medical assistance can be provided regardless of the patient’s immigration status. The diverse health services will include free doctor consultations, low-price or free medications.

The second dream is to establish a non-profit organization where she can create internships and scholarships for students in Central Asia and allow them to travel to isolated communities around the world to provide free humanitarian aid and just to teach how to apply to people around the world. This will help contribute to the physical development of kids, make our future generations be kind to each other and help each other.

Aliia hopes to get Kiva loan, otherwise she knows that her goals will remain as a dreams without a good knowledge and diploma.

loans.use: to pay for her higher education and a degree in Sociology from AUCA.

loans.name: Amneh

texts.en:
Greetings from Palestine. Amneh is 28 years old, married with three children, one of them currently attending school. She lives in Al-Zbabdeh neighborhood in Jenin city.

Amneh has a small stockade in front of her house and needs the loan to buy sheep in order to raise them and after that sell them and make some profits. The business faces two main challenges. The first one is the changeable weather and hence the illness of the livestock and the other challenge is the seasonality of the livestock trade.

For the future, Amneh hopes to expand her project by increasing the number of the livestock.
Amneh thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy sheep to add to her stockade

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a 33-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan with her family. Her husband wants to establish a small general store at the corner of his house. He has a spare shop for many years and wants to establish this shop into a general store. However, due to lack of availability of funds he is unable to buy initial stocks of inventories. 
Maryam has requested a loan for her husband’s newly established general store. Now, he can easily buy stocks of rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits. She is expecting boost in the earnings and dreams of expanding the business further in the future. Maryam is very thankful to kiva field partner's BRAC

loans.use: to buy initial stock such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits etc for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Faiq

texts.en:
Faiq is 27 years old and he is refugee from Bilasuvar region. He is married and has 1 son and 1 daughter. Faiq's family is large, because he also support his old parents and younger siblings. He is very hard-working person in the family.

Faiq is a diligent person. He is trying to earn enough income by being a farmer who raises cattle and sheep. This way he takes care of family's needs. There are many people in the local market who respect Faiq for his dedication, honesty and right principles over doing business. He is a well known farmer who does great job in meeting customers' needs.

He has a small shop where he brings natural meat to sell in the market. In the local market there aren't many people who can provide the real natural meat. That's why people like buying from Faiq. Due to growing demand in the market because of peoples' preference to traditional food like kufta, bozbash which consist of mutton, beef, Faiq is planning to expand. Currently he needs 1200 AZN loan to buy 3 calves. Hopefully Kiva lenders will support him.

loans.use: to buy 3 calves

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
Firuza is a careful mother of her son. She works as a hired worker in a sewing fabric business. Now, she plans to start own business deal. With this aim she took part in a course “To Get Ahead” of women organization and she got certificate.

Firuza plans to open own sewing workshop and service there her clients. Firuza is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni to buy a sewing machine and fabrics for organizing her new business. She awaits your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabrics for organizing a new business.

loans.name: Arely Del Carmen

texts.es:
Arely requiere de otro financiamiento para comprar verduras, aceite, condimentos, gas propano, etc., para elaborar una amplia variedad de comida que le permita vender más en la temporada navideña, ella tiene la esperanza que sus clientes le encargaran mayor cantidad de comida y así obtendrá mayores ingresos para cancelar la nueva deuda.
Al utilizar el crédito anterior ha podido equipar mejor la venta de comida, manifiesta que hoy mantiene los alimentos calientes por largo tiempo con lo que atiende mejor a sus clientes, su familia se mantiene y su nivel económico no ha cambiado mucho, pero aun así conserva el optimismo de seguir trabajando para superarse.
texts.en:
Arely needs another loan to buy vegetables, cooking oil, condiments, propane gas, etc., to make an ample variety of food so that she can sell more during the Christmas season.  She hopes that her customers will make a greater number of food orders so that she will be able to have more income and pay off this new debt.

With her previous loan, she was able to better equip her food business.  She states that today she keeps her food hot for a long time, which allows her to better serve her customers.  She is supporting her family, whose finances have not changed much, but she is still optimistic that she can continue to work and improve their situation.

loans.use: to buy food for her business

loans.name: Paula Estela

texts.es:
Paula, tiene como negocio la crianza de aves de corral, vive con su pareja y dos hijos que tienen las edades de 4 y 3 años, la Sra. Paula aporta el dinero para cubrir los gastos familiares, su compañero de vida es no vidente,  ella tiene su negocio propio desde hace dos años, lo atiende sola bajo un horario de siete de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, sus padres le enseñaron el oficio hace mucho tiempo.
Solicita un crédito para continuar trabajando y cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, comprara pollos y concentrado para alimentarlos, aumentara su inventario para atender las demandas de sus clientes y seguir cumpliendo con las responsabilidades que como jefa de su hogar tiene.
Sus sueños son trabajar día con día para ampliar su negocio y darles a sus hijos un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Paula has a business raising poultry. She lives with her partner and two children who are 3 and 4 years old. Paula contributes the money to cover the household expenses. Her partner is blind. She has had her business for two years and she cares for it herself with a timetable from 7 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon. Her parents taught her the trade a long time ago.

She is requesting a loan to continue working and covering the basic needs of her family. She will buy chickens and concentrated feed to feed them, increasing her inventory to look after the demand from her customers. She will continue fulfilling the responsibilities a head of family has.

Her dream is to continue her work day by day to expand her business and provide her children with a better future.

loans.use: to buy chickens and concentrated feed  for them, increase her inventory to serve the demand from her customers.

loans.name: Rawan

texts.en:
Rawan is a 22-year-old married lady. She is the mother of one boy. Rawan still attends the university as a student majoring in Rehabilitation Sciences and is doing good in balancing her education life and her motherhood life.

Her husband, on the other hand, works in a car agency, and is doing his best to add more income sources to the family from side jobs.

Rawan is now requesting a loan in order to help her pay for her upcoming semester fees to pass the year and start looking for jobs in the field of her studies.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees to pass the year and start looking for jobs in the field of her studies.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is married woman, shown in the photo with her husband. He has been doing business by selling fruits for many years. He has a good client list and earns a reasonable amount of money to support his family. They have three children.

To improve her husband's business, Salma has contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase sacks of apples, mangoes and guavas to meet market demands consistently.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of apples, mangoes and guavas to meet market demands consistently

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 42-year-old married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband, who is a driver by profession. He drives a tractor in the main city and makes enough income to cover all the expenses of his family.

Samina has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 35,000 PKR for her husband; he wants to purchase new tires along with spare parts. Samina is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to purchase new tires along with spare parts

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is a 26-year-old married Egyptian Albanian man and father of a four-year-old child and a six-month-old baby. Since he turned 21, he has been buying and selling clothing. He buys the clothing from Macedonia and sells it for a profit in three cities: Tirana, Fier and Elbasan.

He now wants to buy more such items; in particular, winter jackets and jeans. The annual gross income from this activity adds up to $30,326, while the expenses are $22,745; thus, the annual net earnings are approximately $7,500. This is the only source of income for the family.

"The money is not enough for our family; however, in a poor country like Albania, with very high unemployment and no such opportunities, I consider myself blessed to even be able to do what I do," said Denis to the loan officer.

Denis wants this loan to stock up on clothing to sell.

loans.use: to stock up on clothing to sell.

loans.name: Gs Los Molina Group

texts.es:
El Señor Rony tiene 22 años de edad, es padre de un hijo, convive con su compañera de hogar, habita en la Aldea de Altos de Maquengalito, Su actividad principal es la Agricultura cultiva maiz y frijoles, donde cuenta con mucha experiencia en el manejo de esta actividad  el cuenta con cultivo de maiz y la produccion ya esta lista para sacar el grano de maiz, y el tambien cuenta con café y es una plantacion nueva que para este año le dara exelente produccion de café.
Rony  con el credito que esta solicitando podra fertilizar su finca y esto le ayudara a que le generen mayores ingresos en el hogar, y con esto podra cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros que actualmente desea contraer.
Rony su sueño es mejorar las condiciones de el y de su familia y esta solicitando el apoyo financiero a Microfinanciera Prisma de Honduras y KIVA. Los demas integrantes se dedican a la Agricultura lo integran Marlon y River todos los miembros de este grupo son hermanos y ellos quieren salir adelante con sus familias es por eso que tienen una buena relacion y se han unido en grupo para que la union haga la fuerza.



                                                             Trojes, Honduras Octubre 2015
texts.en:
Rony, 22, is the father of a son, and lives with his partner in the village of Altos de Maquengalito. His main business is farming. He grows corn and beans, and he has a great deal of experience in the management of this activity. He has a corn crop, and the production is already ready for grain extraction. He also has coffee growing on a new plantation, which will yield an excellent production of corn this year.

Rony is requesting this loan to be able to fertilize his plantation, and this will help him generate greater household income, and thus be able to cover the family expenses and financial commitments that he currently wishes to take on.

Rony dreams of improving living conditions for himself and his family, and he is requesting the support of Microfinanciera Prisma de Honduras and Kiva. The other members of this group, Marlon and River, are engaged in farming, and they are all brothers. They wish to get their families ahead and, for this reason, they have a good relationship, and they have united as a group to create strength.





Trojes, Honduras October 2015

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for their land.

loans.name: Maria Lucila

texts.es: Maria de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de pescado desde hace 8 años con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, anteriormente solicito un credito para compra de mercaderia, en esta ocasion ella quiere mejorar su vivienda encementando el piso pero como no posee suficiente capital esta solicitando INTEGRAL para la compra de materiales de construccion y asi poder tener una  mejor vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria is 32 years old and she lives in her own house with her husband. She has worked selling fish for 8 years and with what she obtains from her sales she manages to pay some of the expenses of her household.

She requested her previous loan to buy merchandise. This time she wants to improve her house cementing the floor but as she doesn't have sufficient capital she is requesting a loan from FUSAI. She will buy construction materials to be able to have a better house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 48 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Leonida is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Leonida has been raising livestock for two years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Reyna está satisfecha por los buenos resultados que ha tenido al utilizar créditos para que su negocio mejore, por tal razón se decidió a solicitar un nuevo crédito para comprar hilos de seda y nylon en diferentes colores, guardacabos y agujas para elaborar hamacas, espera así cubrir las demandas que le han hecho sus clientes y seguir teniendo su fuente de ingresos.
Reina expresa que su negocio después de haber invertido el crédito anterior, en materiales básicos para la producción de sus productos ha mejorado, brinda mayor calidad y variedad a sus clientes,  la familia se mantiene y conservan un buen estado de salud.
texts.en:
Reyna is satisfied with the good results she has had using loans to improve her business. For that reason, she decided to request a new loan to buy silk and nylon thread in different colors, thimbles, and needles to make hammocks. She hopes to cover the demand of her customers and continue having her source of income.

Reyna expresses that after having invested the previous loan in basic materials for the production of her products, business has improved, she provides better quality and variety to her customers, and her family is supported and is in good health.

loans.use: to buy silk and nylon thread in different colors, thimbles, and needles to make hammocks.

loans.name: Khodr

texts.en:
Khodr is the proud owner of a birds shop located in a Palestinian refugee camp in North Lebanon. He lives in the same camp with his wife, a school teacher, his mother and his sister.

In his shop, Khodr has been selling birds, fish, cages and other related accessories since 2000. His shop is located in a very popular street of the camp, which allows him to attract lots of clients of all ages. In fact, kids love to pass by his shop and watch the birds and fish.

Khodr is asking for a 4,522,823 Lebanese pounds (LBP) loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. He needs the loan to buy birds and accessories and sell them in his shop. Khodr is expecting an increase in demand for the upcoming weeks and needs to have enough supply in order to avoid shortage. The loan will therefore help him maintain a good business performance and a stable income.

loans.use: to buy birds and sell them in his shop

loans.name: Alhaji Muhammed

texts.en:
Alhaji Muhammed is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Alhaji Muhammed has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Muhammed would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji Muhammed can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Muhammed will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Alhaji Muhammed is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Pawendtaore Group

texts.fr: Justine est mariée et mère de 2 enfants âgée de 32 ans. Elle vend ses pagnes et son jus au marché et cela fait 10 ans qu'elle exerce cette activité. elle a besoin d'un prêt pour acheter  les pagnes à 60 000 f aussi acheter des habits prêt à porter à 50 000 et du sucre à 22 500 F, bissap et gingembre à 17 500 f pour son jus afin de vendre. La diversité de ses pagnes et le goût spécial de son jus dans le marché qu'elle est, fait que la vente de ses pagnes et de son jus marche bien en plus de  cela, elle propose de la bonne qualité de sa marchandise à ses clients, sa propriété et le respect envers ses clients. Après ses ventes, elle aura un bénéfice qui permettra de faire des épargnes, de s'occuper de sa famille et aussi de continuer ses activités. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt  une fois et à rembourser à la bonne date prévue à ACFIME.
texts.en:
Justine is a 32-year-old married mother to two children. She has been selling traditional pagne cloth and her home-made juice for the past 10 years. She needs this loan to purchase 60,000-FCFA of traditional pagne cloth, 50,000-FCFA of ready-to-wear clothing, 22,500-FCFA of sugar, as well as 17,500-FCFA of bissap and ginger, which she will then resell.

Due to the diversity of the pagne cloth she stocks and the unique taste of her fruit drink, her wares always sell well at market. She offers her customers top-quality goods and also treats them with respect. After selling her merchandise, the resulting profits will allow her to put aside some savings, look after her family and also carry on her business. She has already received a loan once before and she paid it back on time in accordance with her agreement with ACFIME.

loans.use: to purchase 60,000-FCFA of traditional pagne cloth, 50,000-FCFA of ready-to-wear clothing, 22,500-FCFA of sugar, as well as 17,500-FCFA of bissap and ginger.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a maize farmer from Rika village. As a Babban Gona member, Joseph is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Joseph would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Joseph can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Joseph no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Joseph hopes to realize better yields. He plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
José vive con su familia, aún es soltero y no tiene hijos, como no cuenta con ayuda económica de parientes, él decidió aprender a revender pan, trabaja de cinco de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde, de esta manera obtiene ingresos para cubrir sus necesidades personales y ayudar a su familia.
Comprará pan dulce, francés y simple, tendrá la oportunidad de ofrecer nuevas opciones de compra a sus clientes, considera que así su negocio tendrá mayor a fluencia de clientes y tanto sus ventas como ingresos aumentaran.
Su sueño es mantener su negocio en el mercado para compartir con sus seres queridos un estilo de vida más confortable.
texts.en:
Jose lives with his family. He is still single, and has no children. As he doesn’t have any financial support from his relatives, he decided to learn how to sell bread. He works from five o’clock in the morning until four o’clock in the afternoon. In this way, he earns income to cover his personal necessities and help his family.

He will purchase sweet bread, French and plain, so he will have the opportunity to offer his customers new selections. He feels that, in this way, his business will have an influx of customers, and both his sales and income will increase.

His dream is to keep his business going in the market so that he can share a more comfortable lifestyle with his loves ones.

loans.use: to purchase sweet bread, French and plain, so he will have the opportunity to offer his customers new selections.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is 46 years old and a married woman. Her brother (also shown in the attached photo) has been successfully running a small general store. He provides his family with good quality food, clothing and health through his business. For the improvement of her brother's business, she requested a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR to buy packs of salt, biscuits, rice, spices and juice to handle the increasing demands of the customers.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, rice, spices and juice to handle the increasing demands of the customers.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is a 59-year-old woman who lives in Catigbian, Bohol with her family. She is the mother of five adult children. For the past years, Andrea and her husband provided for their family by retailing rice.

She dreams of a better and more comfortable means of living in the future. That is why she wants to improve their income. To do this, Andrea has applied for a loan of 18,000 PHP through Kiva's field partner CEVI for additional capital to buy rice. In this way, she will be able to buy more sacks of rice to sell, that will improve her profit.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Konul

texts.en:
Konul is a 41-year-old lady. She is an IDP who lives at the moment in the Bilasuvar region, which is a settlement for refugee people. Konul is married and has 2 sons and 2 daughters. Her family isn't large. She is taking care of her family and also her elderly parents.

Konul is a well-reputed lady in the local market. At this age, she has been successful in the local bazaar. She grows some vegetables and fruits. People see her as an honest, intelligent and hard-working lady. Konul's job is more depending on people who have high demand for fresh natural fruits and vegetables. There are many traditional dishes which consist of vegetables like potato, cabbage, tomato and also egg-plants. People prepare dolmas, bozbash and other meals with them.

Konul is a very hard-working and energetic lady. She wants to become a successful person and to meet the family needs in a better way. For this she plans to improve her business. She is planning to buy new seeds and fertilizers. She requires a 1,900 AZN loan. Kiva lenders should support her.

loans.use: to buy new seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Ahamed

texts.en:
Ahamed is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Ahamed has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ahamed would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ahamed can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Ahamed will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Ahamed is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen is 43 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Allen is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Allen has been in pig fattening for three years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en:
Amadu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Amadu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Amadu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Amadu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Amadu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Amadu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the lives of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Fahat

texts.en:
Fahat is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Fahat has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Fahat would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Fahat can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Fahat will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Fahat is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the lives of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Abahuje Group

texts.en: Abahuje Group leader Colette is 48 years old and married with four children, ages 2 to 15 years. All the children attend school. "Abahuje" means “all together." The group members sell different products and they all wish to expand their businesses to make a better future. Colette owns a shop and has been running the business for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more salt, sugar, and biscuits to sell. She will use the profits from the business to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more salt, sugar, and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Dina Ester

texts.es: Dina de 36 años de edad vive en cas propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee una pequeña tienda y venta de panes con pollo desde hace mas de 2 años y su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia con las gnancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mercaderia como: golosinas, sopas, macarrones, detergente, pan, pollos, etc. para incrementar sus ingresos y asi darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Dina, 36, lives in her own home with her family.  She has a small shop, located in her home, where she has been selling bread with chicken for over two years.  With the income she earns, she manages to pay some of her household expenses.  She is requesting a loan to purchase goods such as candy, soup, macaroni, detergent, bread, chicken, and other items to increase her income and thus, provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase goods such as candy, soup, macaroni, detergent, bread, chicken, and other items.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a mother who is involved in dairy farming to sustain her family. She has been passionate about animal rearing since her early childhood, when she used to help her parents on their farm.

Jane has experienced financial challenges in persuing her dreams of establishing her own farm. She believes that with her Kiva loan, she will be able to purchase one additional cow which will increase her milk production by 15 litres. Selling the milk will allow her to not only repay the loan but will also enable her to save for her family's future needs.

loans.use: to purchase a cow in order to increase her milk production by 15 litres.

loans.name: Navard

texts.en:
Here is Navard from Verishen Village in the Syuniq region. She is a widow living with her daughter.

Navard has been taking care of her family farm for 9 years already, and the income from it is the main source for the family's living. She keeps livestock of 3 cows, 2 oxen, a pig and some hens and also near her house organizes crop cultivation.

Navard requested this loan to purchase a calf and forage for feeding the livestock. She says that the main challenge to her farming business is inflation and she hopes to feed the livestock and sell in spring with better prices.

loans.use: to pay for a calf and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Yahuza

texts.en:
Yahuza is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Yahuza is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Yahuza would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Yahuza will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Yahuza now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and his family members, and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Zarifa

texts.en:
Zarifa is a kind woman. She was born in 1982. Zarifa is married and is raising a daughter. She has been busy with buying and selling women's clothes more than 15 years.

Zarifa has a place to sell in a local market. As Zarifa is a very kind and industrious woman many sellers in the local market respect and like her. She has great experience in selling clothes. Every season she renews the assortment of her goods. With this aim, she is asking for a loan of 7,000 TJS to buy women's clothes for the new season.
She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes for the new season.

loans.name: Yến

texts.en:
Mrs Yến is 26 years old and she is married. She has had a manufacturing business sewing clothes for 6 years. Yến lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.
Her family has no latrine.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a toilet . She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build toilet.

This is Yến first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Yến hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia actualmente vende tamales y ropa, la venta de tamales la prepara en su casa y la sale a vender al mercado municipal, ella trabaja todos los días, Antonia se encuentra acompañada  y tiene dos hijos de 21 y 20 años de edad, los cuales ya trabajan, ella manifiesta que no tiene ayuda de remesas para salir adelante.
Para tener más capacidad de atender las demandas de sus clientes solicitan un crédito para comprar maíz, elotes, sal y leña así tendrá más insumos importantes para preparar la venta de tamales, además invertirá en ropa para ambos sexos, espera estar preparada para las fiestas de navidad y fin de año, pues en esta temporada las ventas tienden a subir.
Su visión es tener mejor calidad de vida familiar y resarcir su deuda.
texts.en:
Antonia currently sells tamales and clothing. She prepares the tamales in her home and then sells them at the city market. She works every day. She has a partner and two children ages 21 and 20. The children work. She notes that she does not receive any funds from family abroad to help her get ahead.

She is asking for a loan in order to increase her capacity to fulfill customer requests. She will use the loan to buy corn, ears of corn, salt and firewood. This will give her more resources for preparing her tamales for sale. In addition, she will invest in clothing for both sexes. She hopes to be prepared for the Christmas and New Year seasons, since during the holidays sales tend to increase.

Her vision is to improve her family's quality of life and to pay off her debt.

loans.use: to buy corn, ears of corn, salt and firewood to make tamales, as well as clothing for both men and women.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen was living a tough life some years ago as it was very difficult to cover her household expenditures. She is a 34 year old, married woman running a milk selling business. She has been running this business for many years with the help of her husband (also shown in the photo).

Perveen has buffaloes for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has 3 children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation and, now, she has requested a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo. It will increase her milk sales and help her earn a good income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo to increase her milk sales so she can earn a good income and provide better living conditions for her children.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Don Miguel, tiene 52 años de edad, está casado, él tiene 4 hijos con su esposa con quien vive en una aldea del municipio de Sulaco, Yoro. Hace 4 años que don Miguel inició con su propio negocio de cría de pollos para engorde y venta. Su actividad la tiene en su casa y vende al mercado local. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 20,000 Lempiras para comprar más pollos para  cría, engorde y revender. Su meta es seguir trabajando con su microempresa y crecer en volumen de pollos para obtener mayor venta e ingresos.
texts.en: Don Miguel is 52 years old, is married and has four children together with his wife.  They live in a village outside of the city of Sulaco, Yoro.  Four years ago Miguel began his own business raising chickens to fatten and then resell.  He does his work at home and he sells the chickens at a local market.  He has asked for a loan of 20,000 Lempiras (local currency) in order to buy more chickens to raise, fatten and resell.  His goal is to continue working with his microbusiness and increase the volume of chickens in order to obtain better sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more chickens to raise, fatten and resell.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a happily married woman shown in the photo with her son. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting a tailoring business at her home as her husband's income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses.

Parveen is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulty in meeting the daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested a Murabaha loan of PKR 20,000. With the loan, she wants to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to make more dresses on time. She hopes to be able to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to make more dresses on time.

loans.name: Isah

texts.en:
Isah is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Isah has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Isah would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Isah can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Isah will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Isah is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the lives of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Sughra

texts.en: Sughra is a 52-year-old married woman. She has three children. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years she has been running a cloth business. She buys cloth in various fabrics, colors, and designs from the market at wholesale prices and then resells it to people in her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. She has requested a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR  to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Sughra expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is 26 years old and is a married woman. She is shown in the photo with her husband. She runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices and after sewing them she sells them to the people of her locality.

She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. For the improvement of her business, Shazia has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors to meet customers’ demand consistently to increase her net income and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors to meet customers’ demand consistently to increase her net income and improve their standard of living.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a hard-working lady. She initiated her business selling milk as it was difficult to run household activities with the small income of her husband (also shown in the photo).

She is 34 years old and is a married woman. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas. Samina ’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them.

Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Samina has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers and provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers and provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en: Zubaida is a responsible mother of five children, aged 33, and a married lady living in Multan, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer and has nearly 12 long years experience with this business. He is capable of convincing the customers with his calm and humble style and sell his customers fresh fruits and vegetables. But he is falling short of the resources to fill back his inventory stock so that he is able to increase his profit amounts for the betterment of the family, and to better sustain the business for his family's future. Therefore Zubaida applied for the loan so that her husband can be successful in attaining what he is dreaming of and ace the target set for himself. Zubaida thanks and pays regards to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 53 years old. She is a hardworking woman who has 2 children; one of her sons is shown in the photo. She has been providing a service stitching clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching.

Naseem ’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele.

Naseem has requested a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of thread and laces to meet the demands of her customers consistently. She aspires to save money for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of thread and laces to meet the demands of her customers consistently.

loans.name: Thakhamlian Group

texts.en: Khamlian is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  Khamlian and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter Khamlian and his group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Khamlian and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Khamlian and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Rached

texts.en:
Rached is a 21-year-old single young man. The sole breadwinner of his family which consists of three, he was forced to quit school during the intermediate level and started working in a cell phone shop to cover the expenses and needs of his beloved family.

Rached is a hard worker and an ambitious man who is trying hard to develop his business. Today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase his merchandise with new fashionable phone accessories, prepaid mobile phone cards, and spare parts.

Rached hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise with new fashionable phone accessories, prepaid mobile phone cards and spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 21 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, el posee un taller de estructuras metálicas donde elabora puertas, balcones, rejas entre otros, tiene 3 años de dedicarse a este negocio y ya tiene mucha clientela pues lo buscan por la calidad de su trabajo, el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar hierro, metal, herramienta etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: This young man's face has been pixelated out because he lives in a high risk area. He is 21 years old and owns a metalic structures shop where he makes doors, balconies, window bars, and other items.  He has been working in this field for 3 years and he has a lot of clients who choose him because of his high quality work.  He lives in his own home with his family.  He is asking for a loan from Kiva's partner INTEGRAL that will help him buy iron, metal, tools, etc.  In this way he will improve his income.

loans.use: to buy iron, metal, tools, etc. for his metalworking business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 54 years old and married with four children.

Rebecca works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like personal care products, home care products, and other groceries.

Rebecca has borrowed and paid back nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from food vending.

Rebecca aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like personal care products, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
María es una mujer emprendedora que ha logrado establecer su propio negocio de ropa (usada y nueva), lociones y cosméticos, cuenta con 6 años de experiencia, el negocio lo emprendió con apoyo de sus amistades, inicio con un inventario muy pequeño, con el paso del tiempo ha ido incorporando nuevos productos y ya cuanta con un puesto fijo de ventas en el mercado municipal. María vive con una hija menor de edad, ella se separó del padre de su hija y en ocasiones le ayuda con la con los gastos de la niña.
Invertirá en pantalones, camisas, vestidos, ropa interior, etc., seguirá ofreciendo mercadería de calidad y con buenos precios a sus clientes, ella cree que así captara la atención de clientes nuevos y podrá generar más ganancias, las cuales le servirán para ir cumpliendo con sus obligaciones.
María sueña con seguir luchando para tener una casa propia, un negocio más surtido y una economía familiar más estable.
texts.en:
María is a hard working woman who has established her own business for selling new and used clothes, as well as lotions and cosmetics. She has 6 years of experience. She started the business with help from her friends and began with a very small inventory. Over time she has begun incorporating new products and now she has her own fixed stall in the city market. María lives with her younger daughter. She separated from the father of her daughter but on occasions he helps with expenses for the child.

She will invest in pants, shirts, dresses, underwear, etc. She will continue to offer high quality merchandise and good prices to her customers. She believes that in this way she will capture new customers' attention and be able to generate more income. That will help her accomplish her goals.

María dreams of having her own home, having a well-stocked business, and offering a stable economic situation to her family.

loans.use: pants, shirts, dresses, underwear, etc. in order to offer high quality and variety for her customers.

loans.name: Edik

texts.en:
Edik is farmer living in Hoktember village of Armavir region with his wife and son. Edik's main occupation is his farming business: he cultivates his grape orchard and grows tomatoes, apricots, cherry and walnuts.

Edik has signed different agreements with local factories and sells them products from his farm.
The requested loan will help him to purchase wires for the grape orchard, cover labor costs for cultivation and transportation of grapes to the market.

Edik has already sold the harvest for this season, but the money he will receive in coming spring, so this loan will greatly help him to cover current costs of the farm and sustain it.

loans.use: to pay for wires for the grape orchard, cover labor costs for cultivation and transportation of grapes to market .

loans.name: Mevlide

texts.en:
Mevlide wants to thank all of the lenders for her previous two loans. She has been able to consistently improve her living conditions for her family through the support of the lenders. She has used the loans to purchase more bees and a place to keep them.

For the third time Mevlide (pictured with her husband) is requesting a loan for the same business to purchase more bees and food for them. She is hoping that by working at her business and selling the honey, she will be able to provide a much better life for her children. She will be able to afford better education and improve their standard of living.
She promises to pay on time again.

loans.use: to purchase bees, more food for the bees and a place to keep them.

loans.name: Henrietta

texts.en:
Henrietta is a 40 year old beautician, married with three kids, who are ten, six and three years old respectively, and lives at Madina, a suburb in Accra.
Currently she is applying for a kiva loan of GHS 6000, to increase the purchase of hair extensions and hair products to be able to serve her customers satisfactorily during the festive seasons.

She works from Mondays to Saturdays and spend some few hours on Sundays to service those that were not served during the week, she believes that attending to the needs of her clients will help the business grow.
She started the business basically to be financially independent so as to provide the needed support to her immediate family and extended family and also to provide help to some of the girls who learn from her as some have no one to cater for their daily needs.
Her clients are mostly women, children and a few other men.

It is her desire to establish a bigger salon and employ more young ladies to earn a living and acquire some skills to earn them a living, and this she hopes to do for free.
Her challenge has been getting financial aid to get modern equipment and accessories to meet the modern trends, and also the power crisis the country is struggling with.

“I cannot thank lenders for their kindness and support for helping all manner of people grow their business around the world, God bless you”, she added.

loans.use: to buy hair extension and beauty products to resell to customers

loans.name: Husan Taja

texts.en:
Husan Taja is a responsible mother of six children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 25 years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to make maintenance of his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good - it requires more maintenance costs on a daily basis.

Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to make maintenance of his taxi. Therefore Husan Taja has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan Husan Taja's husband can afford the maintenance costs easily. And provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Husan Taja also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Husan Taja is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Bilqees

texts.en:
Bilqees is a simple house wife, and the married mother of two daughters and one son. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, and is active borrower of BRAC Pakistan.

Bilqees' husband has had his own butchering business for the past 12 years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family, and managing the household.

Bilqees' husband wants to purchase animals for his butchering business, but due to financial constraints he is unable to purchase the cattle he needs. Therefore, Bilqees has requested a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy cattle to fulfill the needs of his business, which will enable him to earn maximum profits.

Bilqees is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to aid her husband in improving his butcher business.

loans.name: Jouhaina

texts.en:
Jouhaina is a 46-year-old married woman living with her husband and two children, one of whom is still attending school. She works really hard to be able to satisfy her family's needs and demands. She has opened a room in her house to prepare homemade foods for seven years and has gained a fair number of customers so far.

Today she’s requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase more food provisions in order to increase her sales and thus her revenues.

loans.use: to purchase more food provisions.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven aquien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 29 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una venta de cerelaes y granos basicos en el mercado muncicipal desde hace mas de 3 años, tiene muchos clientes por la variedad de productos, gracias a su trabajo es como logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con su grupo de trabajo, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas mercaderia como sopas, huevos, galletas, cereales, granos basicos entre otras cosas y asi poder seguir con sus ventas para tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: The young woman pictured here has her face pixelated because she lives in a high risk zone.  She is 29 years old.  She sells staples and basic grains in the city market and has been working in this field for 3 years.  She has a lot of customers due to the variety of her products.  She makes ends meet through her work. She lives in her own home along with a group from work.  She is asking for a loan in order to buy more products such as soaps, eggs, crackers, cereals, basic grains and other items and in this way be able to increase her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more products such as soaps, eggs, crackers, cereals, basic grains and other items and in this way be able to increase her sales and income.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Angela de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hermano, ella se dedica desde hace 4 años a la elaboración y venta de pupusas su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada, con lo que obtienen de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de chicharrón, quesillo, frijoles, maíz y demás ingredientes y asi poder seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos.
texts.en: Angela is 36 years old and lives in her own home with her brother.  She has worked for the past four years making pupusas and her business is located in her home in a zone with lots of foot traffic.  With her income she is able to pay for household expenses.  She is asking for a loan in order to buy chicharrón (pork rinds), quesillo (a type of dry curd cheese), beans, corn, and other ingredients and thus be able to continue with her work and make a good income.

loans.use: to buy chicharrón (pork rinds), quesillo (a type of dry curd cheese), beans, corn, and other ingredients and thus be able to continue with her work and make a good income.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is working hard to complete his education; therefore he is working beside his education to insure his daily and education expenses. Ibrahim`s father is retired from the army, and his pension is not enough for cover all household expenses, and lately Ibrahim is facing financial problems that lead him to apply for an educational loan to pay for his university fees and achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to pay for his university fees

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena lives in Dili B. She has been involved in business activities since a few years ago. She started with her own working capital and her business is making pounds.

So she is requesting a loan of USD 600 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to improve her business. She is very interested in her business, so she takes this loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy more materials, such as wheat, cooking oil, sugar, salt, and other materials to use.

She needs the loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to improve the management of her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy wheat, cooking oil, sugar, salt, and other materials to use.

loans.name: Pedro Jr.

texts.en: Pedro is a single man who lives in the town of Tubigon, Bohol with his family. He is 46 years old and earns a living by running a sari-sari (variety) store business. His goal in life is to improve his livelihood. To do this, he is asking for a loan of PHP 8, 000 for additional capital to improve his store. He will buy basic commodities such as canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs, cooking oil, toiletries, laundry soap, chips, biscuits, bread, candies, sugar, coffee and drinks. In this way, he will be able to augment his earnings.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs, cooking oil, toiletries, laundry soap, chips, biscuits, bread, candies, sugar, coffee and drinks

loans.name: Khatija

texts.en: Khatija is 59, married, and a mother of three children. She is a very kind woman and works hard in developing her farm. She has been involved in this activity for six years. Her husband always helps her and they work together for the good future of their children. Through the requested loan, Khatija is intending to buy special seeds for vegetables and mineral fertilizers to develop her business. She is planning to expand her agriculture sector with a wide variety of seeds and productions. Khatija hopes that her beloved family will stay in good health and a secure environment.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rosemarie works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is a woman with one child and 51 years old now. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. 

Ester has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines. Ester requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed such as, nail polish, brushes, nail color, etc..

Ester has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Ester would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed such as, nail polish, brushes, nail color, etc.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan vive con su compañera de vida y un hijo, todos dependen de lo que él trabaja para sobrevivir, es fotógrafo, en su negocio brinda el servicio de fotografía y filmaciones, aprendió a desarrollar esta actividad como ayudante, cuando ya tenía mucha experiencia fundo su negocio propio, el cual tiene desde hace 15 años.
El crédito lo utilizara para tener un negocio más competitivo, se podrá comprar cámaras nuevas, memorias, DVS en blanco, papel fotográfico y otros productos relacionados con la fotografía y las filmaciones, con la inversión pretende equipar su negocio para atender mejor a sus clientes.
Entre las aspiraciones de José está renovar su equipo de trabajo por completo, hacer mejoras en su hogar y darle a su familia mejores comodidades.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his life companion and one child. They depend on what he earns from working to survive. He is a photographer.

In his business, he offers photography and film services. He learned to put this activity into practice as an assistant. After he had a lot of experience, he established his own business, which he has been running for 15 years.

He will use this loan to have a more competitive business. He will be able to buy new cameras, memory for them, blank DVDs, photo paper, and other products related to photography and film. With the investment, he hopes to equip his business to better attend to his clients' needs.

José hopes to completely update his work equipment, make improvements to his home, and give his family the best amenities possible.

loans.use: to buy new cameras, memory for them, blank DVDs, photo paper, and other products related to photography and film.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 52-year-old married lady and has been running a small general store in her community for many years with the support of her son (also shown in the photo). She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store.

Shamim makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked she requested a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR which she will use to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers

loans.name: Yolla

texts.en:
Yolla has been working as a salesperson for more than 10 years in Chouf, Lebanon. She is married and lives with her husband, a truck owner, and their three children. Yolla sells all types of kitchen products to her clients who have been loyal to her for several years. In fact, Yolla is very friendly with them as she takes the time to get to know them well. 

Yolla needs to buy a new set of kitchen products that she will be selling in the upcoming weeks. That is why she is asking for a 1,543,658 LBP loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. The loan will allow her to increase her sales and maintain her clients' loyalty by keeping them satisfied. With that extra revenue, she is planning on improving some parts of her apartment before the winter season.

loans.use: to buy kitchen products and sell them

loans.name: Eufemia Apolonia

texts.es: Doña Eufemia de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 15 años, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, gracias a sus ventas es como ha podido salir adelante con los gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder compra de sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Doña Eufemia is 62 and lives in her own house with her son. For the last 15 years she has run a small shop in her home. She has a lot of customers thanks to her competitive prices and friendly selling technique. The business has allowed her to meet her household expenses. She has applied for a loan to buy soup, eggs, dry beans and grains, refreshments, snacks etc. This will generate more income and allow her to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soup, eggs, dry beans and grains, refreshments, snacks, pastries etc

loans.name: Gs Santa Fe Group

texts.es:
La señora Santos Se dedica a la actividad de aserrar madera junto con su esposo Onésimo, esta actividad la realizan hace 15 años, en la comunidad donde reside, Santafé de Guambuco y aldeas vecinas.
Doña Santos sueña  con tener luz en su casa ya que es dificultoso hasta para cargar su celular ya que tienen que caminar varios Kilómetros, y cree que la vida tendría un cambio bastante productivo.
Doña Santos solicita el crédito para la compra de un sistema solar de 80 watt y lo solicita en forma grupal con las siguientes personas: Rubén Se dedica a la actividad de aserrar madera, esta actividad la realizan hace 7 años, en la comunidad donde reside, Malacate Escuapa, Y Saul Se dedica a la actividad de aserrar madera, esta actividad la realizan hace 8 años, en la comunidad donde reside, El Varillal Escuapa, todos ellos solicitan el apoyo por que no cuentan con el capital suficiente y tienen el sueño de ver luz por la noches en sus hogares.

 Honduras Octubre 2015
texts.en:
Mrs. Santos is dedicated to sawing wood with her husband Onésimo. They have been doing this work for 15 years in the community where they live (Santafé de Guambuco) and in neighboring villages.

Santos dreams of having light in her house, since it is difficult to charge her cell phone now since they have to walk many kilometers. She thinks that life would be a very productive change.

Santos requests the loan to buy an 80 watt solar panel system, and he requests it in a group loan with the following people. Rubén is dedicated to sawing wood, which he has been doing for 7 years in the community where he lives (Malacate Escuapa). Saul is dedicated to sawing wood, which he has been doing for 8 years in the community where he lives (El Varillal Escuapa). All of them request the support because they don't have enough capital, and they have the dream of seeing light at night in their homes.

Honduras, October 2015

loans.use: to buy an 80 watt solar panel for their house.

loans.name: Khachatur

texts.en:
Khachatur, 59, lives in Tandzaver in the Syunik region of Armenia with his wife, son, daughter-in-law and grandchildren.
