He has had vocational training and for several years worked as a crane operator. Now he does different construction jobs, but most of the time he spends working on his farm. His son works as a hairdresser but also finds time to help out on the farm, while his wife and daughter-in-law are busy with the care of the children and their big house.

Khachatur has a fertile vegetable garden where he grows tomatoes, cabbage, potatoes, cucumbers and garlic. He also has an orchard with persimmon, apple, nut, fig, pear and peach trees. All these foods he sells both locally and at the city’s wholesale market.

Khachatur has applied for a 400,000 AMD loan through Kiva's field partner Nor Horizon to buy diesel fuel and vegetable seedlings to do the last of autumn’s sowing.

loans.use: to buy diesel fuel and vegetable seedlings to do the last of autumn’s sowing.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 44 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Wilma works very hard to provide for them.

Wilma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like beverages, canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Wilma has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Wilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like beverages, canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marites is 34 years old and has one child still in school.

Marites has a beauty salon services business in the Philippines. Marites requested a PHP 14000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials and pay for her laborers salaries of her salon business.

Marites has been in this business for 4 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and pay her staff salaries at her salon business.

loans.name: Qnarik

texts.en:
Qnarik is 35, mother of 4 children, ages one through seventeen, two of them attend school. Qnarik's husband is a migrant laborer in neighbouring country, where he had to go to sustain his family's living.
Qnarik herself has to take care of her children and the family farm, because the income from farming business is vital for living.

Qnarik currently keeps 14 oxen, 3 cows, 3 piglets and 30 hens. She sells in the local market items such as milk, cheese, eggs, meat. With the requested loan Qnarik needs to purchase forage (barley,sawdust) to feed the livestock during the winter season and sustain the farming business. She would be very thankful if lenders support her to sustain the farm during the winter.

loans.use: to pay for forage (barley,sawdust) to feed the livestock during the winter and sustain the farm

loans.name: Tursunoy

texts.en:
Tursunoy was born in 1983 year. She is married and has 3 children. Her children are schoolboys. Tursunoy has started own business deal with buying and selling shoes. She sells men's and women's shoes in a local market. She has worked in this way more than 6 years.

Tursunoy little by little with the passing of the time develops business and she dreams to open own clothing shop. She is asking for a loan of 10000 Somoni to buy men and women's shoes for the new season. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy men and women's shoes for the new season.

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es: María de 22 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañero de vida, y a sus 2 hijas de 1 y 6 años de edad. María en busca que a sus familia no les falte nada y puedan vivir de una mejora forma presta sus servicios en un negocio de venta de pupusas que está cerca de su vivienda, y es gracias a esta labor que logra cubrir los gastos de su vivienda, así también con el aporte que su compañero de vida le brinda. María en busca de mejorar su estilo de vida solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillos, arena, cemento y pago de mano de obra para finalizar la construcción de la pared de su cocina, la cual por falta de liquidez económica no la ha podido finalizar.
texts.en:
María is 22 years old, and she lives in her own house with her partner and their 2 daughters, who are 1 and 6 years old. María works in a business selling pupusas near her house because she doesn't want her family to lack for anything and be able to live in a better way. Thanks to this work, she has succeeded in covering the household expenses, along with the contribution her partner offers.

Seeking to improve her life, María requests a loan from FUSAI to invest in bricks, sand, cement, and workers to finish construction on the wall of her kitchen. Because of the lack of liquid financing, she has not been able to finish it.

loans.use: to invest in bricks, sand, cement, and workers to finish construction on the wall of her kitchen.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
From Tondo, Manila, Philippines is Marieta, a 48-year-old business woman who’s managing a buy and sell business of comforters, doormats, bed sheets and pillow cases. She has a child in elementary school and a child at college level. The other three are currently employed. She’s thankful for having the business as it became a medium for her in supporting the needs of her family and her children’s educational expenses.

Marieta has already been an entrepreneur for 20 years. The business that she has currently, is where she gets support to pay for bills and other house expenses. Marieta is a mother that has plans for her family and to have established savings for their future.

She is applying for a loan of PHP 20, 000 as this amount will be of great help for her business. It’ll be added capital or a revolving fund that will be used for buying stocks of comforters, doormats, bed sheets and pillow cases.

Marieta is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners which consists of 15 to 30 members where she gains spiritual strength from member’s life changing testimony, shares her own experience of God’s love, repays microfinance loans and hears God’s word that was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy stocks of comforters, doormats, bed sheets and pillow cases for her buy and sell business.

loans.name: Ma. Febe

texts.en:
Ma. Febe is 35 years old and married with two children.  With one child in school, Ma. Febe works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Febe has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Ma. Febe has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned good, personal care products and other groceries. 

In the future Ma. Febe would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Kwegatta Group Katovu

texts.en:
The members belong to the "Kwegatta' group located in Katovu a rural outskirt of Lyantonde town in western Uganda. The group chairman Stephen is 51 years old and he has worked in agriculture for many years longer than a decade. He plants tubers and vegetables.

The member is applying for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. The other members also develop agriculture of tubers, vegetables and livestock. The members are content with the financial boost that the Kiva investors are illing to give them and they commit themselves to continue working hard and repay their loan well.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ama Jeannette

texts.fr: Ama est une femme âgée de 25 ans qui vit à Baguida. Mariée et mère de deux enfants, Ama est une détaillante de la farine du manioc et sucre qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Ama désire ce crédit pour financer son achat des bols de farine de manioc et de sucre en vue de bien revendre puis d’en tirer profit et gagner plus de revenus afin de mieux contribuer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en: Ama is a 25-year-old woman who lives in Baguida. Married and the mother of two children, Ama is a cassava flour and sugar vendor, which she buys two times a month from the market and resells in the surrounding neighborhoods. Ama is applying for this loan in order to finance the purchase of cassava flour and sugar, with the goal of reselling them for a profit and increasing her earnings so that she can pay for her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy 48 bags of cassava flour and 8 bags of sugar.

loans.name: 8 Estrellas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “8 ESTRELLAS” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Achacachi, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Carmen es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de salteñas (empanada tradicional), venta de comida, venta de sombreros, venta de detergentes, venta de verduras, licorería, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Carmen es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene una tienda de licorería; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá y decidió emprender su propio negocio hace varios años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de cerveza por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y  posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "8 Estrellas" (Eight Stars) communal bank will begin its second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the "Centro Focal Achacachi." The group is composed of nine members and is directed by a board of directors in which Mrs. Carmen is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank take forward are varied; among them are: selling salteñas (traditional empanadas), selling food, selling hats, selling detergents, selling vegetables, selling liquor, and running a store.

The loan that they take out will benefit the small micro-enterprises where Mrs. Carmen is a member. She sells that it is the first time that she is part of Pro Mujer, joining by invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. At present, she has a liquor store. She learned this business from her mother, and she decided to start her own business many years ago.

The loan that she now takes out will be use to increase capital to buy beer wholesale, which she will acquire from wholesalers in the city of La Paz. She will then sell the product in her store. This form of work will allow her to generate resources to support her family financially, since she is single and has a son.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy beer wholesale.

loans.name: Aya 1 Group

texts.en:
Zeinab is the featured borrower for Aya 1 Group. She joined with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Zeinab is a 31-year-old married mother of two. She runs a make up and cosmetics business from her house, for five years ago, to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their children. She is a hard worker and ambitious lady who is working hard to develop her business.

Today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase and diversify her merchandise with new collection of winter cosmetics and make ups to satisfy her customers' demands. Zeinab is the lady sitting in the middle. Mariam is the first on the left, and Zeinab is the first of the right of the photo.

loans.use: to increase and diversify her merchandise with new collection of winter cosmetics and make up to satisfy her customers' demands.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline has two children and is a member of Kiva's field partner Center for Community Transformation (CCT) of the Taguig branch in the Philippines. She has managed a sari-sari for two years and earns about 3,000 PHP each month.

A sari-sari is a small variety store very common in the Philippines and means “a variety of choices.” Customers patronize these shops because items here can be purchased by piece, kilo or volume unlike in supermarkets where most products are sold in larger units.

Evangeline’s sari-sari is a way for her to provide for her children’s daily needs and pay for their school expenses. She’s thankful to God for her means of earning an income. Right now, her goal is to have more knowledge as to how to grow her business and what marketing strategies to use. She takes advantage of every CCT seminar given for its entrepreneurs.

As a mother, Evangeline works hard for her family, as she wants her business to be successful someday for them. She dreams of saving money and having a revolving fund as well to compensate for late payments by customers. Now she is applying for a 20,000 PHP loan to be used to buy grocery items for her sari-sari.

All CCT community clients like Evangeline are organized into fellowship groups of fifteen to thirty members who meet on a weekly basis. There they share stories of their work, repay microfinance loans and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for her sari-sari.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en: Saturnina is a previous member of GDMPC. She lives in Tabo-o Jimenez where the main livelihood is fishing. Last year she is granted a loan and she bought a fishing boat. The loan was paid successfully. She helps her husband in fishing and she is the one who sells those fish they caught. This business really helps them a lot in raising their 3 children and providing them a good education. Now, the fishing boat needs to be repair so she plans to borrow money in GDMPC amounted to Php5, 200.00. Her future plan is to engage into a swine fattening business for she believes that it can help her buy the needs of her children.

loans.use: to repair the boat which is used for fishing

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a 51-year-old married mother of one daughter, who is still attending university, majoring in Nursing. Sahar`s husband's is the main income source in the family.

In order to pay her daughter's educational fees, she is requesting a loan from Kiva, She wants her daughter to complete her education and find good work with a good salary. Her daughter appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's educational fees in Nursing.

loans.name: Dila

texts.en:
Dila who is 49 is in the photograph with her husband, Bajram and their only child, the 10-year-old daughter; in the background of the photograph is their house suggesting that they are indeed very poor.

Dila has been receiving weekly dialyses in the hospital far from her rural home, for the past ten years making the lives of her family difficult, as per her statement.
For the past fifteen years Dila's focus and also her husband's has been on livestock and agriculture. On the land that they own, they plant basically corn and fodder and they have citrus orchards and grapevines. They also have a dairy cow and 40 chickens and they sell homemade cheese, chickens and eggs and also homemade alcohol drink 'raki'. As far as her disability concerns, she receives $146.8/month.

The reason she is asking for your compassion and financial help is to pay for the kidney dialyses.

loans.use: to pay for her weekly kidney dialyses.

loans.name: Vernecita

texts.en:
Vernecita earns a living by means of raising hogs. She raises and sold pigs to the locals in her place. She is a married woman and has two young children. Three of them are still attending school. Her income mainly goes for food. On the other hand, her husband's occupation is a welder.

Aside from hog raising, she also goes fishing. She would like to improve her both sources of income to become sustainable.

She has requested a loan to purchase feed, pig, and fishing materials like nylon and weights, These could help enhance her source of income and slowly able to settle her obligation.

Vernecita is thankful for the funds and is determined to manage it successfully to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase feed, pig, and fishing materials like nylon and weights, .

loans.name: Greta

texts.en:
Greta lives in Bnuni village with her husband; their son currently serves in the army and their daughter is married and lives with her family in a different town. Greta and her husband have been occupied with livestock breeding and land cultivation for many years. They keep a large livestock of cows, calves, oxen, pigs and piglets. On the family's arable land, they cultivate potatoes, wheat, walnuts and apples and sell the harvest at local market places.

Greta requested this loan to enlarge their farm and purchase ten sheep and forage for feeding the livestock. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for ten sheep and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene started to manage a variety store business when she was 40 years old. The business that she has right now is also known as “sari-sari” store in the Philippines which means “variety of choices”. Most Filipinos prefer to buy items here since there’s no need for them to spend money for a fare just to buy a product. Most sari-sari stores are located in every barangay (village), municipality or even in cities. She has the business at the comfort of her own home in Taguig, Philippines.

Arlene is eager to earn each day to support the day-to-day needs of her family. Being in the business for 8 years now, she aims to succeed in her chosen industry by having complete products to offer to clients. She also dreams of buying her own motorized tricycle as another source of income. However, there are customers who pay late for the products, that’s why supporting capital is what she wants to maintain so that she’ll be able to buy grocery items and sacks of rice to add to the business. Arlene requested for a loan amount of PHP 30, 000 and she believes that God will touch their hearts for the loan approval.

Arlene regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experiences in business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationships with other partners, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to add to her variety store business.

loans.name: Israa

texts.en: Israa, 24 years old, is a divorced woman living with her family in Irbid. Currently she is in the third year of a degree program in Child Care. As well as being very hardworking, Israa also tried to find good work while pursuing her education, but she did not find any. She says she wants to specialize in child care. Israa is asking for this loan so she can pay the installments for her studies. She is very grateful to the people who are helping her to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to be able to pay for her university fees.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es una mujer de 36 años de edad es casada con una linda familia de dos hijos de las edades entre 2 y 8 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Isabel con el afán de mejorar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la elaboración de jaspeado con este negocio lleva ella 5 años de realizarlo, a ella le gusta esta actividad pues lo realiza desde la comodidad de su hogar.
Isabel por la demanda que se le presenta en la época de fin de año, está solicitando un préstamo de Q 5,000.00 para la compra de materiales tales como: hilos y tintes. Con esta inversión ella espera poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Su gran sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Isabel is a 36-year old woman who is married. Her beautiful family consists of two children, who are between the ages of two and eight. This humble family lives in a Sololá community.

Isabel has a great desire to improve her income and get her family ahead. And so she earns a living making marbled threads. She has had her business for five years, and she likes it because she can work from the comfort of her own home.

Isabel is requesting a loan of Q 5,000.00 (USD $675) so she can purchase materials, such as thread and dyes, to help her meet the year-end demand. With that investment, Isabel hopes to offer a better service to her customers.

Isabel's greatest hope is to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase thread and dyes for her business.

loans.name: Abdurahmon

texts.en:
Abdurahmon is from Shahrituz. He is 30 years old. He is married and has two young children. Abdurahmon is a very cheerful and sociable person. He loves his family very much and tries to be the best father for his children. He always finds the time to look after his children.

Abdurahmon does not have higher education and he makes all effort to ensure that his children receive a better education. Abdurahmon buys and sells cattle. He has good experience in this field. Abdurahmon wants to augment his family's income, and expand his business. He wants to buy some calves, fatten them up, and sell them for profit.

Unfortunately, he does not have enough money for this, thus he has applied for a loan. Abdurahmon believes in you and thanks you in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Shabani

texts.en:
Shabani, who is in his early 40's is a divorcee with three schooling children. He has been running a retail shop since 2011. He works from 7 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Shabani's 8th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase on the shop inventory and has paid back all his loans successfully. He is doing great with his loan. He used the profit to pay school fees,to repay loan, bought a plot of land, started building his house, bought sofa sets, a fridge and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to increase on the fast moving items in the retail shop. He dreams of finishing build his house.

Shabani will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on the fast moving items in the retail shop.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
With her previous loan Amina was able to buy additional groceries for her sari-sari, or variety store. Because she’s now able to provide more products for customers, she has attracted additional patrons. She wants to extend her sincerest appreciation to lenders and Kiva's field partner Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for the financial assistance it has provided. She’s now earning about 2,100 PHP every month, which is much higher compared to what she made before her previous loan.

Amina is working hard to sustain the family’s day-to-day expenses with the help of her husband, Pendatun; she is grateful for a responsible husband like him. The business doesn’t always earn a good profit since there are competitors in the same area. This is a challenge for her as well as customers who are late with their credit payments.

Amina has applied for a 25,000 PHP loan to add more grocery products, cases of bottled drinks and varieties of rice. She knows such additions to her stock will result in greater profits.

Amina believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. All CCT community clients like she are organized into fellowship groups of fifteen to thirty members who meet on a weekly basis. There they share stories of their work, repay microfinance loans and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God.

loans.use: to add more groceries, cases of bottled drinks and varieties of rice to offer in her sari-sari.

loans.name: Tatevik

texts.en:
This young, nice lady is 22 years old and her name is Tatevik. Her name is among those names in Armenian that has a very nice meaning: "to give wings". Tatevik has just graduated from the faculty of Russian Language and Literature, Vanadzor State University, and has already managed to find work in her specialty. She is now working at a school as a teacher of Russian language and literature. She mentions that she works with great pleasure and is greatly devoted to her work. She also has a group of pupils to whom she gives paid courses at her flat, helping them to overcome the difficulties that they have, especially in Russian grammar.

Tatevik is a very much beloved teacher among her pupils. She is temporarily living alone since her parents are in the Russian Federation. Tatevik has asked for this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams as she greatly wants to buy a computer and some professional literature, which she greatly needs, being just a beginner in pedagogical work.

loans.use: to buy a computer and some professional literature, which she greatly needs, being just a beginner in pedagogical work.

loans.name: Knarik

texts.en:
This young and beautiful lady is Knarik, and she is 27 years old. She lives with her large family in Yerevan city. Knarik is married, and she lives with her husband, two sons, and her parents-in-law. 

Knarik has vocational education with the specialty of banking. Now she works as a computer operator at a private workshop. Her husband is also employed, as a manager at the importing company. 

Knarik is asking for this loan as she needs financial support to pay for extensive dental treatment since she has a lot of problems with her teeth. So this loan of AMD 500,000 will be very helpful for her to finally get rid of her dental problems.

loans.use: to pay for extensive dental treatment.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, a resident of Bundibugyo district, is married, with seven children, all attending school. 

She used the previous loan to buy general merchandise such as cooking oil, bread, and balloons to sell this Christmas season. She is a cocoa farmer who buys and sells cocoa from other farmers and also owns a retail shop, where she gets additional income to look after her family. 

She smiles on seeing how her business is progressing as she puts much emphasis on expanding her retail business and educating all her children. Price fluctuations and competitors hinder her business growth.  Now she is targeting increased sales during this festive season, forcing her to apply for a loan to buy general merchandise, such as rice, soap, matchboxes, and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise, such as rice, soap, and other items, to sell this Christmas season.

loans.name: Suwenti

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Suwenti, who is a 45-year-old married with two sons and one daughter. Suwenti has a small shop and her husband is a driver for thirty years. She has asked for a loan of IDR 7.000,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build water source at their home to improve access to water source and sanitation for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Suwenti will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: This loan will be used to build water source at their home to improve access to water source and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
Greetings from Dashtaqar village of Ararat region. This is Andranik, 27-years old. He lives with his parents, wife and their 2-years old son. Andranik is currently a student at University of International Economic Relations, studying for a Bachelor's degree in Law.

As the main breadwinner of his family, Andranik after studies also works as a driver in one of the local companies. He requested this loan to be able to cover his university tuition fee and continue his studies. Andranik feels that Bachelor's degree of Lawyer, will give him a confidence to achieve his most desired dream to become a high quality lawyer.

The studies are going well and the only obstacle Andranik currently faces is tuition cost. He greatly hopes to receive Kiva lenders' support and achieve his professional development.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition to continue his studies and become a lawyer.

loans.name: Tural

texts.en:
Tural is 19 years old. He is a very effort giving and passionate person. Tural is IDP from Bilasuvar refugee settlement built after the war which took place decades ago. He is living with the large family and also helps his old parents, with a brother and sister.

At this young age, he just finished his studies and he knows that he has great responsibilities in both earning income and supporting family, because his parents are both not eligible for work. He is a farmer and people in his neighbourhood call him as an honest young farmer. He is very energetic and he knows that success requires dedication. Tural likes to provide more natural products to people.

Being a refugee and from the region where people are more familiar with farming, gives him more advantage in the local market. He is more familiar with local area people and knows the peoples' needs and demands. In Azerbaijan people consume a lot of wheat such as rural area people bake their own bread and make pastries, cakes at home. Tural has advantage, because people trust him and.

Currently he is planning to buy more fertilizers and plant new trees, buy more seeds for this he needs 1200 AZN. Hopefully Kiva lenders will support him.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and plant new trees, buy more seeds

loans.name: Isroil

texts.en:
Isroil is a man who always works hard for the good of his nearest and dearest. He is from the Shahrituz region and is married with four wonderful children. He has been working in agriculture for many years, an occupation he pursues most of all in order to get food. For instance, in order to get bread on the table, farmers grow grains such as wheat, rye and other cereals.

Isroil has already planted vegetables and wheat this season but didn't have enough money to buy mineral fertilizers. For this reason, he is urgently requesting a loan because, if he doesn't buy fertilizer soon, he won't have a harvest. His only hope is to receive a loan.

loans.use: To purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Gs La Granja Group

texts.es:
Mary es una persona muy trabajadora que se dedica a la caficultura desde hace 23 años, en la actualidad cuenta con 6 Manzanas de café variedad lempira, según  el último año, La señora Mary reporto 150 quintales en café pergamino oro, este café es vendido a los Beneficios de la Ciudad de Teupasenti.
Mary solicita el préstamo para la compra de un sistema de planta solar de 85 watts, ya que desea cambiar su vida teniendo luz en la casa, estar actualizada de lo que pasa en el país utilizando los medios de comunicación comunes como ser Radio y Televisión  y evitarse de pagar y caminar para que le carguen el celular ya que este servicio lo hace en otros lugares donde si hay energía.
Mary cuenta que siempre a soñado con tener energía en su casa ya que el dia durara mas y como bien dice el dicho la vida solo es una y hay que difrutar cada momento.
Mary está solicitando el crédito de forma grupal con las siguientes personas: Rosa, se dedica a la caficultura desde hace 25 años, María se dedica a la caficultura desde hace 8 años, Delfia se dedica a la caficultura desde hace 10 años, Ernelia se dedica a la caficultura desde hace 14 años, Silvia se dedica a la cafiltura desde hace 10 años, Geremias se dedica a la caficultura desde hace 13 Años, Darwin se dedica a la caficultura desde hace 8 años, Wilmer se dedica a la caficultura desde hace 8 años, Alex se dedica a la caficultura desde hace 6 años.
Todos ellos solicitan el apoyo porque no cuentan con el capital suficiente para la compra de los sistemas solares y comparten la ilusión de tener energía en sus hogares.

Honduras Octubre 2015
texts.en:
Mary is a very hard-working person who has made her living in coffee growing for the last 23 years. She currently has six blocks of Lempira coffee. Last year, señora Mary reported 150 hundred-weights of Pergimno Oro coffee. She sold her coffee to Beneficios de la Ciudad de Teupasenti.

Mary is requesting the loan so she can purchase an 85 watt solar system. She wants to change her life by having energy in her home, to be up to date with what is happening in her country by using methods of common communication like TV and radio. She also wants to avoid paying for, and having to walk to, have her cell-phone charged, which is a service offered in other places that have power.

Mary says that she has always dreamed of having power in her home. The day will last longer and, as the saying goes, you only get one life, you should enjoy each moment.

Mary is requesting her financing as a part of a group loan with the following people: Rosa, who has made her living growing coffee for 25 years; María, who has made her living growing coffee for eight years; Delfia, who has made her living growing coffee for ten years; Ernelia, who has made her living growing coffee for fourteen years; Silvia, who has made her living growing coffee for ten years; Geremias who has made his living growing coffee for thirteen years; Darwin, who has made his living growing coffee for eight years; Wilmer, who has made his living growing coffee for eight years; and Alex, who has made his living growing coffee for six years.

All of these coffee growers are asking for help because hey don't have sufficient capital to purchase solar systems. And they share the hope of having energy in their homes.

Honduras October 2015

loans.use: to purchase an 85 watt solar panel for her home.

loans.name: Borik

texts.en:
Borik lives with his wife and two sons in Tandzaver village in the Syunik region of Armenia. He used to work as a village grazer for many years, but now he works on his farm breeding sheep. His two sons are unemployed and are a great help in the sheep breeding business. Borik has over 150 head and sells a lot of mutton and wool the whole year round.

Borik took out and successfully repaid a previous loan through Kiva's field partner Nor Horizon, and he is very thankful for that loan. He would like to further develop his farm, but unfortunately he cannot do so at this time. His wife is in poor health and feels very weak. So he has applied for a 700,000 AMD loan to pay for medical help for his wife.

loans.use: to pay for medical help for his ailing wife.

loans.name: Zaruhi

texts.en:
Zaruhi is 36 years old and she lives in Yerevan City with her nice and big family. She has a vocational education and the specialty of nurse. For several years she worked at a dental clinic as a nurse. Now she is also employed but her work is in another profession.

Zaruhi is married and she has three nice daughters and all of them are school-aged. Zaruhi’s husband is a karate coach at the sport school. This loan of 550,000 Armenian drams she asks for to find the solution to her dental problems that cause her great discomfort. She is hopeful for support and thankful beforehand.

loans.use: to find the solution to her dental problems that cause her great discomfort.

loans.name: Athan Tom

texts.en:
Since 1989, Athan Tom has been dealing in buying and selling cocoa, which is the most lucrative business for people living in Bundibugyo, along with growing and selling yellow bananas. He is a great family man with eight children and one dependent who was abandoned by his father. Athan Tom started business basically to sustain his family and pay school fees for his children as a loving father. His only business is affected by unpredictable weather changes, especially when there is too much rainfall and a lot of sunshine.

Athan Tom does not have enough money to clear his children’s fees balance and to pay workers who are harvesting his cocoa. He has thus run to Kiva to assist him with funds to pay these two obligations.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children and to pay workers on his cocoa plantation.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a cocoa farmer who is charged with the responsibility of looking after four children, all attending school. Moses is married and lives in Bundibugyo. He works hard to ensure that his family does not lack anything as he is always there to provide them with their daily needs.

Having started business in 2009, Moses has achieved a lot because every season has favored him in terms of profits. However, he has been challenged by the price fluctuations of cocoa and the fact that it is a seasonal business. In the future, Moses sees himself as being the leading cocoa supplier in his area. He intends to use the loan to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret, who lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda, deals in shoe selling, a business she started 8 years back. She supplements her income with commercial farming, growing crops like cocoa, cassava, coffee and bananas. The main reason for engaging in business was to support her family. In preparation for the festive season, Margret thinks it wise to boost her business and increase her sales. That is why she is in need of a credit facility to buy shoes for resale. She has a family dream of constructing a good permanent house plus educating her children through good schools.

loans.use: to buy shoes for resale.

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
Micaela es una joven muy optimista, con el tiempo que ya lleva con su tienda a obtenido mucha experiencia y clientes, ella cuenta que con su inversión le fue muy bien, pues más productos para su negocio compro a sus clientes un mejor servicio les brindo.
Micaela con el paso del tiempo su tienda tiene más demanda y su producto ya no se da abasto por esa razón nuevamente acude a un préstamo para realizar otra inversión, ella comprara golosinas, gaseosas, azúcar, y detergentes. Su gran anhelo es tener su casa propia y mejora la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Micaela is a very optimistic young woman. During the time she has had her grocery store she has gained a lot of experience and many customers. She says that her investment was very successful because by buying more products she was able to give her customers better service.

As time has passed, Micaela has had more demand and not enough products and so she is requesting this new loan to make a new investment. She will buy candy, sodas, sugar and detergents. Her great desire is to have her own home and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy products such as candy, sodas, sugar and detergents.

loans.name: Musenge

texts.en:
Musenge is 38 years old. He lives with his wife, who is currently studying. They have a son.  Musenge comes from a town called Chipata located in eastern Zambia.  He describes himself as business minded and passionate. 

Before he started running his own business, Musenge was in full-time employment at a brewing company from 2006-2012. He learned a lot of sales skills, which he uses in his business. 

Musenge would will like to boost his business and make mobile money more accessible to people in more rural communities. His biggest challenge is that he does not have the funds needed to grow his business in the new locations. 

He is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase three trading kiosks, which he will place in Chipata and Lundazi. He hopes that by bringing mobile money to the people, his community will have quick access to outlets that provide financial services. 

He explains that there is a huge challenge, as most of the people in his community are unbanked and as such do not have easy access to financial services. This loan will boost his business while simultaneously creating employment for upcoming entrepreneurs.

Musenge is hopeful that growing his business will enable him one day earn enough profits to fulfill his dream of seeing his wife through school and building his own house.

loans.use: To purchase three mobile-money kiosks so that he can grow his business

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit and her family have been involved in farming for 10 years. They cultivate hens, four pigs, and two piglets, as well as cultivate wheat, grape, sunflowers, cucumbers, potatoes, walnuts and figs.
. 
Anahit lives with her two sons, daughter, daughter-in-law. and two little grandchildren.  They all  help Anahit with her farming business. 

he requested loan will help Anahit and her family to buy two cows, two oxen, and forage for feeding pigs. 

Anahit hopes to earn extra income and provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for two cows, two oxen, and forage for feeding pigs

loans.name: Damiana

texts.en:
Damiana is 46 years old, she is married and is a business women. She is applying for a loan of $ 1.500.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop for her business in the center of the market. Damiana has been involving in business activities since 2005. She started with her own working capital of $ 50.00. She is earning a good income and she is also selling shoes.

So she is still happy to do her business. She is taking this loan because she wants to buy more clothes including children's clothes, skirts, nightgowns, trousers, shorts, shoes and other clothes.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes, skirts, nightgowns, trousers, shorts, shoes and other clothes.

loans.name: Barbra

texts.en:
Barbra is a 21 year old entrepreneurial young lady who recently completed her higher level of education. She’s been supporting her mother by efficiently managing the family retail business in the Bulambuli district in Eastern Uganda. While working in her mother’s shop, Barbra was recommended by an agricultural officer as one of the youths who become part of a youth energy promotion campaign that was being championed by a non-government organization in the eastern part of the country. It was there that she emerged as one of the most entrepreneurial and best sales persons in the campaign.

With the wealth of experience gained during the campaign and with her keen interest in renewable energy products, she started selling UpEnergy products by stocking some of their cook stoves in her mother’s shop. However the limited space in her mother’s shop and the lack of proper transportation has been limiting her ability to reach most of her customers, especially the women’s groups. It’s through them that she sells most of the products and they are in great need of the cook stoves and water filters. She is proud to be able to improve the livelihoods of people in her community who are able to save from improved fuel use and improving on the health of most women through the reduction in indoor air pollution. Barbra plans to use part of the profits from her business to enroll in a business course in a nearby university. Her aspiration is to become a leading entrepreneur in the renewable energy sector and a successful businesswoman in her community.

The loan will make it possible for Barbra to scale up her business and allow her to increase her stock, so that she saves time and transportation costs by not having to travel as often to replenish her stock in order to meet the high demand for stoves in her region. A portion of the loan will go into leasing warehousing space and hiring a pick-up van that will make it easy for her to reach rural communities. It will reduce the transportation costs that currently significantly reduce her take-home earnings.

loans.use: to pay for cookstoves, warehousing space and transportation of products.

loans.name: Djatougbe

texts.fr: Veuve et mère de de trois enfants, Djatougbé est une femme âgée de 56 ans résidant à Baguida. Djatougbé est une revendeuse de fruits qui s’approvisionnent quatre fois par mois au marché et le revend au bord de la route à la devanture non loin de son domicile. Djatougbé sollicite ce prêt pour commander des paniers de bananes, d’oranges et des sacs d’ananas en vue de bien revendre puis d’aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire et aux charges quotidiennes éprouvées par la famille.
texts.en: Widow and mother of three children, Djatougbé is a 56 years old woman residing in Baguida. Djatougbé is a fruit retailer who gets her supplies four times a month at the market and resells it at the edge of the road not far from her home. Djatougbé is requesting this loan to order baskets of bananas, oranges and bags  of pineapples in order to increase sales and help her children with their school education and daily expenses experienced by the family.

loans.use: to buy 04 baskets of bananas, 06 baskets of oranges and 03 bags of pineapples.

loans.name: Ira

texts.en:
Ira lives with her husband and three school-aged children in the village of Tsovagyugh, in the Gegharkunik region. Ira has vocational medical education but she never managed to work in that field. Having gotten married at a very young age, Ira very quickly got used to and became skilled in farming and agricultural work. Her husband is a farmer and he has a lot of cattle on his farm.

Ira has always been a great support for her husband in their farming work, no matter how hard it could be. Unfortunately, Ira is now unable, because of her health problems, to work with the same activity and strength as always. Ira is asking for this loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams to pass a course of treatment at the hospital and solve her health problems. She is so hopeful that this Kiva loan will be very helpful for her.

loans.use: to pass a course of treatment at the hospital and solve her health problems.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en: Luciana lives in Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. She has run a vegetable farming business since 2012. She also raises hogs for extra income. Both businesses come with a challenge - that is to wait for the harvest season and for four months to fatten the hogs. She and her husband work hard to support the needs of her two children, aged 15 and 19. With the money from the loan that she applied for, she plans to purchase fertilizer, piglets and sacks of feed. Luciana has high hopes for the impact of the loan towards her business and she is happy to anticipate a better profit for her family. The additional income will go to her children’s education and the family's daily consumption.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, a married mother of five children, is seeking credit to buy material for tailoring clothes to sell. 

She is involved in tailoring and also deals in cocoa buying and selling. The need to look after her family gave her courage to start business. 

Her family dream is to educate her children, and her business dream is to educate other people on tailoring so as to be self reliant. In spite of this, Sarah lacks enough funds to fulfill her dream. 

She will be happy if you grant her the opportunity to get these funds for shopping.

loans.use: to buy material for tailoring clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jenipher

texts.en:
Jenipher, 27 years old, is an enterprising young woman. She is married and has two children; the family lives in Bundibugyo. Jenipher operates a retail shop where she works throughout the whole week for fourteen hours a day. She ventured into business in 2011, having been inspired by the zeal to get more money for personal development.

As we approach the festive season, Jenipher looks at getting enough stock to sell to her customers, only to be challenged by inadequate capital and unfavorable weather changes which affect her sales, especially during the rainy season. She has a future plan of expanding her business. Jenipher has requested a loan to buy juice and sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy juice and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Kiganda High School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Fred, the Head Teacher of Kiganda High School, a mixed school of 520 students in the urban area of Kiganda, Mubende. Kiganda School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Kiganda School will repay this loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Fred ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration. It should also improve attendance by reducing the number of children who fall sick from water-borne diseases and also increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Kantutitas Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KANTUTITAS II” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Villa Tejada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cerveza, venta de edredones, tienda de barrio, venta de productos de limpieza, venta de perfumes, venta de regalos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ana es integrante, ella indica que integra Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de regalos; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de una amiga y decidió emprender su propio negocio hace más de doce años.  

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de juguetes por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la frontera Bolivia - Perú y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “KANTUTITAS II” communal bank will be starting its first lending cycle with Pro Mujer as a part of Centro Focal Villa Tejada. The communal bank is made up of eight members and overseen by a board of directors, of which señora Ana is the president. The members' businesses are varied and include: beer sales, quilt sales, a neighborhood store, selling cleaning products, perfume sales and selling gifts.

The loan they are taking out will benefit small, micro-entrepreneurs, of whom señora Ana is one. She says that she joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of a friend, who is a client of the institution. Currently, señora Ana has a business selling gifts. She says that she learned the business from a friend and decided to start her own business over twelve years ago.

The loan they are taking out will be used to increase capital. Señora Ana will purchase wholesale toys from the wholesale vendors on the Bolivian-Peruvian border and then sell them from her sales stall. This line of works allows her to generate an income to help her family financially. Señora Ana is single and has one son.

When asked what she likes most about Pro Mujer, señora Ana says that she likes the health training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale toys.

loans.name: Vân

texts.en:
Mrs Vân is 25 years old and she is married. She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling noodles for 3 years. Vân lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.
Her family has no latrine.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a latrine . She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

This is Vân first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Vân hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 31 years old and has two children. Jonalyn is married and has one child still in school.

Jonalyn is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Jonalyn requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jonalyn has been in this business for 1 year now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jonalyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anush

texts.en: Anush is 40 years old and she lives with her children in Vanadzor City in the Lori region. Anush’s husband is in the Russian Federation doing work there. They have a daughter and a son. Both of them are already students. Anush’s daughter is a future psychologist and her son studies at the Vanadzor State University, at the faculty of History and Geology. Unlike his sister he studies at the paid division. Anush is employed and with her husband they do their best to cover their family's needs. She works at the pharmacy as an apothecary. Anush mentions that it is a great hardship with all the needs to be able to pay for their son’s education in a limited period of time. This loan of 100,000 Armenian drams she asks for in order to pay the tuition fees for her son's first semester.

loans.use: to pay for her son's first semester tuition fees.

loans.name: St. Elizabeth S. School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Prossy. She is the Deputy Head teacher of St. Elizabeth S. School, a girl's school in the rural area of Kiyinda in Mityana with 600 students.

St. Elizabeth S. School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

St. Elizabeth S. School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Prossy ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a doting mother to her seven children aged two to nineteen. At 38 years old, Maria has learned to embrace the life common to people in Bohol. She is from the town of Duero. She is married to a mananggite (coconut wine gatherer). Maria earned a living by being a tuba (coconut wine) dealer. She also operates a Sari-sari store business. Since, many people are working in the farm as farmers, coconut wine is a form of luxury to them when they engage in conversation with friends after a long day's work while drinking their tuba. To meet the demand for this wine, Maria has become a dealer even to other Sari-sari store owners. She is asking for a loan to buy tungog (tannin powder), sugong (bamboo tube receptacle), sickle, plastic 'five-gallon-container', filter screen for coconut wine and grocery items for her store.  

She perseveres to provide for the needs of her family, and has the determination to give her seven children a good life.

loans.use: to buy tungog (tannin powder), sugong (bamboo tube receptacle), sickle, plastic 'five-gallon-container', filter screen for coconut wine and grocery items for her store

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is an 81-year-old married man with 15 children, all living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has been a farmer dealing in livestock in a rural area since 1964. He is actively working there six hours a day and five days a week. He started his business with the hope of becoming self-reliant. He is faced with challenges of inadequate labour force and poor harvests brought about by pests and diseases. However, he has a vision of educating all his children to higher levels of learning. John has asked for a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Bonifance

texts.en:
Bonifance is a farmer growing food crops like onions, tomatoes and banana planting, plus rearing chicken. He started these activities way back in 2000 and had a vision of increasing his overall income for his family. Bonifance used his previous loan to buy chicks and chicken feed. He is hindered by limited capital that leads to delayed growth and expansion. However, he is thankful to the lenders that have assisted him so much in reaching where he is now in developing his businesses.

He has asked for another Kiva loan to buy onion herbicides, weed the onion garden and pay workers who are helping him to do the work.

loans.use: to buy onion herbicides, weed the onion garden and pay workers who are helping him to do the work.

loans.name: Maria Bertilia

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 50 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y reside en un sector del municipio de Yoro. Hace aproximadamente 6 años que decidió establecer su propia pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como ser manteca, frijoles, azúcar, refrescos, churros, harina, arroz, productos de aseo, condimentos, pan, huevos, dulces y variedades como cuadernos, lapices, peluchesy colores. este negocio ha sido para ella su fuente de ingresos para el sostenimiento familiar. Ha solicitado el segundo préstamo en ODEF que es por 18,000 Lempiras para comprar más productos como ser manteca, huevos, sal, azúcar, harina, refrescos, churros, productos enlatados y otros para surtir y aumentar las ventas y ganancias. Su plan es seguir creciendo con el negocio y lograr establecerse económicamente y brindar calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Doña María, 50, is a single mother with 3 children. She lives in the municipality of Yoro.

About 6 years ago she opened a grocery store where she sells basic goods for families such as butter, beans, sugar, sodas, fritters, flour, rice, toiletries, condiments, bread, eggs, sweets as well as items such as notebooks, pencils, stuffed animals and crayons. This is how she supports her family.

She has requested her second loan with ODEF of 18,000 Lempiras [$825] to buy more products such as butter, eggs, salt, sugar, flour, sodas, fritters, canned goods etc. to increase her sales and profits.

Her plan is to keep expanding her business and establish herself financially in order to bring her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more products such as butter, eggs, salt, sugar, flour, sodas, fritters, canned goods etc. to increase her sales and profits.

loans.name: Hazem

texts.en:
Hazem is studying in university, majoring Business Administration. After he succeeds in high school, he was not able to get scholarship.

Lately his family is facing financial problems that prevent his father from paying the university fees for him, therefore Hazem had to apply for an education loan to cover the semester fees and achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to cover his semester fees for a degree in Business Administration

loans.name: Sirvard

texts.en:
Sirvard lives in Armash village in the Ararat region with her husband and two sons. Their family cultivates cabbages, apricots and grapes and sells in the local markets. They also keep livestock including cows, an ox and hens.

Sirvard requested this loan to pay for renovation of her barn and forage for feeding her livestock. It would be very helpful for the family's farming business and Sirvard hopes to receive lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of her barn and forage for feeding her livestock.

loans.name: Kastriot

texts.en:
Kastriot is 31 years old and soon to be married and start his own family, as per his statement; so far, he's been living with his elderly parents and will continue to live with them, even after he gets married. He had been living in Greece for the past few years, but is back now for good and planning to start a mini-farm with cows.

Kastriot's family owns about 5500 dynym agricultural land where he plants fodder for the animals and in some other 5 dynym land that his sister has given him to use it, he uses it as pasture for the animals. Currently he's got a dairy cow with a calf, 2 sows and 20 chickens.

To earn a living he sells about 4.5 liters of raw milk a day in the farmer's market and also sells piglets. Since rural activity is the only source of income, Kastriot wanted to add two more dairy cows with the loan that he is requesting from you.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows and fodder for the winter

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 29 years old, married and a happy father of one daughter from the Iganga district in eastern Uganda. After his secondary education he earned a certificate in Agriculture and went on to growing maize and beans that he sold at local markets. Using his savings he became a supplier selling farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, pesticides and improved seeds to farmers in rural communities.

While working with a local community-based organization in his village, Simon was identified as a candidate for a youth energy promotional campaign that was being championed by an NGO in the eastern part of the country. After observing a number of different types of stoves, he became interested in starting a clean energy business. He began to sell UpEnergy products such as charcoal stoves and water filters. He currently makes a small profit but realizes that people in his community are saving more on efficient fuel usage. He now plans to scale up his business.

Simon is proud to be able to improve the livelihoods of people in communities who are able to save from improved fuel use. These savings are being channeled into other expenses such as school fees for children and housing expenses. His aspiration is to grow his business and become self-reliant as well as employ more youths by training them on the benefits of entrepreneurship and the need to conserve and protect the environment.

A 12,590,000 UGX loan will allow Simon to increase his inventory of stoves and lease a tricycle that will make it easy for him to reach rural communities. By not having to travel as often to replenish his stock in stoves and reducing transportation costs, he will see an improvement in his take-home earnings.

loans.use: to increase his stove inventory and lease a tricycle, making it easier to reach rural communities.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is 54 years old and is married to Florence. Together they have three children and live in the informal settlement of Nairobi, Viwandani with his family. He is employed as a driver and the family operates a milling machine business.

Jeremiah wants to improve the sanitation standards within his residential area by installing a fresh life toilet which he learnt about from a neighboring friend. His friend has installed a fresh life toilet.

Helping Jeremiah install this toilet, will not only be a source of income for him but help to improve sanitation in the area.

loans.use: to pay for one Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.name: Speed Group

texts.en:
After her husband’s death, life seemed meaningless for Terefina, since she solely relied on him. With three children who were still in school, this was a huge wake-up call for her. Terefina had to venture into cross-border trading and would travel to foreign lands such as South Africa and Botswana, where she had never thought she would go. She would buy different clothes and shoes. Because she was inexperienced, she incurred high import costs, as the Zimbabwe Revenue Authority would charge exorbitant import duty fees. This made it more difficult for her to sell to her clients, since the clothing would now be more expensive and it would take more than two months to get full repayment.

She was lost in the dark, but as a mother, she had to provide for her children. That is when it dawned on her that a friend of hers who was also widowed seemed to make ends meet by selling fish. She went to her friend for help, and in no time they were travelling together to a nearby lake called Lake Chivero to buy fish. They would leave their houses as early as 4:00 a.m. so that they could buy straight from the fishermen and cut out the middleman to reduce cost. They would then walk door to door selling the fish in their neighbourhood.

The fish business has proven worthwhile for Terefina, as she has been able to pay rentals and school fees for her children. She even managed to celebrate all her children’s birthdays this year and has been saving small amounts for Christmas gifts for them. Since their father died, this will be the first year that they will have been able to celebrate birthdays and Christmas.

Terefina is now 36 years old and has joined hands with fellow neighbours in Kuwadzana 5, a high-density suburb in Harare, to form a group called ‘Speed’. They have completed training on financial literacy and group dynamics, and they are now applying for a loan of $900 to boost their businesses.

Terefina needs $300 to enable her to buy the fish in bulk, since her customer base has increased and she is frequently running out of stock these days.

loans.use: to buy fish in bulk, since her customer base has increased and she is frequently running out of stock these days.

loans.name: Kigaga Bakyara Kweyombeka Group

texts.en:
The group was mobilized, trained and they have requested their first loan from UGAFODE Microfinace. They are 12 members doing different activities ranging from cattle rearing, goat breeding, farming and petty trade. This loan will help them to run their businesses, highlight the support to the family economy and improve their living conditions. They organize jobs selling food stuffs to strengthen the work and integration of the participants, which has brought an improvement to the relationships of the members. Until now, they have been working with their own money but hope to have the opportunity to begin to grow with the help of Kiva funds through their partner UGAFODE. Each member contributes to their home and develops a business that provides them an income. They have formed the group to do jobs, support each other and get additional income to save and boost their businesses.

One of the group members is the president, Sylvia. She has four children and supports both them and the man of the house who is attending school. She works mainly in sewing women's clothing, which will be on demand this season, and selling it in the community. She trains and enjoys the opportunities to support her associates and her family and has dreams of being successful. Sylvia's family has few resources and they live in a social bond house. With this opportunity she hopes to improve the living conditions of her family.

They are looking to fully develop their business and want to participate in community and regional activities. They hope to receive the support of UGAFODE Microfinance to participate in fairs and other similar activities. Sylvia will invest in buying materials that she will use to make clothes to sell during the festive season, increasing her sales and profit.

loans.use: to buy material stock to make clothes.

loans.name: Juila

texts.en:
Juila is 30, married, and has 3 children. She and her husband have a small clothing project and Julia is requesting 3,000 EGP to buy winter clothing for the season.

She will use the loan to expand their project and guarantee better living conditions for their children.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing for the season.

loans.name: Kayimbaya Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KAYIMBAYA” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Villa Tejada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Hermenegilda es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, venta de frutas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Hermenegilda es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “KAYIMBAYA” communal bank will be starting its third lending cycle with Pro Mujer as a part of Centro Focal Villa Tejada. The communal bank is made up of eight members and is overseen by a board of directors, of which señora Hermenegilda is the president. The members' businesses are varied and include vegetable sales and fruit sales.

The loan they are taking out will benefit small, micro-entrepreneurs, of whom señora Hermenegilda is one. She says that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago at the invitation of a friend, who is a client of the institution. Señora Hermenegilda currently has a business selling fruit. She says that she learned the business from her mother a number of years ago.

The loan señora Hermenegilda is taking out is to increase her capital. She will purchase wholesale vegetables from the wholesale vendors in El Alto and later sell them from her sales stall. This line of work allows her to generate income to help her family financially; señora Hermenegilda is married.

When asked what she likes most about Pro Mujer, señora Hermenegilda says that she likes the education and health training offered by the institution.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale vegetables.

loans.name: Eshnazar

texts.en: Eshnazar is from the Shahrituz region is a nice and caring man. He is married and has lovely children. He makes a living by growing farm produce, mainly vegetables. On his field he has planted several types of vegetables. He sells vegetables at the market and supports himself and his family in this way. However, to obtain a good harvest, he needs to use mineral fertilizers. Eshnazar has insufficient funds to buy fertilizers and thus he has applied for a loan, hoping for your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Amigas Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMIGAS EMPRENDEDORAS” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Eimy es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de masitas, venta de chamarras, venta de muebles, venta de comida, venta de panderos.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Eimy es integrante, ella indica que integra Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de empanadas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió su amiga y hace varios años que decide emprender su propio negocio, quien le ayuda en su negocio es su hijo mayor.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de harina y azúcar por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The group "Amigas Emprendedoras" (Enterprising Friends) will begin it's second term in Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal Santiago II. It is made up of eight members and run by a governing board with Eimy as president. The businesses of the members are varied, such as selling pastry, jackets, furniture, food and hand drums.

The loan they are requesting will benefit small businesses where Eimy is a member. She says she joined Pro Mujer by invitation of a friend who is a client of the organization. She currently has a business selling empanadas. She says she learned this business from a friend several years ago and decided to start her own business with the help of her oldest son.

The loan she is getting will give her more capital to buy flour and sugar wholesale from wholesalers in the city of El Alto and then make products for resale. This work will allow her to bring in income to support her family financially as she is married with three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health services and training offered by the organization.

loans.use: to buy flour wholesale.

loans.name: Monic's Group

texts.en:
Monic's group is comprised of two hardworking women. Monic is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. 

For the past two years, Monic has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells home-use items like sugar, rice, and beans. 

To help expand her business, Monic has requested a loan of UGX 600,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used for more essentials to be sold in the shop and a weighing machine.  It will help Monic to generate greater profits and complete some rooms in her house at home. 

Monic hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business into a supermarket so as to employ more workers, hence creating more jobs in the community. 

Monic is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more essentials fpr her shop and a weighing machine

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 17 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past two years, Juliet has been working hard to manage her boutique business, which sells both adult and kids clothes. To help expand her business, Juliet has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy both adult and children's clothes to stock for the festive season. This will help Juliet to generate greater profits and pay for her sister's school tuition fee. Juliet hopes that in the future she will be able to she hopes to move away from home and rent a house of her own. 

Juliet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy stock of clothes to sell during the festive season,

loans.name: Vanisha's Group

texts.en:
Vanisha's group is comprised of 3 hardworking women. Vanisha is 22 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 6 years, Vanisha has been working hard to manage her drug shop, which sells medicine.

To help expand her business, Vanisha has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more drugs, which will expand her drug shop and help her to employ more workers. This will help Vanisha to generate greater profits and to pay the school tuition fee for her child. Vanisha hopes that in the future she will be able to further her studies in clinical medicine.

Vanisha is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more drugs, which will expand her drug shop and help her to employ more workers,.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past three years, Hellen has been working hard to manage her vegetable stall, which sells fresh vegetables. To help expand her business, Hellen has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add more types of vegetables which will increase her sales, and will help Hellen to generate greater profits. She wants to pay for her trading licence and hopes that in the future she will be able to purchase a plot of land. 

Hellen is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to add more types of vegetables to her vegetable stall which will increase her sales

loans.name: Abibu

texts.en:
Abibu is a 39-year-old married man with 6 children all living in Fort Portal Uganda. He is a farmer growing bananas on a large scale and selling produce. He started these businesses way back in 2007 with a hope of earning an income for his family. He is challenged by low capital which limits him from attaining his goal of expanding his business and raising more profit to educate all of his children to higher levels of learning.

Abibu has asked for a loan to help him pay the school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Dukangukirumurimo Subgroup C

texts.en:
