Francois is 28 and single. He is also the leader of this group called Dukangukirumurimo, which means “Concentrate On Our Work” in English. They are all in different retail businesses and wish to develop them for the sake of their futures. He has now applied for a 3,950,000 RWF group loan through Kiva's field partner Urwego Opportunity Bank.

For the past three years Francois has made and sold pancakes. With his portion of the loan he will buy more sugar and flour to make them. The profits from his business will be used to grow it and put toward renovating his house.

As their name says, the group members all wish to work hard to develop their businesses and provide for their families.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and flour to make the pancakes that he sells.

loans.name: Zhirayr

texts.en:
Greeting from Getashen village of Armavir region. Here is Zhirayr, 42 years old farmer, and father of two infant chidlren.

He lives together with his elderly retired parents, wife and two kids. He has been involved in farming business for already 8 years. Zhirayr grows grape and peach that he sells at the local markets.

He now wants to enlarge his farm and get involved in livestock breeding. Zhirayr requested this loan to purchase 5 oxen, forage for feeding the livestock, and fertilizer for land cultivation. He hopes to receive lenders' support and enlarge his farm.

loans.use: to pay for 5 oxen, forage for feeding the livestock and fertilizer for land cultivation .

loans.name: Albana

texts.en:
Albana is very poor according to the national poverty level. She is 33 years old and has three children, 4 and 8 years old boys and a 10-month-old girl and she is in the photograph with the two younger ones. Despite the fact that they live in a village, they don't own any land to practice rural activities like the majority of rural families. Their only source of income is that of her husband who works in a nearby dairy farm for a monthly pay of $180 and $88, a monthly disability income of their older son who was born with some disabilities.

" We have been sleeping on the floor for so very many years. We've just put some cardboard and other old blankets and staff to sleep. Now, we thought to buy two sofa beds, one to be a bed for the children and one for me and my husband and the little one," said Albana to the loan officer who visited her family in their home.

loans.use: Albana's family has been sleeping on the floor and they want to buy two sofa beds; one for herself and husband and little one and one for both other children.

loans.name: Eastland School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda!   This is Martin, the head teacher of Eastland Secondary School, a mixed school in the urban area of Nansana in Wakiso, with 150 students. 

Eastland School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children.

Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Eastland School will repay their loan from school fees, which it collects each term. 

Martin ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children who fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increasing the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To buy a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 23 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has three children (two of them currently in school). For the past six years, Mary has been working hard to manage her beauty salon.

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more braids, hair weaves and a hair dryer and will help Mary to generate greater profits and complete her kids' school tuition fees. Mary hopes that she will be able to build a good commercial house for herself in the future.

Mary is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more braids, hair weaves and a hair dryer

loans.name: Viola's Group

texts.en:
Viola's group is comprised of two hardworking women.  Viola is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past two years, Viola has been working hard to manage her boutique business, which deals in kids wear. 

To help expand her business, Viola has requested a loan of UGX 300,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more fashionable clothes to attract her customers.  It will help Viola to generate greater profits and help her family by buying them basic needs for home use. 

Viola hopes that in the future she will be able to see her business grow, so that she can become a boss and start employing workers. 

Viola is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase for more fashionable clothes to attract her customers,

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen de 64 años de edad, vive de manera humilde en vivienda propia, y para cubrir sus gastos se dedica a la elaboración de tamales de gallina los cuales vende de manera ambulante en su comunidad, así también en las comunidades vecinas. Y gracias a que cuenta con aproximadamente 11 años de dedicarse a este negocio, es muy reconocida y cuenta con un numero bastante grande de clientes que prefieren de su comida típica tan deliciosa. En vista que sus clientes han aumentado tiene la necesidad de aumentar la producción de los tamales y es por ello que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: maíz, consomé, salsas, etc. ollas y recipientes de mayor tamaño para aumentar la producción de tamales y de esta manera aumentar las ventas. También Carmen se encuentra muy agradecida con el crédito anterior ya que gracias a ello pudo invertir en mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo.
texts.en: Carmen is 64 years old. She lives in a humble manner in her own home. In order to cover her expenses she makes chicken tamales which she sells as a street vendor in her community as well as neighboring communities. And thanks to the approximately 11 years of experience in this business, she is well-known and has a rather large number of customers that prefer her delicious, traditional food. Seeing that her customers have increased, she needs to increase her tamale productions. Therefore she seeks a loan from FUSAI to invest in corn, consume, salsas, etc. and large pots and containers in order to increase her tamale production.  Carmen is very grateful for the previous loan as thanks to that loan she was able to invest in improving her home by replacing the roof.

loans.use: to invest in corn, consume, salsas, etc. and large pots and containers in order to increase her tamale production.

loans.name: La Realeza Group

texts.es:
Laura es una mujer de 25 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos de 1, 6, 9 y 10 años, y su negocio es la venta de artesanías en Saó.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente y muy luchadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘Paurito’ situado a 30 kilómetros de la ciudad, que ostenta con orgullo su condición de santuario mundial de la Palmera de Sao, tesoro vegetal que abarca 750 hectáreas de tierra y que es fuente centenaria de la materia prima para fabricar el famoso sombrero de sao. 
Laura es de tez morena, cabello negro largo y físico robusto (sentada, la primera de la izquierda, viste blusa rosada con flores), su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla dentro de su entorno familiar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la agricultura y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto propio construido de madera con piso de tierra y techo de calamina que cuenta sólo con energía eléctrica no tiene agua potable ni alcantarillado porque los servicios no llegaron al lugar. La banca continúa trabajando con la institución, algunos socios se retiraron porque cumplieron sus metas, el resto sigue buscando la manera de mejorar sus actividades, es por eso que Laura lidera la banca. Su negocio es la venta de artesanía en Saó, el Saó es la palma de un árbol del lugar con el que se realizan sombreros de todo tamaño, individuales para mesas de comedor, carteras, canastas, muñecas, jarrones, bisutería, vinchas, llaveros y cotillones para cumpleaños, “el 90 por ciento de las familias del lugar teje la palmera, hacemos -cuando hacen el encargo- hasta vestidos con este tejido del saó…” comenta. Su negocio es exitoso porque es el único lugar donde se comercializa y desarrolla esta artesanía. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con épocas de ventas fuertes, la desventaja es la falta de capital de operación. Su sueño es abrir una tienda grande para vender artesanías dentro del mercado, ella desea comprar material de trabajo como; palmeras de Saó, pegamento, Hilos y otros. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Laura solicita un préstamo para comprar material de trabajo para realizar artesanía con palmeras de Saó.
texts.en:
Laura is 25 years old and lives with her husband and four children ages 1, 6, 9, and 10. Her business is selling artisan products made of palm. She is enterprising, independent, and very hard-working. Her business is located in Paurito, located 30 kilometers from the city. The area is proud of its position as a global sanctuary of the Sao palm, a treasured plant on 750 hectares of land and is a source of primary materials in order to make the famous sao hat (palm hat).

Laura has a dark complexion, long dark hair, and is physically robust. In the photo she is seated the first on the left, wearing the pink floral blouse. Her first language is Guaraní, which she speaks with family and she speaks Spanish in the greater community and in her business. She shares her life with her husband who is a farmer, and with her children, who attend school. They live in their own room built of wood with a dirt floor and laminate roof. They have one source of electricity, they do not have potable water or sewer.

Some of the members withdrew because they have met their goal; the rest continue seeking to improve their work. Therefore Laura leads the bank. Her business is selling artisan products made of palm. Palm is a tree from which all sizes of hats are made, placemats for dining tables, wallets, baskets, dolls, costume jewelry, hairbands, keychains, and other items. “90% of the families here weave palm, and we even make, upon request, dresses from palm, “ she shares.

Her business is successful because it is the only place that sells and makes these artisan products. The advantage for her business is that she can count on seasons of strong sales. The challenge is the lack of working capital. Her dream is to open a large store to sell the products inside the market. She wishes to buy materials to work with such as palms, glue, thread, and other items. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the 10 years that she has had this business.

It is for these reasons that Laura seeks a loan to buy materials to make artisan products from palm. She is enterprising,

loans.use: to buy materials to make artisan products from palm leaf.

loans.name: Marvely Francisca

texts.es: Marvely de 22 años de edad, vive al lado de su hijo de 2 años de edad y demás integrantes de su familia. Ella es madre soltera y es una mujer muy trabajadora y dedicada a su familia. Desde hace varios años se dedica a la administración de una tienda en su localidad, es así como mantiene la economía de su hogar. Marvely solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: azúcar, aceite, consomé, golosinas, bebidas gaseosas, jugos, etc. para aumentar las ventas en su negocio y así poder darle todo lo necesario a su hijo.
texts.en: 22-year-old Marvely lives with her two-year-old child and other members of her family. She is a single mother and a hardworking woman who is devoted to her family. For a number of years, she has been running a shop in her district and that is how she covers the household expenses. Mravely is applying to FUSAI for this loan to buy sugar, oil, soup, sweets, fizzy drinks, fruit juices, etc. to boost her sales and provide for all her child's needs.

loans.use: to buy sugar, oil, soup, sweets, fizzy drinks, fruit juices etc., to boost her sales.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is 46 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Esmeralda works very hard to provide for them.

Esmeralda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, personal product care, and other groceries.

Esmeralda has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Esmeralda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, personal product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Twegerane Acb Sub Group B

texts.en:
Liberatha is a group leader, 44 years old. She is married with 7 children aged 8 and 24 years. The younger ones all attend schools. The group is called TWEGERANE which means “squeezed” in English. They sell different items and they wish to expand their business for a better future.

Liberatha owns a shop and has been doing in a business for the past 5 years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more cooking oil, rice, sugar and salt for sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and buy goats for rearing.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, rice, sugar and salt for selling.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 45 year old married man living in Fort Portal Uganda. For the past 5 years, John has been working as a farmer growing tea. He started by working at a tea factory and with savings from his salary, bought land and started his own tea plantation. He is responsible for his children's school fees and providing for their basic needs.

John is challenged by unpredictable price changes and fluctuating weather conditions, hindering him from achieving his goal of building a permanent house. John has asked for a loan to enable him to improve his tea estate by buying manure and applying it in order to yield good results.

loans.use: to improve his tea estate by buying manure and applying it in order to yield good results.

loans.name: Edison

texts.en:
Edison is seeking credit to pay school fees for his child and to buy cocoa to sell. He is a hardworking married man with one child, living in Bundibugyo-Uganda. 

is a determined man looking at educating his only child to the university and supporting him till he gets a job to sustain himself. He says that an education is the best thing he can offer his child because he never got the chance to go to school. 

His business aspiration is to become a model cocoa farmer in his area, which makes him work hard towards attaining it.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his child and buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Kibingo

texts.en: Kibingo is requesting a loan to buy land for farming. He is married with 7 children and living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. This is a man who vowed to educate his children till they get a minimum qualification to sustain them, which will make him retire as a happy man. He is a cocoa farmer who supplements his harvests with what he buys from other farmers to make bigger sales at the end of the day. On seeing that cocoa has enabled him achieve a lot in his life, Kibingo now requests a loan to buy land for growing cocoa so as to increase his harvest and his income. He complains of seasonality changes on top of fluctuation of cocoa prices.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Nashibiso School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Michael. He is the Head teacher of Nashibiso School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Nashibiso in Mbale with 1000 students. Nashibiso School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Nashibiso School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Michael ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
Rogelio es un joven de 19 años de edad es soltero vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en una comunidad de Sololá.
Rogelio para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia trabaja como jornalero desde hace 5 años, gracias al esmero y dedicación que le pone a su trabajo no hay ningún solo día que se quede sin trabajo. Rogelio a pesar de ser muy joven le preocupa la estabilidad de su familia, por esa razón a considerado necesario realizar un préstamo para la compra de materiales y remodelar su casa, ya que se encuentra en muy malas condiciones. Su mayor anhelo es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
19-year-old Rogelio is single and lives with his parents and his siblings in a town in Sololá department. He has worked as a day labourer for 5 years which enables him to have income and to support his family. Thanks to the attention and dedication he puts into his work, not for single day has he ever not had work. Although Rogelio is very young, he is concerned about his family's welfare and it is for that reason that he feels it necessary to take out a loan to buy materials and to renovate his home, as it is currently in a very bad state of repair. His great ambition is to improve his family's quality of life.

Rogelio para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia trabaja como jornalero desde hace 5 años, gracias al esmero y dedicación que le pone a su trabajo no hay ningún solo día que se quede sin trabajo. Rogelio a pesar de ser muy joven le preocupa la estabilidad de su familia, por esa razón a considerado necesario realizar un préstamo para la compra de materiales y remodelar su casa, ya que se encuentra en muy malas condiciones. Su mayor anhelo es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: to buy building materials to renovate his home.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel is 25-years-old farmer from the village of Noramarg in the Ararat region.
He lives with his mother, twin brother, wife, and infant son. The family's only occupation is in agriculture. They cultivate greens and tomatoes, and they keep cattle, oxen, and hens.
The family's income comes from the sale of milk, eggs, greens, and tomatoes in the market.
Samvel says that lately the main challenge he faces is the lack of sufficient capital to take advantage of business opportunities.
Samvel asks for this loan to purchase a calf and forage for feeding the livestock. This will help him to invest in his farming business and to develop it, so his family has better living opportunities.

loans.use: to pay for a calf and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Iganga High School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Godfrey. He is the Head teacher of Iganga High School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Iganga Town with 2277 students. Iganga High School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 1000 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Iganga High School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Godfrey ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 23, single and works in wall paintings and pre-painting preparations. He previously requested 5,000 EGP loan from TADE and successfully repaid it on the due dates. He is requesting another 5,000 EGP loan to buy tools such as painting rollers, paints, and brushes to attract more customers and increase his income to save for his marriage.

loans.use: To buy tools such as painting rollers, paints, and brushes.

loans.name: Clever's Origin Bundibugyo School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Jackson, the head teacher of Clever's Origin Primary School, a mixed school in a rural area of Bundibugyo, with 180 students. 

Clever's Origin School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. 

Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Clever's Origin School will repay the loan from school fees, which it collects each term. 

Jackson ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increasing the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Centro Corapata 2 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CENTRO CORAPATA 2” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Marlene es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de golosinas, venta de queso, venta de parquet, venta de leche, venta de chamarras deportivas, servicio de transporte. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Marlene es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer por la invitación de una promoción de la institución que se realizó en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de dulces; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de dulces por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Centro Corapata 2 Group will begin their second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the "Centro Focal Copacabana". 

The group is made up of 8 members and is governed by a board of directors with Marlene as the President. The businesses among the group are varied, among them are: candy sales, cheese sales, selling parquet, milk sales, sporting shirt sales and transportation services. 

The loan will help small businesses that are a part of the group where Marlene is a member. 

She joined Pro Mujer through the invitation of an advertisement the institution was doing in her area. Currently she has a business selling candy. She started the business by herself several years ago. 

She is requesting a loan to increase her capital (to buy candy at wholesale) which she will buy from wholesalers in the city of El Alto and sell in her stall. 

This type of work allows her to generate income to help her family financially. She is single and has three children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she says she likes the training offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy candy at wholesale.

loans.name: Duteraninkunga Sub Group B

texts.en:
Duteraninkunga is a group led by Marie Claire who is 61 years old. The group name means “Support each other” in English. Marie Claire has been a group leader for two years. She owns a bar and she has been running this business for the past four years. The group members sell different items and they all share the same goal of working hard to expand their businesses.

With the loan, Marie Claire would like to buy more beer for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve their standards of living.

loans.use: To buy more beer for sale.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past two years, Florence has been working hard to manage her beauty salon, which she owns.

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock new hair braids and weaving to be used in the festive season. This will help Florence to generate greater profits. She will use some of the money to pay her workers at the beauty salon.

Florence hopes that in the future she will be able to own a bigger beauty salon and employ more workers.

Florence is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to stock new hair braids and weaving to be used in the festive season.

loans.name: Duteraninkunga Sub Group A

texts.en:
Venantie, aged 47, is a group leader. She is married and has six children aged between 15 and 25 years. The group is called DUTERANINKUNGA meaning “Let's Support each other” in English. Most of the group members own retail shops and sell different items and they wish to expand their businesses in order to improve their standards of living.

Venantie owns a small shop and has been running this business for the past 22 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more milk, cakes, sugar and soft drinks for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy more milk, cakes, sugar and soft drinks for sale.

loans.name: Nsagasa Farmers Group

texts.en:
Joshua a member of Nsagasa Farmers Group where members guarantee each other in case of borrowing and loan repayment. His main work is teaching in a primary school where he works 5 hours a day and the rest of his time he is busy selling produce and matooke the business he has been doing for over 4 years now.

He started all this with a vision of raising more income to support his family. However, limited capital and price fluctuations are hindering him from attaining his goal of expanding his produce business. Joshua has asked for a Kiva loan to enable him buy stock of rice, beans and posho for selling during this festive season.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, beans and posho for selling during this festive season.

loans.name: Elly

texts.en:
Elly is 42 years old, a senior bachelor and a father of two children. He operates a business of phone accessories which he has done for 10 years. He started by repairing phones and managed to get capital to start up a phone business.

At this time he is faced with a challenge of limited capital to stock latest phones on market which are also so expensive and his customers are demanding for them. He is requesting for a loan to buy more latest phones to sell and increase his income levels.

loans.use: to buy phones for selling

loans.name: Hadeel

texts.en:
This 20 year old girl is Hadeel who lives in Ramtha. She is studying at the university majoring in Business Administration. Hadeel has dreamed of becoming a good manager since her childhood.

Hadeel applied for a loan with great hopes as she needs to pay her tuition. Your help will allow her to continue her education and reach her goal. Hadeel extends his gratitude in advance.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition in Business Administration

loans.name: Ararat

texts.en:
Ararat is farmer from Koghb village of Tavush region. With his family: his wife and two kids, Ararat has been involved in agriculture. He cultivates plum trees as well as keeping two piglets, a calf and hens.

Ararat transports and sells the harvest using his own truck. Currently the truck is damaged and there is some renovation work needed, so Ararat will be able to use it in the work. The requested loan will help Ararat to pay for renovation of the truck and purchase a cow.

This loan will greatly help him to continue running his agribusiness and earn income for his family.
Ararat hopes to see his farm developed and works hard to reach his goal.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the truck to be able to continue transporting and selling harvest in the market, and purchase a cow

loans.name: Bugisu School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Martin. He is the Head Teacher of Bugisu High School, a mixed school in the rural area of Mbale with 500 students. Bugisu School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Bugisu School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Martin ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Super School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Benison. He is the Head Teacher of Super Primary School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Mutukula in Bundibugyo with 600 students.

Super School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Super School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Benison ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Vilma Yanira

texts.es:
Vilma, de 46 años de edad, está casada, su esposo trabaja en la agricultura y tienen 5 hijos. 

Vilma, decidió iniciar su propio negocio desde hace 2 años, todo inicio gracias a una amiga que le enseño a trabajar en la venta de mariscos y con un poco de dinero prestado por un familiar inicio su venta; el negocio ha funcionado muy bien y está vez necesita dinero para invertir más.

Vilma, necesita el préstamo para comprar maricos para vender en las comunidades más cercanas. 

Su sueño es comprar un vehículo para vender mariscos en otros municipios y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Vilma, 46 years old, is married. Her husband works in agriculture, and they have 5 children. Vilma decided to start her own business 2 years ago. This all started thanks to a friend who showed her how to work in seafood sales. With some money borrowed from a family member, she began her business.

The business has gone very well, and this time she needs money to invest more. Vilma needs a loan to buy seafood to sell in nearby communities. Her dream is to buy a vehicle to sell seafood in other cities and increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy seafood and sell it in the nearby communities.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is 22 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past 4 years, Aisha has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sales clothes.

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add different types of clothes to attract more customers, and will help Aisha to generate greater profits and to supplement her business. Aisha hopes that in the future she will be able to own a plot of land and build a commercial house.

Aisha is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to add different types of clothes to attract more customers.

loans.name: 29 De Enero Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “29 DE ENERO” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Santiago II, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de salchipapa (comida rapida), venta de colchas, venta de chamarras, venta de celulares, carnicería, venta de papel higiénico, venta de cuadros de pintura.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juana es integrante, ella que ingreso a Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de cuadros de pintura; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su esposo hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de cuadros por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “29 de Enereo” (29th of January) communal bank will be starting is fifth lending cycle with Pro Mujer as a part of Centro Focal Santiago II. The communal bank is made up of nine members and is overseen by a board of directors, of which señora Juana is the president. The members' businesses are varied and include: selling hot-dogs and fries (fast food), quilt sales, jacket sales, cell phone sales, running a butcher shop, selling toilet paper and selling paintings.

The loan they are taking out will benefit small, micro-entrepreneurs, of whom señora Juana is one. She joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of a friend, who is a client of the institution. Señora Juana currently has a business selling paintings. She says that she learned the business from her husband a number of years ago.

The loan she is taking out is to increase her capital. She will purchase wholesale paintings from the sellers in El Alto and later sell them in the markets around El Alto. This line of work allows her to generate an income to help her family financially; Señora Juana is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, señora Juana says that she likes the health education and the training offered by the institution.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale paintings.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is 23 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past 4 years, Aisha has been working hard to manage her hardware shop, which deals in construction supplies.

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more, different construction items to increase her sales. This will help Aisha to generate greater profits and she will be able to buy a metal door to complete the kitchen in her house.

Aisha hopes that in the future she will be able to open up another hardware shop in the nearby trading center.

Aisha is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more and different construction items to increase her sales.

loans.name: Nuby

texts.en:
Nuby is 16 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Nuby has been working hard to manage her boutique business, which deals in clothes for both adults and kids.

To help expand her business, Nuby has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase her stock of clothes and even to add bed sheets, which will increase her sales and help her to generate greater profits and help out her family with basic needs like food. Nuby hopes that in the future she will be able to open another standard boutique in town, which will help create more jobs in the community.

Nuby is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to increase her stock of clothes and even to add bed sheets, which will increase her sales,.

loans.name: Duterimbere Group

texts.en:
Drocelle is 42 years old, and is married with four children, who are between ten and 24 years old. She is well-known in the business of bananas, which she has been doing for about five years.

Drocelle is the president of this group, DUTERIMBERE, which in local language means "being developed." She is the one who has a book in her hands in the second row.

Drocelle's hours for selling bananas are from 6:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. every day. She wants to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase a large quantity of bananas for sale.

With the profit from this loan, Drocelle will be able to purchase enough food for the family, to save for the future, to buy new clothes and shoes for the children, to pay school fees for her children, to buy medical insurance for her family and to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of bananas for sale.

loans.name: Adelia

texts.en:
Adelia landed at a right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. 

She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet when went broke after her first business went bad. PMPC to Adelia came as a rescue for lending her money when she needed it the most. 

Now she has requested another loan for the next cropping season. She is borrowing an amount to pay for land preparation like plowing and harrowing and to purchase a good variety of seedlings for healthier, heavier, and more produce. 

Adelia perseveres and always believes that she will reach her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation like plowing and harrowing and to purchase a  good variety of seedlings for healthier, heavier. and more produce

loans.name: Esmaelita

texts.en:
Farming helped Esmaelita survive for her family. She also retails charcoal and brings sufficient income of PHP 60,000 per quarter. She found the business of farming very fulfilling.

Esmaelita plans to expand her farming business. She applied for a loan from PMPC for the needed capital. She wants to purchase rice seeds which will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. Esmaelita smiles at seeing all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds which will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.name: Artashes

texts.en:
Artashes is 40 years old farmer living in Darakert village of Ararat region. He lives with his elderly retired parents, wife and daughter. Besides his farming business, Artashes also works at local gas station as a laborer. He works hard to sustain his family's living and cover basic needs.
He cultivates cauliflower, greens and tomato in the greenhouse and sells the harvest at the local markets.

Artashes requested this loan to purchase green seeds, polyethylene cover for the greenhouse to prepare it for the winter season.

In the future, Artashes would like to expand the variety of vegetables growing on his farm.

loans.use: to pay for green seeds, polyethylene cover for the greenhouse to prepare it for the winter season.

loans.name: Paterno

texts.en:
Paterno is from Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. He and his wife have r ice land and earn a living doing farming activities. 

Recently, Paterno has requested a loan to pay for land preparation like plowing and harrowing and to purchase of a good variety of seedlings for healthier, heavier, and more produce. 

Paterno deeply wishes to save enough for his children's education.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation like plowing and harrowing and to purchase of good variety of seedlings for healthier, heavier, and more produce

loans.name: Indis Lisseth

texts.es:
Indis, de 31 años de edad, está casada y su esposo trabaja en la agricultura y tienen un hijo.

Indis, hace seis meses decidió colocar su propio negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos económicos de la familia, ella coloco una venta de platos típicos como riguas de maíz tierno con quesillo como relleno; este negocio gracias Dios va funcionando cada día mejor, los cliente han aumentado y sus ingresos también.

Indis, necesita el préstamo para comprar más elotes y comprar sillas y mesas para brindarle un mejor servicio para sus clientes. 

Indis, sueña con bríndale la mejor educación posible a su hijo, para que pueda mejorar su calidad de vida  atreves de los estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
31-year-old Indis is married with one son. Her husband works in agriculture.

Six months ago, she decided to set up her own business to help her husband with the household expenses. She set up a business selling typical local dishes such as sweetcorn tortillas filled with soft cheese.

Thanks to God, her business gets better every day, and her clientele has grown along with her income.

Indis, needs the loan to buy more corn on the cob and to buy tables and chairs to provide a better service for her customers.

Indis' dream is to give her son the best education possible, so that he can go to university and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more corn on the cob and to buy tables and chairs to offer a better service for her customers.

loans.name: San Antonio De Padua Group

texts.es:
Maria Petronila (la primera del lado derecho en la foto) es una madre que se esfuerza con el afán de que su familia no le haga falta nada, ella cuenta que con el apoyo del crédito compro más productos para su negocio, afortunadamente esto le dejo una buena ganancia, con este avance ella está muy contenta más no conforme, por esa razón solicita un nuevo préstamo junto a su grupo para comprar mercadería para su negocio ella comprara piñas, sandia, papaya.
Con esta siguiente inversión ella espera poder satisfacer mejor a sus clientes y mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Maria Petronila (the first on the right in the photo) is a mother who does not want her family to lack anything.

The first loan allowed her to buy more products for her business.

Fortunately she gained a good profit which made her very happy but not satisfied.

This is why she is requesting a new loan with her group to buy merchandise for her business. She will buy pineapples, watermelons and papayas.

With this second loan she hopes to better satisfy her clients and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy fruits like: pineapples, watermelons and papayas.

loans.name: Marilia

texts.en:
Marilia is an artisan from Brazil who specializes in leather jewelry. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of leather and metal.

Marilia has been selling through NOVICA since 2002. This is her story:
"My designs are meant to be used at all times of day and they are chic, original and feminine. I try to give meaning to my materials by maximizing their forms, textures and translucence so that each piece is versatile, well finished and sophisticated. I call my line 'bijoulherias' (from the Portuguese 'bijouteria', meaning costume jewelry, and 'joalheria', referring to fine jewelry). This term came to me in a dream and it describes my designs as a blend of costume and fine jewelry."



"I am profoundly grateful for your support through this microcredit. It will allow me to continue crafting while growing my business."



Use the link below to view Marilia's leather jewelry on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/3284

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of leather and metal.

loans.name: Guena

texts.en:
Guena is an artisan from Brazil who specializes in Brazilian trees, coasters and figurines made from gemstones. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of gemstones and wood.

Guena has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story:
"In 1980, I left a career as an accountant. I began as an artisan's assistant and a sculptor, and became fascinated with gems and crystals. Today, I travel throughout Brazil in search of crystals from Bahia, emeralds from Minas Gerais, and agates from Rio Grande do Sul. I realize I have experienced a great personal transformation. I have more patience for art than for logic!"

"This microcredit represents a huge source of support and motivation for me. In addition to providing capital, it reinforces my belief in my own work and pushes me to continue dedicating myself to my craft with enthusiasm and love. Many thanks to all of you."

Use the link below to view Guena's Brazilian gemstone trees, coasters and figurines on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/3766

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of gemstones and wood

loans.name: Maharramoy

texts.ru: Махаррамой благодарно за Вашу огромную поддержку. Она очень рада, что Вы поддерживаете ее. Махаррамой достигла своих целей. Она продвигает свою деятельность. Ей в работе помогает ее дети.  Иногда ее старший сын печет хлеб. У нее дружная и заботливая семья. Махаррамой еще раз обратилась за кредитом с целью отремонтировать свой дом. За счет кредита она купить стройматериалы для ремонта. Махаррамой верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Maharramoy is thankful for your enormous support. She is very glad that you are supporting her. Maharramoy achieved her goals and is advancing her business.

Maharramoy's children help her with her work. Sometimes her oldest son bakes bread. She has a friendly and caring family.

Maharramoy is applying for a loan to repair her house. With the money from the loan, she will buy construction materials for the repairs. Maharramoy trusts in you and your support.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair her house.

loans.name: Rosas De Paximaya Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS DE PAXIMAYA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Beatriz es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de queso, venta de mantas, servicio de construcción. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Beatriz es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un asesor que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de queso; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá y  hace varios años que decidió emprender su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para la compra de una vaca lechera que adquirirá de las vendedoras de una comunidad cercana, esta compra le beneficiará en el aumento de capital ya que podrá elaborar mas queso y así comercializarlo  en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella aún es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The. “ROSAS DE PAXIMAYA” community bank will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana Centro Focal. This group consists of 8 members and is directed by an executive board of which Beatriz is the Presidents. The members' businesses are varied: selling cheese, selling blankets, construction service.

The loan will benefit the small businesses of which Beatriz is a member. This is the first time joining Pro Mujer. She joined at the invitation of an assessor who is part of the institution. Today she has a business selling cheese. She learned this trade from her mother and some years ago she decided to start her own business. The loan will be used to buy a milk cow that she will acquire from the sellers in a nearby community. This purchase will benefit her with an increase in capital as she will be able to make more cheese. She will then sell it in community markets in El Alto city. This work will enable her to generate income to support her family economically, even as she is still single. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the healthcare that the institute offers.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Patulul Group

texts.en:
In the Nueva Esperanza community on the outskirts of the city of Patulul in the West Coast of Guatemala, where the climate is hot and coffee, fruit, sugarcane, and other items vital to the global economy are mass-produced, live the seven women of “Nueva Esperanza Patulul”, or “New Hope Patulul”, trust bank.

Maria, a woman with a warm and joyful spirit, is the elected treasurer of her group. She is 31 years of age and has a 9th grade education. With three children, ages 13, 10 and 3 and the two oldest studying in the local school, Maria is a mother and a business woman. She sells a variety of delicious foods on the street corners of her community. Week to week, her customers demand traditional “chuchitos” and tamales and chile rellenos with atol. In addition, she also raises ducks on her small property.

Maria plans to invest her loan in buying more animals, such as chickens, to expand her animal husbandry business, and also ingredients for her food sales. All of her work is for her children. This woman is dedicated to the success of her family, striving toward the best quality of life she can reach and overcoming poverty through her business efforts, with the support of Friendship Bridge and Kiva.

All of the ladies in this trust bank have children or grandchildren studying in primary and secondary school, working with their spouses to provide quality life for their families. To bring income to their families, these women run tortillerías, raise ducks and chickens, sell food and snacks such as icees, smoothies and tamales, and sell used clothing

In their first loan cycle as a part of Friendship Bridge, the women of Nueva Esperanza are very excited to start a journey of growth and prosperity in their businesses, moving forward and expanding their horizons with this opportunity. Thank you, Kiva, for making them capable of fulfilling their beautiful dreams!

loans.use: in buying more animals, such as chickens, to expand her animal husbandry business,

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia is 23 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children. For the past 4 years, Sylivia has been working hard to manage her bakery business, which sells bread and doughnuts.

To help expand her business, Sylivia has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase wheat, sugar, and another machine that will help in the baking business, and it will help Sylivia to generate greater profits. She will use her profits to provide for her kids. Sylivia hopes that in the future she will be able to open up many outlets to create employment for young people.

Sylivia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase wheat, sugar, and another machine that will help in the baking business,.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a rice grower in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities and earning as well for her family.

As a microfinance member of PMPC, she has sought financial help to pay for land preparation like plowing and harrowing, and to purchase of good variety of seedlings for healthier, heavier and more plentiful produce.

In the future, Susan wishes to become the supplier of rice grains in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation like plowing and harrowing, and for purchase of a good variety of seedlings for healthier, heavier and more plentiful produce.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria finds pleasure in doing her hog-raising business in Pagadian City.  Not only is she doing things she likes, but she also earns an income as well. 

At the age of 54 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full-fledged member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative for providing her capital in supporting her gardening activities. 

Recently, she applied a loan to purchase bags of animal feed. In the future, Gloria wishes to become a supplier of pork in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
In 2008, Remedios learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. Remedios tried her luck on doing a business focusing on her farming activities. 

She feels she owe her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. 

Remedios is requesting another loan to pay for land preparation like plowing and harrowing and to purchase of good variety of seedlings for healthier, heavier and more produce. This will help her farming income a big boost. 

Remedios looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation like plowing and harrowing and to purchase of good variety of seedlings for healthier, heavier, and more produce

loans.name: Delmira De Jesus

texts.es:
Delmira, de 26 de años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de tres años de edad, desde que se separo de su compañero de vida ha trabajado muy duro, para que no le falte nada a su hijo. 

Delmira, debido a la necesidad de generar ingresos para ella y si hijo, aprendió a hacer pan gracias a la ayuda de una amiga que le enseño y desde entonces se dedica a este negocio y elabora pan tres veces por semana.

Delmira, necesita el préstamo para comprar una amasadora de pan y cazuelas para mejorar su producción y vender en otras comunidades. 

Delmira, sueña con posicionar su negocio como uno de los mejores de la zona.
texts.en:
Delmira, 26 years old, is a single mother of a three-year-old son. Since separating from her life partner, she has worked very hard so that her son lacks for nothing.

Due to the need to generate income for her and her son, Delmira learned to make bread, with the help of a friend who taught her. Since then, she has been working in this business. She makes bread three times a week. 

Delmira needs a loan to buy a dough mixing machine and baking pans to improve her production and sell in other communities. Delmira dreams to position her business as one of the best in the area.

loans.use: to buy a dough mixing machine for bread and baking pans to improve her production.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia did not have the chance to study.  She is a widow, with three children, but that situation never stopped her from making the best for raising them.
 
The wife of her oldest son abandoned him with his three daughters (the ones in the picture).  From that moment they moved with Lucia, and she became like a mother to them.  The oldest of her granddaughters sells candies and tamales (a traditional dish made of corn) for paying her university studies as an engineer.
 
The one in the middle in the picture abandoned her secondary studies for lack of money.  Her biggest dream is to continue studying so she can become a chef. In the meanwhile she helps with the homework of her younger sister and with selling tamales.

The greatest dream of the family is to have a suitable house, where everyone has her own space, where they can live together in a healthy environment. But mainly they want to work hard to achieve the building of their house, to teach her children and granddaughters that no matter the difficulties if you are persistent, everything is possible.

loans.use: to build a house for her children and granddaughters and teach them that everything is possible

loans.name: Janilo

texts.en:
Janilo makes a living through his retailing business. He runs a rice production business in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur and earns a promising income to support his family. He has signed up his membership with PMPC to gain access to capitalization. He wants to increase his inventory.

Now, he has requested a loan to pay for land preparation like plowing & harrowing and purchase of good variety of seedlings for more, healthier and heavier produce.

Janilo hopes to sustain his business and dreams of sending all his children to school.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation like plowing & harrowing and purchase a good variety of seedlings for more, healthier and heavier produce.

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en:
Pedrita is 57 years old and lives in San Isidro, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children of adult age.

Pedrita earns a living from a hog raising business. She's been doing this activity for more than five years already. She earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month.

Pedrita requested a loan to be used to purchase 4 sacks of feed and vitamins for her hog raising business. She has been a member of PMPC for 10 years.

In the future, Pedrita hopes to expand her hog raising business and to become a major supplier for pig lechon in the area.

loans.use: to purchase 4 sacks of feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Las Kantutitas B Saavedra Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS KANTUTITAS B SAAVEDRA” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido y venta de mantas, servicio de construcción, venta de frazadas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maria es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción de la institución, que se realizó en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años con la ayuda de su mamá.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración, lo  comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.

En la foto no aparece la señora Gladys, ya que después del desembolso tuvo que ir a su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
The community bank. “LAS KANTUTITAS B SAAVEDRA” will begin its third cycle with Pro Mujef as part of the Centro Focal Panamericana. The group consists of 8 members and is directed by an executive board of which Maria is the president. The members have varied businesses: weaving and selling blankets, construction service, selling blankets. The loan will benefit these small businesses.

Maria joined Pro Mujer one year ago at the invitation of a promotion from the institution that was made in the area. Today she has a business weaving and selling blankets. She learned this trade years ago from her mother. The loan today will be used to increase capital in order to buy wool at wholesale from the wholesalers in El Alto city and then make and sell the blankets in the El Alto markets. This work will enable her to generate income to support her family, as she is married and has 5 children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training the institution offers.

Gladys is not in the photo as she had to go to her vendor stand after the disbursement.

loans.use: to buy wool at wholesale.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is 68 years old. She is known in the Calamba area for her vegetable growing business. She actively participates in the various programs and services that the coop offers. She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which she has applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and slats. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given priority, as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). She is thankful that all the financing needs of her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and slats for her house.

loans.name: Paulita

texts.en: Paulita, a responsible mother, has requested a loan from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to increase her rice production. She wants to purchase rice seeds that will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. This way, she will be able to sell more rice grains, which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds that will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a businesswoman in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 28 years old, married, and a microfinance member of PMPC. Janet runs a rice production business. Running this type of business has supported her family, especially in the education of her younger siblings. Recently, she has applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds that will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. She is thankful that she has signed up for membership with PMPC as her financing partner.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds that will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 45 years old. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Marjorie has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish and seafood to sell.

Marjorie has been in this business for five years. In the future, Marjorie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish and seafood to sell.

loans.name: Risa

texts.en:
Risa is 28 years old and married with two children. With both children in school, Risa works very hard to provide for them.

Risa has a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of groceries to sell. Risa has been in this business for eight years, and sells a variety of items such as sugar, canned goods and other groceries.

In the future Risa, would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gidion

texts.en:
Gidion, aged 64, is a married man. Four out of his six children attend school. He is involved in cocoa farming plus buying and selling from other farmers to increase his sales.

He ventured into business mainly to get income to look after his family. Because the cocoa season is at its peak, Gidion discovered that all his money was invested in cocoa and so at this time he does not have school fees for his children. He has requested a loan to pay school fees for his children ahead of the promotion term. The problem he faces is over-reliance on cocoa which is a seasonal product.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children ahead of the promotion term.

loans.name: Yamileth Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yamileth es una mujer emprendedora y carismática de cincuenta y tres años de edad, desde que las personas entran a su sala de belleza las recibe con una gran sonrisa, ella tiene veinte años de dedicarse al estilismo. Tener su propia sala le ha costado arduo trabajo a ella así como a su esposo y dos hijos, quienes son su principal apoyo. 
Ella ha solicitado un préstamo de Kiva junto a MiCrédito dado que en estos momentos, Yamileth, está captando nuevos clientes que buscan un cambio de apariencia, con dicho financiamiento pretende comprar maquillaje, shampoo, acondicionadores, cremas alisadoras, pinturas de uña, entre otras cosas que utiliza para llevar a cabo sus creaciones. Ella ha descubierto en MiCrédito y Kiva grandes aliados luego de este crédito piensa obtener otro que ocupara para mejorar la infraestructura de su local.
texts.en: Yamileth is an enterprising and charismatic 53 year old woman. People who enter her beauty salon receive a big smile. She has 20 years of experience as a stylist. Having her own salon has been hard work for her as well as her husband and two children, who are her primary support. She seeks a loan from Kiva through MiCredito now. Yamileth is capitalizing on new customers seeking a change of appearance. With the loan she intends to buy makeup, shampoo, conditioners, creams, nail polish, and other items that she will use to complete her creations.  She has discovered great support through MiCredito and Kiva, and she hopes to obtain another loan in the future to improve the infrastructure of her locale.

loans.use: to buy makeup, shampoo, conditioners, creams, nail polish, and other items.

loans.name: Wildian

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Wildian, who is a 25-year-old married with two sons and one daughter. Wildian has been selling food for fiveteen years. She has asked for a loan of IDR 7.200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build sanitation at their home to improve access to sanitation and water source for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but is enough to repay the loan received.
She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: This loan will be used to build sanitation at her home to improve access to sanitation and water for her family.

loans.name: Chrisantus

texts.en: Chrisantus is a 30 year old businessman living in Mukuru kwa Reuben. He is married and has two children. Given his love for education Chrisantus has started Mukuru Talent Academy, where he helps poor children from the informal settlement to get a high quality and affordable education. However, the biggest challenge to his venture has been the provision of hygienic sanitation to his children given the large school population. He is seeking financing for construction of one toilet to provide adequate sanitation in his school.

loans.use: To pay for One Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.name: Francisco Noe

texts.es:
Francisco, de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está soltero, se dedica a la agricultura y también trabaja como corralero en una ganadería del la zona y vive en casa de su madre.

Francisco,  trabaja en una ganadería de la zona, sale de su casa a las 2:30 a.m. para su trabajo ha ordeñar 25 vacas, después de eso hay que darles de comer y darles agua; también trabaja como agricultor y siembra una parcela de maíz para consumir y para vender.

Francisco, necesita el préstamo para comprar una vaca, para que su madre pueda elaborar productos lácteos a base de la leche que obtengan de la vaca.

Francisco, sueña con comprar una porción de tierra más grande, para poder cultivar más y si es posible también desea mejorar la vivienda de su madre.
texts.en:
Francisco is 28 years old and single. He studied through sixth grade and works in farming. He also works in the cattle industry as a ranch hand.

He leaves his mother's house, where he lives, at 2:30am to go to the farm in the area where he works. At work, he milks 25 cows, then gives them food and water. As he is also a farmer, he sows a plot of corn to consume and sell.

Francisco needs this loan to buy a cow so his mother can produce dairy products made from the cow's milk. Francisco hopes to buy a larger piece of land to farm more and, if possible, he hopes to better his mother's home.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Madzimai Ehumhare Group

texts.en:
Her passport knows the stamps of the immigration offices of Zimbabwe’s neighbouring countries intimately as it is always alternating monthly between borders. Her feet are intimately familiar with climbing aboard the buses which take her across the border. Before embarking on a journey, Shupikai kneels down with her children praying for God’s divine intervention that will guide the drivers in whose hands the passengers place their lives. She knows that she has to put fear aside as it will paralyze her operations, bringing her business to a standstill.

As most buses leave late afternoon, most cross border journeys are embarked during the night for various borders. While some are sleeping comfortably in their homes, every month Precious leaves the comfort of her home to “sleep” in either a bus or bus stations in neighbouring countries. She is a cross border trader who imports clothing, kitchenware and television sets for resale back home in Zimbabwe.

Shupikai is a 30-year-old married mother of four children. Three of her children are school-going at the primary education level. Her biggest motivation is the good performance of her children at school and she feels the need to work extra hard so as to be able to provide them with tertiary education in the future even though it is expensive to do so.

Her lack of qualifications and advanced education did not deter Shupikai, she decided to use her passport as her “tool” for success, crossing to neighbouring countries. She started buying and selling small items but can now buy bigger items and sell them to companies. Her sheer determination and hard work made her a proper candidate for the Chairlady post for the group Madzimai Ehumhare, a group based in Glenorah Harare. The group has applied for a second loan from Thrive and attended a one-off training offered to loan recipients focusing on marketing, strengthening group relations and leadership issues. Her first loan was used to start procuring bigger items like TV sets and furniture-like room dividers for resale.

Shupikai wants to use her loan to get more furniture for resale. She is planning to use her current loan to buy clothing and furniture for resale during the festive season when people are in the buying spirit after getting their “thirteenth cheque”.

loans.use: to buy clothing and furniture for resale during the festive season when people are in the buying spirit after getting their “thirteenth cheque”.

loans.name: Teresinha

texts.en:
Teresinha lives in Maliana, and she is a businesswoman. She has a very strong interest in doing business.

She has a small store, and she hopes to open a bigger store. Her capital is not enough, so she is requesting a loan of $ 1,000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business.

She has been involved in business activities since a few years ago with her own working capital, and she does her best on it. She will use this loan to buy additional items to keep in her store including hand and body lotion, glue, candles, biscuits, sauces, cooking oils, eggs, noodles, water and other things to sell.

She is Taking this loan because she also wants to improve her management of her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy hand and body lotion, glue, candles, biscuits, sauces, cooking oils, eggs, noodles, water and other things to sell.

loans.name: Kantutitas De Vilaque Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KANTUTITAS DE VILAQUE” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal  Copacabana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosenda es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, venta de ganado, venta de leche, venta de manteles para mesa, venta de queso, venta de agregados (arena, piedra, grava).

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosenda es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción de la institución, que se realizó en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de agregados (arena, piedra, grava) para construcción; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años por iniciativa propia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de arena por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas en una comunidad cercana a su domicilio y posteriormente lo comercializará en las obras  en construcción de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The group "Kantutitas de Vilaque" will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the "Centro Focal Copacabana".

The group is made of nine members and is governed by a board of directors with Rosenda as the President. The members of the group have varied businesses such as: blanket sales, selling livestock, milk sales, tablecloth sales, cheese sales, sale of sand, stone and gravel.

The loan will benefit small businesses in the group of which Rosenda is a member. This is the first time she is a part of Pro Mujer. She joined Pro Mujer through the invitation of an advertisement the institution was doing in her area. She currently has a business selling sand, rock and gravel for construction. She learned this business several years ago by herself.

The loan she is requesting will be to increase capital (buy sand at wholesale) which she will buy from wholesalers in a community close to her home and then sell it to the construction sites in the city of El Alto.

This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family financially. She is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the training offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy sand at wholesale.

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru: 35 летняя Малохат проживает на районе Гиссар. Она замужем и мать двоих детей. Детям 2 и 3 года. Ее муж занимается пекарням. Сама Малохат занимается пошивом у себя дома. По ее словам ей удобно заниматься дома. Она ухаживает за детьми и одновременно занимается шитьем. Малохат 10 лет назад начала заниматься шитьем национальной женской одежды. У Малохат старая швейная машинка. Ее нынешняя машинка хорошо не выполняет свои функции достаточно хорошо. Она решила купить многофункциональную швейную машинку. Желаемая машинка поможет ей ускорить процесс работы и увеличить количества клиентов. Малохату очень нужна Ваша поддержку.
texts.en:
35-year-old Malohat lives in the Gissar region. She is married and is the mother of 2 children, who are 2 and 3 years old. Her husband works as a baker, and Malohat works as a seamstress from her home. She says it is convenient for her to work from home. She watches after the children and, at the same time, can sew. Malohat began sewing traditional women's garments 10 years ago.
