Malohat has an old sewing machine. Her current sewing machine does not fulfill its functions very well, so Malohat has decided to purchase a multi-function sewing machine. Her desired machine will help speed up her work process and increase her number of clients. Malohat really needs your support.

loans.use: to buy a multi-function sewing machine.

loans.name: Eshmat

texts.ru: Эшмат отец троих детей и верный муж. Он занимается животноводством всю жизнь и за счет этого прокормил и обеспечивал семью. До сих пор он продвигает эту деятельность. На сегодняшний день Эшмат имеет не большое стада и намерен купить еще пару голов телят. У нее имеется все условия для такого бизнеса. Ему только не хватает денежных средств, и он надеется, что с кредитом сможет осуществить свой план.
texts.en:
Eshmat is the father of three children and a faithful husband. He raised livestock his entire life, and he has fed and provided for his family by means of this profession. To this day, he is still advancing in this work.

Today, Eshmat has a small flock and intends to buy another couple of young livestock. He has all that is necessary for this business. He only lacks the monetary funds, and he hopes that he will be able to carry out his plan with a loan.

loans.use: to buy a few head of livestock.

loans.name: San Juanito Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SAN JUANITO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Gumercinda es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de papa, venta de helados, venta de ropa, venta de mantas, venta de frazadas, venta de leche, servicio de transporte, venta de abarrotes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Gumercinda es integrante, ella indica que integra Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de papa; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace veinte años por iniciativa propia. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de papa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente  lo comercializara en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The community group “SAN JUANITO” will begin its 1st cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal Panamericana. The group consists of 8 members and is directed by an executive board of which Gumercinda is the president. The businesses of the members are: selling potatoes, selling ice cream, selling clothing, selling blankets, selling milk, transportation service, selling groceries. The loan will benefit their respective small businesses.

Gumercinda joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of a friend who is a member. Gumercinda has a business selling potatoes. She learned this skill 20 years go by her own initiative. The loan will be used to increase working capital enabling her to buy potatoes at wholesale from the wholesale vendors in El Alto and then sell them in her own stand. This work will enable her to generate income to support her family, as she lives with a partner and has a son. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training and health services the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy potatoes at wholesale.

loans.name: Las Estrellitas Del Cielo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS ESTRELLITAS DEL CIELO” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Patricia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, venta de guantes, venta de jugos y batidos, venta de zapatos

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Patricia es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia ya que la señora tenía la necesidad económica de realizar un negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de mantas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
Communal bank “Las Estrellitas del Cielo” ("The Stars of Heaven") began its second cycle at Pro Mujer as a part of Centro Focal Panamericana. It is made up of eight members and is managed by a board of directors where Patricia is the president. The members of the communal association run a wide variety of businesses, including the sale of blankets; gloves; juices and smoothies; and shoes.

The loan they are taking out will benefit small micro-businesses like Patricia's. She states that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for eight months, joining at the invitation of a friend who is also a client of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling blankets. She wants people to know that she learned this business on her own initiative because she had an economic need to start a business.

The loan she is taking out now will be used for increasing her capital by purchasing blankets at wholesale, which she will acquire from wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto and will then sell from her sales space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, she being single and having two children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the healthcare and training the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase blankets at wholesale.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 59 years old residing at Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married and blessed with adult age children.

She joined PMPC on June 20, 2008 in order to access the programs and services of the coop. Recently, she's accessing her 12th loan in the amount of PHP 15,000 to pay for land preparation like plowing & harrowing and purchase of good variety of seedlings for more, healthier and heavier produce.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation like plowing & harrowing and purchase of good variety of seedlings for more, healthier and heavier produce.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is driven by her passion for farming. At the age of 66, married and living in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, she runs a farming business that primarily supports her family. Everyday she never gets tired attending to her farm.

Editha is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations without records of default. Now, she is borrowing another loan to purchase rice seeds that will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. Having enough inventory will mean income opportunities.

In the future, she dreams of sustaining her business to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds that will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.name: Jovie

texts.en:
Jovie landed at the right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet when she went broke after her first business went bad.

PMPC came to Jovie as a rescue by lending her money when she needed it the most. Now, she is requesting another loan for the next cropping season. She is borrowing an amount for land and seedbed preparation.

Jovie perseveres and always believe in reaching her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Sofronio

texts.en:
This is Sofronio, a 45 years old business man managing his own Electronic repair shop for already 15 years. He use the business' profit for their day-to-day expenses and an added capital for the business. Good health is what he prays so that he’ll be able to run the  business for his family. He’s earning for about Php 25, 000 every month and thankful to God for being blessed of having a business to manage.

Like every entrepreneur, Sofronio aspires to suceed on his chosen industry. Right now, he starts to save money for future purposes and to continually support his children's educational expenses. He believes that a loan amount of Php 50, 000 will make a vast impact on his business since the amount will be used to buy added equipment and electronic parts  for his electronic repair shop.

Despite of being busy managing the business, Sofronio spares time attending CCT group fellowship that consist of 10-15 individuals where he can gain strength spiritually and where he hear testimonies from other CCT partners and able to hear God’s word, study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy added equipment and electronic parts for his electronic repair shop.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
For eight years now, Maricel has shown her dedication as a member of CCT Credit Cooperative in Intramuros, Manila. This is where she gets some tips on how to manage her variety store business. Her store sells various commodities that are essential to an individual’s daily living such as sachets of toiletries, canned goods, snack items, repacked condiments, and many more. Simultaneously, she retails rice to strengthen the competitiveness of her store. She really works hard in order to supplement their lacking financial resources because her husband Huel’s irregular income doesn’t suffice for the growing expenses of their family with children studying in college.

She aims to improve her variety store so she can enhance her income and boost her savings. She will buy cases of soft drinks, stock of groceries, and sacks of rice. She will also set aside an amount to buy a sidecar that her husband can drive. It will somehow give her husband a more regular daily income. She is requesting for PHP 50,000 loan to address this need. Hoping that your help will bring positive steps towards her dream of having a prolific and successful business.

She regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy cases of soft drinks, stock of groceries and sacks of rice.

loans.name: Mariflor

texts.en:
Mariflor is a Center for Community Transformation (CCT) member from Taguig Citry branch. She is 42 years old and currently a fish vendor and earning for about Php 20, 000 each month. She has the business for 17 years already.
 
There are events when she’s lacking capital to support for the business. That's why she's determined to earn more since she has a child that is still studying and bills that needs to be paid as well. Supporting capital is what she needs to continually operate the business. With this, she applied for a Php 15, 000 loan that will be used as a revolving fund and for her to buy varieties of fresh fish daily. She’s hoping that lenders would consider her story as she prays that God will also provide blessing back to people with considerate hearts.


Mariflor believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony , share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and  hear God’s word that  was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: as a revolving fund and for her to buy varieties of fresh fish daily.

loans.name: Marnie

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Marnie works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Marnie is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Marnie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma works hard to support herself. She is single and has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines.

Alma requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

She has been in this business for 28 years.

In the future, Alma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell in her rice retailing business. She has been in this business for 15 years.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Leonora works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from firewood retailing. Leonora is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Leonora has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more wood to sell.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is 65 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Trinidad has a food vending business in the Philippines. Trinidad requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business. Trinidad has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Trinidad would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elisa is 53 years old and has one child in school.

Elisa has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Elisa requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fruits to sell.

Elisa has been in this business for three years. In the future, Elisa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy variety of fruits to sell

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raúl, de 67 años de edad, es agricultor y está casado, tiene 7 hijos por los cuales ha trabajado muy fuertemente para sacarlo adelante. 

Raúl, es un hombre que desde muy pequeño le ha gustado trabajar mucho y obtener sus propios ingresos; hace 3 años con sus ahorros decidió colocar una tienda, en donde ofrece productos de la canasta básica.

Raúl, necesita el préstamo para comprar arroz, frijol, azúcar, aceite, golosinas y bebidas carbonatadas para su tienda, pues el negocio ha funcionado muy bien y necesita invertir en más productos, para ofrecerle más variedad a sus clientes. 

El sueño de Raúl es, que su tienda se posicione como una de las mejores de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Raúl is a 67 year old farmer, he is married and has 7 children for whom he has always worked very hard to raise them. Raúl has always liked to work and he has worked since he was very young to obtain his own income. Three years ago, with his own savings he decided to start a store where he offers basic staple products.

Raúl needs the loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, candies and soda beverages for his store. The store is doing well and he needs to invest in more products to offer a greater variety to his customers.

Raúl's dream is for his store to become one of the best ones of the community.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, sugar, oil, candies and soda beverages for his store.

loans.name: Khamheang Group

texts.en: Lad understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Lad knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Ladpurchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    Lad is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Elmer Alexander

texts.es:
Elmer, de 23 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está acompañado y tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad.

Elmer, trabaja en la agricultura sembrando maíz y maicillo, esta actividad la aprendió con su padre desde que era muy pequeño.

Elmer, necesita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes y foliares para su cultivo, con todo esto mejorara su cosecha y obtendrá una buena producción.

Elmer, sueña con construir su propia casa, para brindarle a su familia un buen techo para vivir.
texts.en:
Elmer, 23 years old, has a fourth-grade education. He is in a relationship and has a two-year-old son.

Elmer works in agriculture, growing corn and sorghum. This is an activity that he learned from his father when he was very young.

Elmer needs a loan to buy fertilizers and leaf-absorbed fertilizers for his crops. With this, he will improve his harvest and will have a good production.

Elmer dreams of building his own house, to provide his family a good roof to live under.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and leaf-absorbed fertilizers for his crops.

loans.name: Moreen

texts.en:
Moureen is 17 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Moureen has been working hard to manage her Beauty Salon.

To help expand her business, Moureen has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. This loan will be used to purchase other types of hair braids and weaves to attract more customers to the beauty salon, and will help Moureen to generate greater profits. She will use some of these profits to pay for her trading license. Moureen hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her beauty salon so as to employ more workers which will create more jobs for the young girls in her community.

Moureen is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase other types of hair braiding's, weaves to attract more customers in her beauty salon.

loans.name: Zaydullo

texts.ru: Житель промышленного города Турсунзаде Зайдулло на протяжении 15 лет занимается животноводством. Ему 53 года, он женат и имеет 3 детей. Старший сын Зайдулло находится в трудовой миграции в Российской Федерации. Младший сын помогает отцу в его деле. Зайдулло очень ответственно подходит к своему делу.  У Зайдулло есть одна единственная дочку, которую он хочет выдать замуж. Но не смотря на то, что Зайдулло получает неплохой доход, для покупки приданного ему не хватает финансовых средств. Именно с этой целью он обратился к Вам за помощью и верит, что его заявка не останется нерассмотренной, и он достойно выдаст свою дочку замуж.
texts.en:
A resident of the industrial city of Tursun-Zade, Zaydullo has raised animals for the last 15 years. He is 53 years old, married, and has 3 children. Zaydullo's oldest son is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation. His younger son helps his father with his business. Zaydullo attends to his work very responsibly.

Zaydullo has one unmarried daughter, who he wants to have a wedding for. But despite Zaydullo's fairly good income, he does not have the financial means for all of the associated purchases. With this goal in mind, he has applied to you for help. He trusts that his application be fulfilled, and he will be able to give his daughter away in marriage.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's wedding.

loans.name: Dalia Mary

texts.es:
Dalia Mary, tiene 43 años de edad, ella es estudiante de la carrera de Auxiliar de Enfermería,es una carrera corta, lleva estudiando seis meses y le faltan siete meses para terminar de estudiar.
Actualmente paralelo a sus estudios trabaja prestando servicio de cuidado de ancianos, es un trabajo duro pero que le agrada mucho.
Se esfuerza día a día para poder culminar sus estudios y su mayor motivación son sus dos pequeños hijos. Es por ellos y para darles una mejor educación y el mejor ejemplo de esfuerzo y sacrificio que ella no se ha rendido ni a dejado los estudios a pesar de haber pasado por problemas económicos, en los cuales en alguna oportunidad se le hizo difícil juntar el dinero de las mensualidades.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en el pago por adelantado del resto de meses que le falta para terminar sus estudios.
texts.en: Dalia Mary is 43 years old and is studying to be a nursing assistant. It is a short course of study. She has been studying for 6 months and has 6 months to go to complete her studies. Today along with her studies she works caring for elderly people, which is hard work but very fulfilling. She strives day after day to be able to complete her studies and her greatest motivation is her two small children. It is for them and to give them a better education and the best example of effort and sacrifice that she has not given up or abandoned her studies in spite of economic problems which has made it difficult to make her monthly payments. The loan will be used to pay the rest of the months of her course of study.

loans.use: to pay her education expenses.

loans.name: Myla

texts.en:
It’s not impossible for a vendor and a driver to have successful children and own a decent house for their family someday. This is the principle of Myla, 42 years old, from Tondo, Manila, who runs a “sari-sari” (variety) store while her husband, Alquin, works as a driver. They work hard and save little by little in order to improve their business and uplift their lives. It’s the husband-and-wife partnership that will make their dream house and their children’s education a realization.

As of now, Myla aspires for additional capital of 30,000 PHP for her variety store business. It will help her obtain more grocery items, dry goods, and beverages. With an enhanced inventory, she can increase her profit and cover their daily expenditures. She is praying that you will be one of God’s instruments to help her. She would really appreciate your kind support.

Myla is committed to CCT Credit Cooperative’s vision to alleviate poverty, and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. (All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.)

loans.use: to obtain more grocery items, dry goods, and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Direct selling business is common in the Philippines, especially for housewives who want to be productive and are willing to supplement the family resources. Working people who want to earn extra money usually engage in this business also. It’s easy to venture into a direct selling business since it typically requires low capital to begin with. Then the entrepreneur or direct selling representative will just enhance the business by expanding her network and target consumers and proper rolling of capital.

Gina of Bacolod City, Negros Occidental, is a direct selling representative who sells Avon, Natasha, and MSE products, which range from cosmetics and beauty products to ready-to-wear items and footwear. She is married to Ramiro, a construction painter, and they have children who are studying in college.

Her husband’s job is occasional and his income cannot suffice for their everyday expenses and children’s education. This is the reason why Gina aspires to improve her business with the aid of additional capital amounting to PHP 23,000. She will use it to buy more RTWs, shoes, personal care and household products that are in demand this Christmas season. She’s positive that this additional capital will give her more profit to support their everyday expenses.

Her dream is to have a stable space or a showroom for her business someday. She also wntsfor a good future for her children and harmonious relationships among her family members. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear clothes, shoes, personal care and household products

loans.name: Lilybeth

texts.en:
Lilybeth is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. 

Lilybeth dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 61 years old, married, and has two children. She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Nenita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Nenita has been in this business for 30 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Nenita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 61 years old and married. She has three children. Angelita works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

Angelita has been in this business for 40 years and sells a variety of items. In the future, Angelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Rea

texts.en:
Rea is 41 years old and married with one child. Rea works very hard to provide for the family.

Rea runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, snack foods shampoo and other personal care products. Rea has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Rea would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, snack foods, shampoo and other personal care products.

loans.name: Aguida

texts.en:
Aguida is 27 years old, she is married and she is a business women. She is applying for a loan of $ 600.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop of second hand clothes and she also sells in the market. Aguida has been involving in business activities a year ago, which she started with her own working capital. She is earning a good income from selling her second clothes because many people are interested in her second hand clothes, which are cheap and unique, if compared to new clothes.

So she is still happy to do her business. She will use this loan to buy more second hand clothes such as trousers, shorts, shirts, turtleneck shirts, nightgowns, jackets and others.

loans.use: to buy more trousers, shorts, shirts, turtleneck shirts, nightgowns, jackets and others.

loans.name: Ella

texts.en:
Ella is 64 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ella runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries. She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Ella would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan, de 32 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene un hijo.

Juan, se dedica a la agricultura, especificamente a la siembra de maíz y maicillo, para garantizar la seguridad alimentaria de su familia y para tener el maíz para la tortillería que administra su pareja, pero también él le ayuda con la venta, este negocio lo tienen desde hace 5 años y les ha generado buenos ingresos.

Juan, necesita el préstamo para comprar leña para la tortillería, porque al comprarla por cantidades grandes se ahorra más dinero. 

Juan, sueña con mejorar su negocio y brindarle a su familia estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Juan, 32 years old, is in a relationship and has one son. Juan works in agriculture, specifically growing corn and sorghum, to ensue his family's food security and to have the corn for his partner's tortilla business. 

He also helps his partner with tortilla sales. They have had this business for five years, and it has brought in good earnings.

Juan needs the loan to buy more firewood for the tortilla business, because by buying in bulk he can save more money.

Juan dreams to improve his business and provide economic stability for his family.

loans.use: to buy firewood for his tortilla business.

loans.name: Synorita

texts.en:
Synorita is a 27-year-old woman, and she is married with three children. She lives in a rural area outside of Honiara, the capitol of the Solomon Islands.

She operates a small convenience store, selling varieties of food items such as rice, noodles, canned food, biscuits and snacks. She has been doing this for four years.

Synorita requested a loan to buy housing materials such as masonite, nails and timber to improve her home. She plans to use her business profits to help cover her family's daily expenses and also to provide a better life for her family.

She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy housing materials such as masonite, nails and timber to improve her home.

loans.name: Rizwana

texts.en:
Rizwana is the responsible mother of 3 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, where her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 8 years. The current condition of his taxi is not good, as it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to do the maintenance. Therefore Rizwana has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Rizwana's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. And provide the better transport facilities to earn the profitable income. Rizwana also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.
Rizwana is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is 16 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, Robina has been working hard to manage her boutique business, which deals in second hand clothes.

To help expand her business, Robina has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more types of clothes to attract other customers so as to complete them in time and stock more for the festive season. It will help Robina to generate greater profits and to complete her hair dressing course. Robina hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a beauty salon.

Robina is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy different types of clothes to attract other customers so as to complete them in time and stock more for the festive season.

loans.name: Hijas Del Illampu Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “HIJAS DE ILLAMPU” iniciará el octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Achacachi, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Reina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, tienda de barrio, venta de frutas, venta de refrescos, servicio de construcción, salón de belleza.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Reina es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá y decidió emprender su propio negocio hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de fideo y arroz por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The A.C. “HIJAS DE ILLAMPU” will start their 8th loan cycle at "Pro Mujer", as part of the "Centro Focal Achacachi". The group is made of nine members and it has a board of directors where Reina is the President. The type of businesses the members of the community association have are various, among them; food sales, community store, fruit sales, beverage sales, construction services and beauty salon.

The loan they are requesting will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs. Reina is a member and eight years ago she became a part of "Pro Mujer". She joined when she received an invitation from a promotion made by the organization in her community. Currently, she has a business selling meals, she learned this trade from her mother and a few years ago decided to start her own business.

The loan that she is requesting will be used to increase her capital (to buy pasta and rice in bulk). She will buy them from vendors in La Paz and after preparing the meals she will sell them in her food stall. This type of work allows her to generate the resources to financially support her family since she has three children.

When asked why she likes "Pro Mujer" she responds that she likes the workshops that the organization offers.

loans.use: to purchase pasta and rice in bulk.

loans.name: German Evaristo

texts.es: German de 34 años de edad, reside en vivienda propia al lado de su compañera de vida y sus hijos gemelos de 13 años y uno de 7 años de edad. Él es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador quien se desempeña como jornalero y realiza diferentes tareas para poder obtener los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, además se dedica a cultivar maíz y frijol. German en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida, solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: láminas, madera y clavos para construir un cuarto cocina, ya que como se nota en la foto, el lugar que tiene designado está al descubierto y los días de lluvia no puede cocinar ahí.
texts.en:
German is 34 years old. He lives in his own home with his life companion and children: 13-year-old twins and a 7-year-old. He is a very responsible and hardworking man who works as a day laborer and completes different jobs to be able to earn the income necessary to cover home expenses. He also works farming corn and beans.

German is looking to better his quality of life. He is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in aluminum sheets, wood, and nails to build a kitchen. As can be seen in the picture, the place he has picked out is out in the open and the days it rains he cannot cook there.

loans.use: to buy aluminum sheets, wood, and nails to build a new kitchen.

loans.name: Anselma

texts.en:
Anselma is a native from the town of Clarin. She is a married woman and has five young children.

Anselma earns a living through operating a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells commodities like noodles, powdered milk, sugar, seasonings, soap, shampoo, and assorted canned goods. Her husband has an income that could help defray the family's daily expenses.

Anselma would like to fill her store with out-of-stock supplies to improve her earnings. She would like to buy items such as rice, beverages, condiments, and soft drinks. With these supplies, she would able to control the flow of merchandise and be able to manage the store efficiently.

For the future, she is determined that she will become successful in her business and continue to support the welfare of her growing children.

loans.use: to invest in assorted groceries such as a pouch of vinegar, edible oil, various canned goods, and toiletries.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 29 years old and married, and she has three children, two of whom are currently in school.

Rosalia is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig. Rosalia has been in this business for 5 years now and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosalia would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad is 47 years old and married with five children. With all five children in school, Caridad works very hard to provide for them.

Caridad has a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell. Caridad has been in this business for 18 years, and sells a variety of items such as sugar, noodles, spices and other groceries.

In the future, Caridad would like to save enough money to expand her business and to repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a widowed woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Norma is 55 years old, and has one child currently in school.

Norma has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines. Norma requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as dresses, underwear, etc. Norma has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Norma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as dresses, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Amasimbi Sub Group A

texts.en:
Collette is a 36-year-old group leader. She is married with four children, aged 6 and 12 years, who all attend school. Collette owns a bar, while her husband is in construction. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more soda, beer and wine to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and make savings.

The group is called AMASIMBI which means “It's a precious thing” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for a better future.

loans.use: to buy more soda, beer and wine to resell.

loans.name: Jesus Humberto

texts.es: Jesús esta llevando a cabo la labor de conversión a orgánico de su cafetal certificado ya bajo otros sellos Jesús quiere en estos momentos incrementar la cantidad de finca que convertirá a la producción 100% orgánica ya esta llevando a cabo las labores pero para certificar toda su finca y tener mas posibilidades de mercado necesita un poco mas de fondos es por esa razón que Jesús solicita un crédito. El crédito le ayudara a Jesús a continuar con las labores de conversión a orgánico de su cafetal y así tener una mejor producción de mejor calidad y por lo tanto acceder a un mejor mercado para su cosecha.
texts.en:
Jesús is in the process of converting his coffee plantation to organic. It is already certified under other seals.

He wants to increase the size of the 100% organic portion of his plantation. He is already in the process, but to certify his entire plantation and have a larger possibility for production, he needs more funds. This is the reason Jesus is requesting a loan.

The loan will help him to continue the work of converting his plantation to organic. He will then have a higher quality product and have access to a better market for his crop.

loans.use: to purchase the materials needed to convert his coffee plantation to organic such as organic fertilizer, organic pesticides, coffee plants etc.

loans.name: Avliyokul

texts.ru: Житель района Фархор, Авлиекул. Ему 51 лет. Он отец 5 детей. Его жена мастер рукодельница. Она занимается шитьем женской одежды на заказ. Старшие сыновья Авлиекула находятся на заработках загранице. Они помогает родителям обеспечить семью. Авлиекул сыновей многому научил, и он верит и доверяет сыновьям. Сам Авлиекул хороший дехканин. Он занимается земледелием на районе. Авлиекул решил построить коровник и заниматься животноводством. У него имеет несколько скотов, но не имеет коровник для скотов. Авлиекул решил взять кредит и за счет кредит приобрести стройматериалы и построить коровник. Скоро зима и будет холодно животным. Ему требуется немного определенная сумма денег.
texts.en:
Avliyokul is a resident of the Farkhor region. He is 51 years old, and he is the father of 5 children. His wife is a master seamstress. She works by sewing women's clothing to order. Avliyokul's older sons are migrant workers abroad. They help their father provide for his family. Avliyokul taught his sons much, and he trusts and believes in his sons.

Avliyokul himself is a good "dehkan" farmer. He does agricultural work in the country. Avliyokul has decided to build a barn for cows and do animal husbandry work. He has a few livestock, but does not have a barn for his animals. Avliyokul has decided to take out a loan to purchase building materials and build the barn. Winter is coming soon, and it will be cold for the animals. He is asking for a modest, precise sum of money.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for a barn and start a new business.

loans.name: Matimtiman

texts.en:
Matimtiman would like to extend her grateful appreciation and thanks because her previous loan has indeed helped her enhance her business. She faithfully repaid PHP 18,000 which she used in buying additional stock of processed meat and frozen goods. She aims to improve her sales further. She would like to grab the opportunity for higher demand this Christmas season. Hence, she is humbly requesting for another PHP 35,000 loan, which she will utilize to purchase larger quantities of frozen goods and processed meat products. She has already committed to her loyal customers to deliver their orders for Christmas celebration.

Matimtiman continues to work hard towards her dream of an improved living condition for her family. She prays for sufficient resources for their daily needs and savings for the future. She doesn't fail to meet with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of frozen goods and processed meat products to sellu

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a shell craft business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Jocelyn is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy the shells, thread, and other supplies needed for her business.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities with her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy the shells, thread, and other supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is a married woman with six children. Dolores is 59 years old, and one of her children is currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Dolores has a buy-and-sell fruit business in the Philippines. Dolores has been in this business for 20 years.

Dolores requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy a variety of fruit to sell.

In the future, Dolores would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruit to sell.

loans.name: Rosarion

texts.en:
Rosario is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosario is 64 years old now.

Rosario has a metal shop business in the Philippines. She has requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her welding shop.

Rosario has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her welding shop.

loans.name: Rovelyn

texts.en:
Rovelyn is 36 years old and married with four children.

Rovelyn is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig. She has been in this business for 15 years and earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Marlen Carolina

texts.es:
Marlen, de 43 añod de edad, es madre soltera de 4 hijos, tres de ellos están en etapa escolar y la otra es una joven quien ya formo su propia familia, ella logro estudiar hasta sexto grado y por razones económicas no continuo estudiando, actualmente solo sus 3 hijos dependen de ella.

Marlen, se dedica a la venta de tamales desde hace 11 años, esta actividad la aprendió con su madre desde que era pequeña, ella comercializa su venta en el cantón y los alrededores de la zona, camina aproximadamente 2 kilometros diarios y las labores diarias las comienza a las 7:00 de la mañana y las termina hasta las 6:00 de la tarde y en el negocio regularmente le ayuda su hija para vender. 

Marlen, necesita el préstamo para comprar leña, maíz, condimentos, hojas de huerta, entre otros insumos que necesita para elaborar los tamales,  con ello espera poder ayudar a su familia a tener una mejor calidad de vida. 

Marlen, sueña con poder dar a sus hijos una condición económica estable y la educación que ellos necesitan para ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Marlen, 43, is a single mother of four. Three of her children are school age and the other is a youngster who has already started their own family.

She studied up to sixth grade but due to economic reasons, was not able to keep studying. Currently only three of her children depend financially on her.

Marlen has sold tamales for the past 11 years. She learned this trade from her mother when she was young.
She sells tamales on the street around her neighborhood and other areas. She walks approximately 2 kms every day.
She starts at 7 AM and ends at 6PM. Her daughter often helps her with the sales.

Marlen is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as firewood, corn, spices and vegetable leaves to make the tamales.

She hopes to help her family have a better quality of life.

Marlen dreams of being able to give her children a stable financial situation as well as the education they need to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as firewood, corn, spices and vegetable leaves to make the tamales.

loans.name: Bright Children School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Robert. He is the Head teacher of Bright Children School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Kampala with 300 students. Bright Children School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Bright Children School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Robert ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Maria Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia, de 53 años de edad, no estudio debido a la escasees económica que vivía su familia, actualmente es madre de 4 hijos, todos sus hijos ya son mayores de edad y uno de ellos está estudiando y los demás trabajan. 

Alicia, desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de calzado, ella aprendió este negocio por medio de una amiga a quien le ayudaba a vender, además se dedica a la venta de queso y es la otra fuente de ingresos que ella posee, para poder comercializar sus productos se desplaza a los cantones aledaños y camina una distancia promedio de 5 kilometros por día.

Alicia, utilizara el préstamo para comprar sandalias, zapatos y botines, con ello espera tener satisfechos a sus clientes y así  aumentar sus ventas.

Alicia, sueña con poder ayudar a culminar los estudios de su hija y que se convierta en profesional.
texts.en:
Alicia is 53 years old. She did not go to school due to the economic scarcity in which her family lived. She is currently the mother of 4 children. All of her children are adults; one of them is in school, and the others work.

For the past 5 years, Alicia has made a living selling shoes. She learned about this business by helping a friend make sales. Additionally, she sells cheese, which provides her with another source of income. In order to market her products, she travels to the neighboring towns, walking an average of 5 kilometers per day.

Alicia will use this loan to buy sandals, shoes, and booties. With this merchandise, she hopes to satisfy her customers and, that way, increase her sales. Alicia dreams of being able to help her daughter finish her studies so that she can become a professional.

loans.use: to buy sandals, shoes, and booties.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is a hardworking woman and is an entrepreneur with five children.

She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines and has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Shirley dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Jose De La Paz

texts.es:
José, de 41 años de edad, está casado y tiene 2 hijos por cuales trabaja fuertemente para brindarle todo lo necesario. 

José, siempre ha trabajado en la agricultura, pero hace un año decidió colocar su propia tienda con productos básicos, la cual fue muy aceptada por su vecinos y le genera buenos ingresos.

José, necesita el préstamo para comprar arroz, frijoles, pan, café, detergentes, entre otros productos.

José, sueña con que su negocio sea rentable, para mejorar la situación económica de su familia.
texts.en:
José is 41 years old, he is married and he has 2 children, and he works really hard to provide them with everything they need.

José has always been engaged in agriculture; yet about one year ago he decided to open his own shop selling commodities: this was well received by his neighbors and it gives him a good income.

José is requesting a loan to buy rice, beans, bread, coffee, washing powder and other products.

José wishes for his activity to be profitable, in order to improve his family's economic situation.

loans.use: buy rice, beans, bread, coffee and washing powder.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is 50 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Arsenia is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock. She has been in this business for 5 years and earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre de 39 años de edad es casado con una linda familia de siete hijos de las edades entre 10 y 26 años, esta familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Carlos para generar sus ingresos tiene tres diferentes actividades, el primero es de fletero, prestando servicios de trasporte, el segundo es que es comerciante en el mercado regional y el último es que trabaja como agricultor con estas tres actividades lleva 10 de realizarlo. Carlos gracias a sus aspiraciones de superación ha logrado la superación de su familia sin embargo falta lo más esencial que es su casa por esa razón a hora a considerado empezar con la construcción de casa pero a pesar de todo su esfuerzo su capital no es suficiente por tal motivo solicita un préstamo para comprar materiales como: cemento, cal, arena y piedrín.
Su gran sueño es empezar y finalizar lo más pronto la construcción de su casa para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 39-year-old man. He is married with a beautiful family with seven children, aged between 10 and 26. This family lives in the community of Sololá. To bring in income, Carlos has three different activities. The first is providing transportation services, the second is as a merchant at the regional market, and the last is working as a farmer. He has been working in these three activities for 10 years.

Thanks to his aspirations to excel, Carlos has managed to keep his family going. Nevertheless, he lacks what is most essential, his house. For that reason, he now has considered starting to build his house. However, despite all of his effort his capital is not sufficient. For that reason, he is requesting a loan to buy materials such as: cement, lime, sand, and gravel. 

His great dream is to start and finish the construction of his house as soon as possible, to improve his family's quality of life

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, lime, sand, and gravel.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina, de 57 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado debido a que su familia era de escasos recursos económicos y no podían mandarla a la escuela; actualmente está casada y tiene 5 hijos, 4 trabajan y ya formaron sus propios hogares y con ella solo vive 1 hijo, su nieto y su esposo.

Josefina, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras como sandilla, plátanos, guineo, pipianes, tomates, entre otros, se dedica a este negocio desde hace 10 años y fue su mamá quien le enseño este negocio; para llegar hasta donde está su negocio tiene que caminar aproximadamente 50 metros y  trabaja un promedio de 8 horas diarias. 

Josefina, necesita el préstamo para comprar sandilla, plátanos, guineo, tomate, papa y pipianes, con esto abastecerá su negocio y tendrá satisfechos a sus clientes.

Josefina, sueña con tener un negocio amplio y una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Josefina is 57 years old. She went to school until the third grade because her family had very limited financial resources and they could not send her to school. Currently, she is married and has 5 children. Four of them work and have their own homes. Only one son, her grandchild and her husband live with her.

Josefina sells fruits and vegetables such as watermelon, plantains, bananas, "pipianes" (a kind of squash) and tomatoes among others. She has been doing this for 10 years and she learned this trade from her mother. To get to where her business is located she walks approximately 50 meters and she works an average of 8 hours a day.

Josefina needs the loan to purchase, watermelon, plantains, bananas, tomatoes, potatoes and "pipianes" (a kind of squash) to stock her business and satisfy her customers.

She dreams with having a big business and a good quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase watermelon, plantains, bananas, tomatoes, potatoes and "pipianes" (a kind of squash), to stock her store.

loans.name: Rebeca Sarai

texts.es:
Rebeca, de 27 años de edad, tiene dos hijos, se separó de su esposo y solo vive con sus hijos, por los cuales lucha día a día para que no les falte lo necesario.

Rebeca, debido a la necesidad de mejorar los ingresos económicos de su familia, decidió instalar una venta de tortillas y de esta manera generar los ingresos suficientes para la alimentación y educación de sus hijos.

Rebeca, necesita el préstamo para comprar maíz y leña para la venta de tortilas.

El sueño de Rebeca es, brindarles la mejor educación a sus hijos para que sean personas profesionales.
texts.en:
Rebeca is 27 years old and she has two children. She is separated from her husband and she lives only with her children, and she fights everyday for them to make sure they have everything the need.

Due to her need to increase the income of her family, Rebeca decided to start an activity selling tortillas, in order to earn enough money to feed her children and provide for their education.

Rebeca needs the loan to buy corn and firewood to sells tortillas.

Rebeca dreams of granting the best education to her children, for them to become professionals.

loans.use: buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Ocomisto Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “OCOMISTO” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nicolasa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de edredones, venta de poleras, venta de calzados, venta de comida, venta de leche, venta de ropa deportiva, venta de celulares, venta de chamarras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nicolasa es integrante, ella indica que hace seis años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de leche; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su abuela,  desde que era niña y decidió emprender su propio negocio hace varios años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para la compra de una vaca que adquirirá de la comunidad Vilaque, esta compra le ayudará a aumentar su capital ya que podrá comercializar más leche en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene siete hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The village bank Ocomisto is starting its sixth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes regional office. The group has eight members, and Nicolasa is the chair of the board of directors. The members of the group earn their living in a variety of retail ventures, including blankets, T-shirts, shoes, food, milk, athletic clothing, cell phones, and jackets.

This loan will help these microentrepreneurs. Nicolasa notes that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for six years, having joined at the invitation of a friend who is also a client of the institution. She currently has a business selling milk. She says that she learned the business from her grandmother from the time she was a little girl and decided to start her own business several years ago.

She will use the present loan to buy a cow, in the village of Vilalque. This will allow her to increase her income, since she’ll be able to sell more milk at the markets in the city of El Alto. This business helps her bring in an income to support her family, since she is married and has seven children.

When we ask her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the professional development the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 62 years old and widowed with two adult children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For many years, she has owned and operated a retail business of selling goods for use in the home, earning 7,000 PHP every month. She has been a member of GDMPC since the year 2007. Now, she has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional goods to sell in her store. With the profits, Teresita will make improvements to her house to raise the general living condition of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Jose Remberto

texts.es: José de 41 años de edad, vive al lado de su hija de 20 años quien le acompaña en su diario vivir. Él es una persona muy responsable y muy trabajadora, que se desempeña como agricultor. Gracias a esta labor logra llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. José en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso del corredor de su vivienda. Y de esta manera mejorar considerablemente su calidad de vida.
texts.en: José  is 41 years old and lives next to his 20-year-old daughter, who is often with him in his day-to-day life. He is a very responsible and hardworking person who works as a farmer. This work allows him to put food on the table. Hoping to improve his quality of life, José is applying for a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, and gravel to install a cement floor in the breezeway of his house. This will allow him to greatly improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and gravel to install a cement floor in the breezeway of his house.

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose is 29 years old and has one child. Mary Rose is single and has one child still in school.

Mary Rose is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Mary Rose requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Mary Rose has been in this business for 4 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mary Rose would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 61 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Salvacion has a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of groceries to sell. Salvacion has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as sardines, noodles, spices and other personal care products.

In the future, Salvacion would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maria Godelina

texts.en:
Maria Godelina is 44 years old and married with five children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Maria Godelina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like canned goods, beverages, condiments, home care products, and other groceries. She has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Maria Godelina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like canned goods, beverages, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 40 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Cristina has been raising livestock for nine years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 32 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Michelle has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business. Michelle has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Michelle would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Maria Domitila

texts.es:
María, es madre soltera de 3 hijos, por los cuales ella lucha día a día para bríndales todo lo que ellos necesitan. 

María, debido a la falta de un empleo formal, decidió colocar su propio negocio con ayuda de sus familiares que le brindaron el capital semilla para iniciar, ella compró productos plásticos de cocina como platos, vasos, tasas, rapadores de verduras, entre otros para vender y su negocio ha funcionado muy bien.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar más productos plásticos como platos, vasos, tazas, raspadores, coladores, entre otros, porque se acerca la temporada navideña y las ventas aumentan.

María, sueña con tener una tienda con productos básicos en su casa.
texts.en:
María is a single mother of 3 children for whom she struggles each day to give them everything they need.

Because she wasn't formally employed, María decided to start her own business with the help of her relatives, who gave her the seed capital to get it off the ground. With it, she purchased plastic products like plates, cups, bowls, vegetable graters, colanders, and other items to sell, and her business has progressed very well.

María needs a loan to purchase more of the same plastic products because the Christmas season is coming and her sales will increase. She dreams of having a store in her home selling essential goods.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic products like plates, cups, bowls, graters, colanders, and other items.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is 27 years old, with three children. With one child in school, Jenalyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase personal care products and other items to sell.

Jenalyn has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase personal care products and other items to sell.

loans.name: Jeta

texts.en:
Jeta is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur, 57 years old, with one child currently in school.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies.

Jeta has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Mirian Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mirian, de 45 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos, ella estudio hasta sexto grado, es madre soltera porque su esposo falleció hace dos años, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas y es la fuente principal con lo que mantiene su familia. 
 
Mirian, tiene 3 años de dedicarse a la venta de tortillas, este oficio lo aprendió con su madre, porque desde que era muy joven le enseño a ser independiente y mantenerse por si sola.- Después que falleció su esposo ella tiene que esforzarse el doble para mantener a su  familia, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa y las labores diarias las inicia a las 6:00 de la mañana y las culmina a las 2:00 de la tarde. 

Marlen, necesita el préstamo para comprar maíz y leña para elaborar las tortillas, con esto espera tener segura la producción de tortillas por mucho más tiempo.

Mirian, sueña con ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales y darles el estudio que ella no pudo tener, además sueña con construir una casa más grande, ya que donde actualmente vive es pequeño.
texts.en:
Mirian, 45 years old, has two children. She studied through the sixth grade and is a single mother because her husband died two years ago. She makes a living selling tortillas, which provides the major source of income to support her family.

Mirian has been selling tortillas for three years. She learned the business from her mother, who taught her to be independent and take care of herself from the time she was quite young. After her husband’s death, she must work twice as hard to support her family. She runs her business out of her home. She starts working at 6:00 a.m. and finishes at 2:00 p.m. every day.

Mirian needs the loan to buy corn and firewood to make her tortillas. She hopes that this will allow her to keep producing tortillas for a long time.

Mirian dreams of seeing her children become professionals and offer them the chance to study that she never had. She also dreams of building a larger house, since the one she currently lives in is small.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood to make her tortillas.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana, de 63 años de edad, no estudio debido a que sus padres no poseían la capacidad económica para poder darle el estudio, actualmente está soltera y tiene 2 hijas las cuales ya tienen sus propios hogares y con ella solo vive su hermana y su cuñado.

Juana, se dedica a vender tortilla desde hace 5 años, aprendió este negocio gracias a su hermana, hoy en día tiene sus propios clientes y está orgullosa de salir adelante; aparte de eso ella también vende pan y esa es otra fuente de ingreso alterna que posee, la venta de tortilla la realiza al medio día y en la tarde.

Juana, necesita el préstamo para comprar maíz y leña para suplir la demanda de tortillas que incrementa en estos meses y de esa manera obtener ingresos mucho más elevados, para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

Juana, sueña con tener un lugar más apropiado para tener su tortillería ya que actualmente no tiene el suficiente espacio para poder atender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juana, 63 years old, didn’t go to school because her parents did not have the financial resources to allow her study. She is unmarried and has two daughters, who both have their own homes. She lives with her sister and brother-in-law.

Juana has been selling tortilla for five years. She learned this business from her sister. Today she has her own customers and is proud of her accomplishments. In addition, she also sells bread, which provides an alternative source of income. She sells tortillas at midday and in the afternoon.

Juana needs the loan to buy corn and firewood to meet the demand for tortillas, which rises at this time of year. By bringing in a higher revenue, she will be able to improve her family’s living conditions.

Juana dreams of having a more appropriate location for her tortilla shop, since at the moment she doesn’t have enough space to serve her customers properly.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood to meet the demand for tortillas, which rises at this time of year.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor, de 33 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos y ambos están en etapa escolar, ella solo logro estudiar hasta noveno grado debido a la escases económica de sus padres, está acompañada y su pareja es agricultor y es albañil.
 
Flor, se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde desde hace 1 año aproximadamente, ella anteriormente solo se dedicaba a los oficios domésticos y la crianza de aves la aprendió a traves de capacitaciones en programas de desarrollo que se han presentado en la comunidad y es por ese motivo que quiere continuar criando más pollos.

Flor, necesita el préstamo para comprar pollos, concentrados y vacunas, de esta manera espera mejorar más el volumen de ventas, he incrementar las ganancias al momento de las ventas. 

Flor, sueña con tener un negocio más amplio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Flor is 33 years old, a mother of two children, and both of them are in school. She was only able to study through the ninth grade due to the lack of finances from her parents. She is married, and her partner is a farmer and a brick mason.

Flor has earned a living raising chickens for approximately one year. Previously she only focused on the household chores, and she learned how to raise fowls through trainings at development programs that have been presented in the community. For this reason, she wants to continue raising more chickens.

Flor is requesting a loan to buy chickens, feed, and vaccines. In this way she hopes to improve her sales volume and increase the profits at the time of the sales. Flor dreams about having a much larger business, and that her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed, and vaccines.

loans.name: Bakhtori

texts.en:
Bakhtori is 35 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan and mother of four children. Her husband has been running his own barber shop for the past 18 years.

Bakhtori's husband needs to buy different types of cosmetics i.e creams, hair brush, and other accessories for his barber shop but due to financial constraints her husband is not capable to buy these items. Therefore Bakhtori has applied for Kiva loan. This loan will help her husband to buy the relevant items so that he can provide better services to his customers. It will also helpful for him to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of his business and family.

For this financial assistance Bakhtori is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic accessories her husband's barber shop.

loans.name: Elfego Leonardo

texts.es:
Elfego es un hombre de 27 es casado con una linda familia de un hijo de siete años, esta familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Elfego para generar sus ingresos y sacar a su familia adelante se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas y legumbres que la tierra de su zona produce, el lleva 15 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, él tiene la fortuna de habitar en una zona muy fértil.
Él tiene la necesidad de un préstamo porque no cuenta con el capital suficiente para poder comprar sus semillas y fertilizantes  y la época de esta legumbre se está acercando. El confía plenamente en que conseguirá el préstamo para su cultivo y poder al final de este año cultivar.
Su gran sueño es mejorar su vivienda para que su familia viva mejor.
texts.en:
Elfego is a 27-year-old man. He is married and has a beautiful family, including a 7-year-old son. This family lives in a community in Solola. In order to earn an income and move his family forward, Elfego cultivates the vegetables and legumes that the land in his area produces. He has been in this business for the past 15 years. He is fortunate to live in a very fertile zone.

He needs a loan because he does not have enough capital to buy seeds and fertilizers, and legume season is approaching. He trusts that he will receive this loan for his crops and that he will be able to cultivate at the end of this year. His greatest dream is to make improvements to his house so that his family can live better.

loans.use: to buy pea seeds as well as fertilizers.

loans.name: Estrellas Celestes Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLAS CELESTES” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Cristina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: cortinas, venta de material escolar, venta de comida, servicio de transporte, tienda de barrio, venta de mantas, venta de accesorios de celulares, tienda de ferretería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Cristina es integrante, ella indica que hace siete ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de cortinas; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio por iniciativa propia hace varios años.
