El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de cortinas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es viuda y tiene dos hijas.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “ESTRELLAS CELESTES” will start their 6th loan cycle with "Pro Mujer" as part of the "Centro Focal Collpani". The group consists of eight members and it is led by a Board of Directors, Cristina is the President. The members of this group have various businesses, among them: curtains, selling school supplies, food sales, transportation services, community store, selling blankets, selling cellular accessories and a hardware store.

The loan they are requesting will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Cristina. She is a member and has been with "Pro Mujer" for seven loan cycles. She joined when she was invited by a friend who is a customer of this organization. Currently, she has a business selling curtains. She decided to start this business on her own a few years ago. The loan will be used to increase her capital (to purchase curtains, wholesale), which she will acquire from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz. She will then sell them in her stand. This type of work allows her to generate income to financially support her family. She is a widow and has two daughters.

When asked what she likes of "Pro Mujer", she responds that she likes the workshops and the health center that the organization offers.

loans.use: to buy curtains, wholesale.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica lives in the town of Sinacaban. She is 58 years old and married to a farmer, and she has 3 children. She became a member of GDMPC in the year 2010. The income of her husband was not enough to raise their children, so she decided to start a business buying copra (coconut fruits). They started this business 10 years ago. However, Veronica felt that the income from this business was still not enough to provide for the needs (educational needs) of their children, for the harvesting period is 2 to 3 months.

So Veronica looked for another line of business and decided on sugarcane. She wants a sugarcane farm so she can produce kalamay (a confection made of coconut milk, sugar, and flour) in her town and also in the neighboring town. Demand for this product is very high. She went to GDMPC and asked for help, and then she applied for a 25,000 PHP loan. This will be used to buy fertilizers and to pay for the labor cost of starting the business. Veronica hopes that her business will grow so that she can give her children a higher education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for the labor cost of starting a sugarcane business

loans.name: Recilda

texts.en:
Recilda is a 31-year-old woman who lives a simple life with her family in Tubigon, Bohol. She is married and has four children, ages 19, 11, 5 and 2 years old.

She makes a living by selling banana cue (snacks) to the community. She has been doing this for one year and is hoping to have more successful years to come to enhance their livelihood, while her husband went to other country to earn more.

Recilda uses her profit for her children’s school allowances such as food, transportation expenses and other basic needs. Now she is asking for a loan amount to buy food ingredients such as banana fruit, sugar and cooking oil.

Recilda aims to improve her business for her children. She wants to have enough money to support her children in their studies.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients such as banana fruit, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa from Bacolod City, Negros Occidental, maximizes the space inside her house where she displays her merchandise for sale.

As you can see, it needs a lot of improvement in terms of display cabinets and stock for sale, but it’s not hard to achieve, especially if her loan request worth 24,000 PHP will be kindly granted. This will gradually pave the way towards reaching her dream grocery store someday.

Elsa’s husband Norberto already died some years ago. All responsibilities for their children fell onto her shoulders, but she’s able to fulfill these with the help of God.

Soon her children will finish their schooling and Elsa will be relieved of huge expenses. For now, she is humbly seeking your kind generosity and hopes you would extend your help to a widow like her.

Elsa continues to inspire her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to share testimonies about life and to draw strength from the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for display cabinets and additional stock for sale

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 56 years old, married, and has five children.

Concepcion is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Concepcion has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Concepcion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Namphou Group

texts.en: Mone is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  Mone and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter Mone and his group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Mone and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Mone and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 29 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Adela is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Adela has been in this business for four years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Edith works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. Edith is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of charcoal to sell to customers.

Edith has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is 45 years old, married, and has five children, one of whom is still in school.

Ruby is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Ruby has been in this business for fifteen years now, and has borrowed ten times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ruby would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a resident of Tubigon, Bohol. She is 48 years old and a mother of three children, ages 15, 13 and 11 years old. Her husband supports them as a chess instructor, while Lina does a tailoring business. She has been doing this proficiently for 15 years to earn a living and to support her husband in providing for their children’s needs.

Lina’s main goal in life is to improve their livelihood to have enough money for their children. She wants them to finish their studies. That is why she is asking for a loan. She will use the money to buy thread and cloth.

Aside from this, she will also buy dried fish to sell. Definitely, Lina is engaged in a buying and selling (dried fish) business.

loans.use: to buy thread and cloth; also, to buy dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Xochitl Orlibeth

texts.es: Xochitl de 32 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia en compañía de sus padres a quienes apoya en todo lo necesario para el bienestar de ellos. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida brindando sus servicios como secretaria en la alcaldía municipal de su comunidad, lo que le ha permitido ir realizándole reparaciones a su vivienda para tener una mayor comodidad para su familia. Xochitl desea levantar un muro de retención el cual  brinde mayor seguridad para su familia ya que por el momento no cuenta con ningún muro y en temporada de lluvia se desborda la tierra, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, ladrillos, hierro, arena, mano de obra. Para realizar construcción de muro de contención en su vivienda.
texts.en: Xochitl is 32 years old and lives in her own home with her parents whom she supports with everything they need for their well-being. She is a hard-working woman who earns a living providing services as a secretary in the municipal government of her community, which has enabled her to make repairs on her home in order to have greater comfort for her family. Xochitl wishes to build a retention wall to provide greater security for her family as right now she doesn't have any kind of wall and during the rainy seasons the earth washes away. Therefore she seeks a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, bricks, iron, sand, and labor in order to build a containment wall at her home.

loans.use: to invest in cement, bricks, iron, sand, and labor in order to build a containment wall at her home.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a 48-year-old married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Wilma has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 23,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

Wilma has been in this business for 18 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Alejandra is 56 years old, and one of her children is still in school.

Alejandra has a buy-and-sell diesel business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional containers of diesel to sell.

Alejandra has been in this business for two years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional containers of diesel to sell.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is a 52-year-old married woman with four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Tita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

In the future, Tita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 43 years old and has three children who are in school.

Imelda has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. She has been in this business for two years. In the future, Imelda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Hog raising has been Cristina's way of making a living. She raised and sold hogs to cover the needs and expenses of the entire household.

She is a forty-year-old married woman and has five school-aged children. Her income would go for food and school expenses.

Cristina would like to increase the number of her livestock to boost her livelihood.

She has requested a loan to purchase a pig and feed. These could help enhance her source of income and slowly make her able to settle her obligation.

She is thankful for the funds and is determined to manage it successfully to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase a pig and feed.

loans.name: Nefo Rotes Group

texts.en:
Taroci (in the middle) and four other additional members are in the existing group named Nefo Rotes. They live close to each other.

Taroci, a 58-year-old woman, has a business of selling coconut oil and has been engaged in this for 15 years. She usually sells the product at the market, which is located about 25 km. from the village. Although it is quite far away from home, it does not stop her from making money. Due to the village being overgrown with many coconut trees, most people, including Taroci, produce the coconut oil. She usually uses 300 coconuts to produce 50 bottles of oil per week.

Even though there are many cooking oil products at the market, people still like to consume the traditional oil. Therefore, she intends to produce up to 100 bottles, but to make it happen, she needs the business capital. She was happy when a neighbor asked her to join in the Nefo Rotes Group. Along with four other women, Taroci requested a loan totaling IDR 12,500,000. She wants to spend her portion on more coconut and to pay for a rasping machine.

She believes the loan from Kiva via TLM will encourage them in improving their business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more coconut and her own coconut rasp machine.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 44 years old and has two children. With her two children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Merlyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy canned goods, biscuits, cigarettes, and other groceries. She has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Merlyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, biscuits, cigarettes, and other groceries.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Amelia works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock and fishing. Amelia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, canned goods, noodles and other snack foods for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Amelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish net, plastic wire, and gasoline.

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es:
Marta, es una mujer emprendedora, solo estudio hasta cuarto grado y día a día lucha por salir adelante junto a su familia, está casada y vive con su esposo y sus hijos, su esposo se dedica a la pesca y sus hijos estudian.

Marta, se dedica a la venta de ropa, este trabajo lo ha realiza desde hace poco tiempo.

Marta, necesita el préstamo para fortalecer su negocio con más mercadería (ropa), porque se acerca la temporada navideña y la afluencia de clientes es mayor. 

Marta, sueña con seguir trabajando para poder salir adelante y darle a sus hijos la oportunidad que estudien y se preparen academicamente.
texts.en: Marta is an enterprising woman. She only completed 4th grade and day after day she fights to help her family get ahead. She is married and lives with her husband and children. Her husband is a fisherman and her children study in school. Marta sells clothing, a business she recently started. Marta needs a loan to strengthen her business with more merchandise (clothing), because the Christmas season is approaching and her customers are more inclined to buy. Marta dreams of continuing working in order to support her family and provide her children the opportunity to study and prepare themselves academically.

loans.use: to strengthen her business with more merchandise (clothing).

loans.name: Rosa Antonia

texts.es:
Rosa, de 50 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudio hasta quinto grado, no continuo sus estudios debido a la falta de recursos económicos, está acompañada y junto a su pareja tiene 4 hijos, su pareja trabaja en un corral y también hace viajes en su carro.

Rosa, se dedica a la venta de películas y discos musicales, pero también vende antojos típicos, como tostadas, yuca, empanadas, nuégados, etc, estos los vende en la plaza pública de la comunidad desde hace varios años, este trabajo lo inicio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y para sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Rosa, necesita el préstamo para comprar más películas y discos musicales, porque se acerca la época de corta de caña y aprovecha para sacar su producto y venderlo con la gente que trabaja cortando caña.

Su sueño es, tener un local propio para ampliar más su negocio y poder vender más.
texts.en:
Rosa is 50 years old, a homemaker, and studied through the fifth grade. She did not continue her studies due to a lack of financial resources. She is married, and together with her partner she has four children. Her partner works in a corral, and he also makes trips with his cart.

Rosa earns a living selling videos and music CD's, and she also sells typical goodies such as tostadas, yuca, empanadas, nuegados [syrup coated dumplings] etc. She has sold these in the community's public plaza for many years. She started this job to help her husband with the home expenses, and to move her children ahead.

Rosa is requesting a loan to buy more movies and music CD's because the sugar cane harvest is approaching and she uses this time to get out her products and sell them to the people that work harvesting sugar cane. Her dream is to have her own location to expand her business and be able to sell more.

loans.use: to buy more movies and music CD's.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosario is 48 years old, and three of her children are in school.

Rosario has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stock of dried fish to sell.

In the future, Rosario would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is 56 years old, married, and the mother of seven children. She lives in Gango, Ozamis City where she has earned a living for many years by running a business, a retail store, selling home use products.

She has been a member of GDMPC since 2008. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy more items such as candies, milk, shampoo, soaps and other items to sell to her customers.

Merly plans to use the additional revenue she earns from this loan to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional varieties of grocery goods to resell.

loans.name: Eutemia

texts.en:
Eutemia is 55 years old and married with six children. With four children in school, Eutemia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

Eutemia has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 40 years old and has two children who are in school.

Ailyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy meat, hotdogs, edibles, etc. to use for her food vending. She has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Ailyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy meat, hotdogs, edibles, etc. to used for her food vending.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 54 years old and has three children who are currently in school. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Erlinda has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. She has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Expectacion

texts.en: Expectacion is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Expectacion is 54 years old and has two children who are still in school. Expectacion has a direct selling business in the Philippines. Expectacion requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional products of Avon, Natasha and personal care collection products to sell. Expectacion has been in this business for 12 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional products of Avon, Natasha, MSE and personal care collection products to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 33 years old and married with six children, three of whom are still in school. Gina works very hard to provide for them. Gina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, canned goods, noodles and other snack foods. Gina has been in this business for four years.

In the future Gina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, canned goods, noodles and other snack foods

loans.name: Marvin Ivan

texts.es:
Marvin, de 31 años de edad, está casado y vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, no estudio, pero eso no le impide trabajar para poder sacar a su familia adelante.

Marvin, se dedica a la pesca desde hace 17 años y a traves de este trabajo genera los ingresos necesarios para su familia. 

Marvin, necesita el préstamo para comprar mariscos y de esa manera hacer crecer su negocio.

Sus sueños a futuro son, seguir con su negocio y seguir obteniendo buenos resultados.
texts.en: Marvin is 31 years old, married, and lives with his wife and two children. He didn't go to school, but this hasn't impeded his work in order to be able to help his family get ahead. Marvin is a fisherman, work he has done for 17 years. Through this work he generates the necessary income for his family. Marvin needs a loan to buy seafood and in this way grow his business. His future dreams are to continue with his business and continue getting good results.

loans.use: to buy seafood and in this way grow his business.

loans.name: Epifanio

texts.en:
Epifanio is a hardworking man, who operates a habal-habal (motorcycle) transportation service. He earns a fee for a particular ride. He is a 47-year-old, married man. He has three children, and one is still attending school. He also raises hogs, and does farming as well, to meet the family's needs. He resides in the town of Pilar.

He has insufficient funds to expand his livelihood. That is why he joined CEVI, to avail a loan. Epifanio wants to buy tires, fuel, and farm maintenance like fertilizer and pig feed. In that way, his farm will produce a bountiful harvest and raise quality hogs. In the future, he is hoping that he will become successful in his project, to improve the family’s living condition and also finance the schooling of his child.

loans.use: to buy tires, fuel, and farm maintenance like fertilizer and pig feed.

loans.name: Ethelinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Ethelinda works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tricycle transport.

Ethelinda is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy a variety of vegetables to sell for her business buying and selling vegetables.

Ethelinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Assion

texts.fr: Assion est une femme mariée âgée de 33 ans qui vit à Baguida. Ayant deux enfants à charge,Assion s’efforce  pour gagner son revenu en revendant les produits alimentaires. Pour s’approvisionner Assion se rend quatre fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des cartons de spaghettis et de tomates, Assion nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera suite à une bonne vente, Assion va pouvoir aider son mari dans les charges quotidiennes de la famille et favoriser une bonne éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Assion, age 33, is a married mother to 2 dependent children. She lives in Baguida. Assion strives to earn a living as a reseller of grocery products. She stocks up 4 times per month at the market.

Assion is seeking this loan to purchase spaghetti and tomatoes. Good sales will yield a profit that she will use to help her husband with the family's day-to-day expenses and to support their children's education.

loans.use: to buy 4 boxes of spaghetti and 5 cartons of tomatoes.

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
Amor is 25-years-old, with one child. Amor works very hard to provide for them.

Amor runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like sacks of rice, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Amor has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Amor would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like sacks of rice, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en:
Magdalene is a 54-year-old married woman with three children. She lives in a rural community outside Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands.

She owns and operates a small general store selling food items such as canned food, rice, noodles, tea and snacks, and she has been doing this for three years.

Magdalene needs a loan to buy a large deep freezer to assist her in running the business. She hopes to cover her family's weekly expenses with the profits she makes with her business.

She has been a SPBD member since 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a large deep freezer for her general store.

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:
Basilisa, 65 years old, is a married woman and has a 15-year-old child. They live in a municipality of Catigbian in Bohol, Philippines. For the past 14 years, this woman has run her farm where she grows vegetable plants. It is very important for her that this business can last in time, because it is the financial support for her family.

With this, she is asking for a loan to buy vegetable seeds (specifically a bitter gourd known as “ampalaya” or “paliya” in locals), medicines and fertilizer to enhance the growth of her plants. In the future, she wants to improve her business for their sustainability.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds (specifically a bitter gourd known as “ampalaya” or “paliya” in locals), medicines and fertilizer.

loans.name: Madeliene

texts.en:
Madeliene is a woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 29 years old and has two children who are in school. She has a buy-and-sell mineral business in the Philippines.

Madeliene has requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional containers of mineral to sell. She has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Madeliene would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional containers of mineral to sell.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
As a parent of four children, Elvie works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fruit vending. Elvie is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Elvie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre muy trabajador, él cuenta que con la ayuda del préstamo pudo comprar sus semillas, fertilizantes y pagó la mano de obra de su cultivo de maíz, a Dios gracias obtuvo una buena cosecha y en su mercado regional lo pudo vender, esto le dejo una bonita ganancia, con este logro él está muy contento pero no conforme pues ahora nuevamente se le presenta la necesidad de remodelar su casa porque  ya se encuentra en muy malas condiciones, por esa razón acude a un nuevo crédito para la compra de cemento, cal y arena.
Su más grande sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel is a very hard working man. He states that with the help of the loan, he was able to buy his seeds and fertilizers, and he payed the workers of his corn crop. He thanks God that he had a good harvest and was able to sell it at his regional market. This left Manuel with a nice profit and he is very happy, but not satisfied since now, once again, he is presented with the necessity to remodel his house because it is in very bad condition. For this reason Manuel is turning to a new loan to buy cement, lime, and sand.

His biggest dream is to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like cement, lime, and sand.

loans.name: Milva

texts.en:
Milva is 33-years-old and married with two children. With two children in school, Milva works very hard to provide for them.

Milva runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy eggs, coffee, soft drinks, biscuits, and other groceries. Milva has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Milva would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy eggs, coffee, soft drinks, biscuits, and other groceries.

loans.name: Hezel

texts.en:
Hezel is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 44 years old and has two children who are still in school. She has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Hezel has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase fishing materials such as fish net, gasoline for her boat, and maintenance for her business. Hezel has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials such as fish net, gasoline for her boat, and maintenance for her business.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Imelda works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.

Imelda is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of dried coconut meat to sell. Imelda has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 22-years-old and single with one child. Lorena works very hard to provide for them.

Lorena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, canned goods, noodles and other snack foods.

Lorena has been in this business for 4 years. In the future Lorena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, canned goods, noodles and other snack foods

loans.name: Aida

texts.ru: Аида успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав средства по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто ей помог в финансировании. Сегодня в хозяйстве Аиды есть земельный участок мерою 1,42 Га, где она выращивает люцерну и пшеницу для реализации, также есть 10 коров, 20 овец и 2 лошади. Ежемесячный доход Аиды составляет в среднем 30,000 сомов (KGS). Аида очень трудолюбива и ответственна. Она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS), на который она купит 3 бычков для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита позволят Аиде увеличить ее хозяйство.
texts.en:
Aida successfully repaid her loan, using it for its designated purpose. She is thankful to Kiva and to everyone who helped with her financing.

Currently, Aida has a farm with a plot of land measuring 1.42 hectares where she grows alfalfa and wheat for resale. She also has 10 cows, 20 sheep, and 2 horses. Aida's monthly income averages 30,000 som (KGS). Aida is very hard-working and responsible.

Aida has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 130,000 som (KGS) to buy 3 steers for fattening and resale. Aida will use the income from her loan to enlarge her farm.

loans.use: to purchase three steers to fatten and resell.

loans.name: Thao's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thao, born in 1987, is the Kinh ethnic majority and joined the program in January 2013. She is living with her husband and her lovely daughter in Mai Son district, son La province. Her family’s main occupation is small trading. Because there are so many competitive shops around, the income is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and they have saved a small amount.

She wants to invest in raising chickens to get more income for the family, but the saved amount is not enough. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose. She hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively and well in breeding, and thanks to that loan amount it will help to better improve the family’s living standards. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI.

loans.use: to invest in raising chickens

loans.name: Adelino

texts.en:
Adelino has build his home a few years ago, with his own working capital, and until now his house has been completed. Now he plans to tile the ceramic inside his home. But his money is not enough to buy more materials.

So now he is requesting a loan of $ 1,000.00 from the Tuba Rai Metin to buy more materials like cement, sand, ceramic, cement tiles. He is very happy with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin for his, because with this loan can help him to complete his house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, ceramic, cement tiles.

loans.name: Emma

texts.es:
Emma es una mujer de 38 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 15 años y una hija de 3 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es paciente, buena oyente y muy solidaria. Su negocio lo realiza en la provincia ‘vichaya’ área rural, caracterizado por ser la zona productora de estuco, los pobladores en su mayoría se dedican a la explotación de estuco y cal, de clima frio con una temperatura máxima de 12 grados centígrados.
Emma es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado y su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica a la extracción de rocas y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto construido de adobe y ladrillo con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que cuenta con energía eléctrica no tiene agua potable ni alcantarillado porque los servicios no llegaron al lugar. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional como; ‘p'esque’ a base de quinua cocida en agua y acompañada con leche, queso o tal vez carne, es la comida favorita de los pobladores, músicos, escritores, y hasta albañiles, “Cuando era niña era muy habitual pasar las tardes con mi abuela, acompañándola y ayudándola en la cocina, era la cocinera de la familia, me transmitió su pasión por la cocina, me pasó sus tips y algunas de sus recetas…” comenta. Su negocio es exitoso porque los pobladores consumen su comida a diario. La ventaja  de su negocio es que los insumos son propios del lugar, la desventaja es la falta de un horno para cocinar. Su sueño es vivir en la ciudad, ella desea construir un horno para cocinar. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Emma solicita un préstamo para construir un horno para cocinar comida tradicional en el campo.
texts.en:
Emma is a 38-year-old woman. She is married and has two sons who are 13 and 15 years old, and a daughter who is 3. She runs a business selling food. Emma is patient, a good listener, and very loyal. Her business is located in the "vichaya" province, a rural area which is known as the stucco production zone. For the most part, the residents of this area work in stucco and lime mines. The climate is cool, with a maximum temperature of 12 degrees Centigrade.
Emma has a dark complexion and long black hair which she braids. She wears traditional clothing (a hat, poncho and skirt). Her native language is Aymará, which she speaks at home, and she speaks Spanish in day-to-day life. She shares her life with her husband, who works in a quarry, and with their children, who are in school. They live in a room made of adobe and brick with a corrugated iron roof and an earthen floor which has electricity but doesn't have water or plumbing because they don't have those utilities in their area.
Emma sells traditional food such as "p'esque" which is quinoa cooked in water and served with milk, cheese or meat and which is the favorite food of the people, musicians, writers and even bricklayers. 
"When I was young it was very typical for me to spend my afternoons with my grandmother, accompanying her and helping her in the kitchen. She was the cook of the family and she passed on her passion for the kitchen. She gave me her tips and some of her recipes" says Emma. Her business is successful because the people of her community eat her food daily. The advantage of her business is that the ingredients come from nearby; the disadvantage is the lack of an oven to cook in. 
Emma's dream is to live in the city and she hopes to build an oven to cook in. She is in the first loan cycle with this institution, after being in business for 5 years. 
For these reasons, Emma requests a loan to build an oven to prepare traditional food in the countryside.

loans.use: to construct a clay oven to prepare traditional food.
